original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir ni bstan bcos las /
translated: Here in this Bhagavatī, the treatise should be stated with other words:

original: gzugs la sogs pa rlom med pa //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rlom med pa //
translated: “Without conceit about form, etc.,

original: rnam brgyad de yi mnyam pa nyid /🔽ces bya tshig gzhan du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam brgyad de yi mnyam pa nyid / ces bya tshig gzhan du brjod par bya'o //
translated: there are eight equalities of that.”

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi dang / gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi ni sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //🔽de yang de bas na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi dang / gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi ni sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to // de yang de bas na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The four kinds of conceptual thoughts about the apprehending subject and the four kinds of conceptual thoughts about the apprehended object are the meaning of “equality of application.”

original: spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, that is stated from “Therefore” up to “one practices.”

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad brag ca lta bu de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir chos thams cad brag ca lta bu de'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means “because all phenomena are like an echo.”

original: de la zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la'o //
translated: “There” means “in all phenomena.”

original: rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: “One does not conceive” means “one does not cling to things.”

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba la'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba la'o //
translated: “One does not see” means “one does not see the apprehended object.”

original: mi shes pa ni gzungs ba la'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni gzungs ba la'o //
translated: “One does not know” means “one does not apprehend.”

original: kun tu mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa la ste /
analyzed: kun tu mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa la ste /
translated: “One does not fully know” means “one does not conceptualize.”

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam @108b par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam @108b par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four conceptualizations of the apprehended are as follows.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi ni chos de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi ni chos de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The four conceptualizations of the apprehended are stated from “those phenomena” and so on.

original: med ces bya ba ni yod par rlom sems med pa'o //
analyzed: med ces bya ba ni yod par rlom sems med pa'o //
translated: “ Do not exist” means not conceiving of them as existing.

original: yang dag par mi snang zhes bya ba ni mthong la'o //
analyzed: yang dag par mi snang zhes bya ba ni mthong la'o //
translated: “ Do not appear” means not seeing them.

original: yang dag par med ces zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par med ces zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: “ Do not exist” means not apprehending them.

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
translated: “ Are not observed” means not conceptualizing them.

original: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog pa med pa rnam pa brgyad kyis so //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog pa med pa rnam pa brgyad kyis so //
translated: Thus, it is by means of these eight nonconceptualizations of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la spyod pa'o //
translated: “ Abiding” means engaging with all phenomena.

original: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “ What happens by that?” means “slowly” and so on.

original: rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: rtogs par sla'o //
translated: It is easy to understand.

original: de ni sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: That is the sameness of application.

original: 'di'i sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid kyi zhar la /
analyzed: 'di'i sbyor ba'i mnyam pa nyid kyi zhar la /
translated: In this context of the sameness of application,

original: chos ston pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyang bstan te /
analyzed: chos ston pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyang bstan te /
translated: the sameness of teaching the Dharma is also taught.

original: mngon par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: mngon par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: In order to make them fully believe, then, through the Buddha's power...🔽

original: le'u rdzogs kyi bar gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: le'u rdzogs kyi bar gyis gsungs te /
translated: In order to make it fully believable, then, from “through the power of the Buddha” up to the end of the chapter, it is said.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams na zhes bya ba ni mi mjed 'di nyid na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams na zhes bya ba ni mi mjed 'di nyid na /
translated: “In the world systems” means in this very Endurance.

original: sngas rgyas stong zhes bya ba ni gang mi mjed 'di nyid du bskal pa bzang po 'di la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: sngas rgyas stong zhes bya ba ni gang mi mjed 'di nyid du bskal pa bzang po 'di la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: “Ten thousand buddhas” means those who fully awakened to perfect buddhahood in this very Endurance in this Fortunate Eon.

original: de la dang po log par dad sel dang / gser thub dang / 'od srung dang / sh'akya thub pa bzhi mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de la dang po log par dad sel dang / gser thub dang / 'od srung dang / sh'akya thub pa bzhi mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Among them, the first four were Krakucchanda, Kanakamuni, Kāśyapa, and Śākyamuni.

original: de dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ston pa la mnyam pa nyid du ston pa'i phyir ming 'di dag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ston pa la mnyam pa nyid du ston pa'i phyir ming 'di dag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to show that they are the same in teaching omniscience, it says “those with the same name” and so on.

original: byams pa yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byams pa yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Maitreya” and so on.

original: yang gi sgra ni de'i phyi ma gzhan dgu brgya dgu bcu rtsa lnga yang bsdus te /
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni de'i phyi ma gzhan dgu brgya dgu bcu rtsa lnga yang bsdus te /
translated: The word “and” includes the other nine hundred and ninety-five after him.

original: 'di nyid bstan pa mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan pa mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: This is the equality of the teaching.

original: gtsor rnam par dag pa ston cing brjod pa'i le'u ni rnam par dag pa'i le'u'o //
analyzed: gtsor rnam par dag pa ston cing brjod pa'i le'u ni rnam par dag pa'i le'u'o //
translated: The chapter that primarily teaches and describes purity is the chapter on purity.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
translated: Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines

original: slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u brgyad pa'o /
translated: by Master Ratnākaraśānti, called Essence of the Most Sublime

original: // / le'u brgyad par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ston ston pa'i mnyam pa nyid bstan nas ;
analyzed: // / le'u brgyad par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ston ston pa'i mnyam pa nyid bstan nas ;
translated: In the eighth chapter, having taught the equality of the teaching of omniscience,

original: 'di nyid du bskal pa bzang po'i chos ston pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid du bskal pa bzang po'i chos ston pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in this very chapter, in order to clarify the teaching of the Dharma of the Good Eon,

original: le'u 'dir rab 'byor gyis gang bshad pa de /
analyzed: le'u 'dir rab 'byor gyis gang bshad pa de /
translated: what Subhūti explained in this chapter

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽ming tsam mo zhes bya ba ni ming yin gyi don ma yin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // ming tsam mo zhes bya ba ni ming yin gyi don ma yin te /
translated: is stated in the passage beginning with Then the Blessed One said to Subhūti...🔽Mere name means it is a name, not a meaning.

original: ming dang don ni 'brel ba med pa nyid @109a * //
analyzed: ming dang don ni 'brel ba med pa nyid @109a * //
translated: Because there is no connection between name and meaning,

original: kyis de dag las don rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: kyis de dag las don rtogs pa med do //
translated: there is no understanding of the meaning from them.

original: gzhan du na bdag nyid ni lha yin no zhes smras na /
analyzed: gzhan du na bdag nyid ni lha yin no zhes smras na /
translated: Otherwise, if one were to say, “The self is a god,”

original: lha nyid du 'gyur ba thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha nyid du 'gyur ba thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that the self would be a god.

original: de lta mod kyi ming tsam na yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ming tsam na yod do zhe na /
translated: “ But it exists merely in name.”

original: de'i phyir ming de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ming de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: To that he says, “That name too,” and so on.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni ming tsam nyid kyis so ;
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni ming tsam nyid kyis so ;
translated: “ This” refers to the mere name.

original: / mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni don gyis stong pa'i sgra la mi rigs pa'i ro //
analyzed: / mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni don gyis stong pa'i sgra la mi rigs pa'i ro //
translated: “ Nonapprehension” means that it is not tenable for a sound to be empty of meaning.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dag gis dngos po zhes bya ba ni brjod par byed pa brjod par bya ba'i don dang bcas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dag gis dngos po zhes bya ba ni brjod par byed pa brjod par bya ba'i don dang bcas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ The thing” refers to the expression, which is to say, the meaning of what is to be expressed.

original: don dang bcas kyang rung don med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: don dang bcas kyang rung don med kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether it has meaning or not,

original: ming de nyid mi rigs te med par grub bo //
analyzed: ming de nyid mi rigs te med par grub bo //
translated: that name is not tenable, and so it is established as nonexistent.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yod do zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yod do zhe na /
translated: “ But the perfection of wisdom exists.”

original: de yang ma mchis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de yang ma mchis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: To that he says, “That too does not exist.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi dmigs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi dmigs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “ Because it is not apprehended,” he says.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: ji ltar de mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar de mi dmigs she na /
translated: How is that non-apprehension?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ming dang don ni med de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ming dang don ni med de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the perfection of wisdom, there is no name and no referent, because they are incompatible with the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la de'i don kyang med de /
analyzed: de la de'i don kyang med de /
translated: There is no referent there.

original: don dang 'brel ba med pa'i sgra las ni don rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: don dang 'brel ba med pa'i sgra las ni don rtogs pa med de /
translated: From a word that is not related to a referent, there is no apprehension of a referent.

original: gal te dngos po dang 'grel ba med pa'i phyir don ni med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po dang 'grel ba med pa'i phyir don ni med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the referent does not exist because it is not related to the thing,

original: de ltar na sgra las dngos po gos par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na sgra las dngos po gos par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the word would not be related to the thing.

original: don gyi dngos po la yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gyi dngos po la yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the referent would not be engaged in the thing.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ming dang don med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ming dang don med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is without name and referent.

original: don mi dmigs pa ni shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: don mi dmigs pa ni shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of the referent is the non-apprehension of the perfection of wisdom.🔽Therefore, in order to teach the sameness of these two, it is said:

original: de'i phyir 'di gnyis mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ming ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gnyis mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ming ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Just as the name, just as the referent...

original: ji ltar 'di gnyis mnyam pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di gnyis mnyam pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How are these two the same?

original: de'i phyir chos 'di gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos 'di gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “These two dharmas…”

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du bsgrub te /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du bsgrub te /
translated: Thus, having established the perfection of wisdom,

original: ston pa mnyam pa nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa mnyam pa nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the teacher clarifies their sameness.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Why is it so?”

original: ci'i slad du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: ci'i slad du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: “Why” means by what aspect, having fully awakened,

original: ming 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ming 'di nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: he will explain with “this very name…” and so on.

original: gang gis kyang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gang gis kyang ma yin zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that it is not by anything at all.

original: med pa la ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: med pa la ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that it is not possible to fully awaken to what does not exist.

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis lan gsungs te /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bcom ldan 'das kyis lan gsungs te /
translated: “Having thus been requested…” and so on explains the Blessed One’s reply.

original: @109b ji ltar khyod kyis chos rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa de kho na bzhin du /
analyzed: @109b ji ltar khyod kyis chos rnams stong pa nyid du bstan pa de kho na bzhin du /
translated: Just as you have taught that phenomena are emptiness,🔽you will teach that just as it is after you fully awaken to perfect buddhahood.

original: de mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don to //
analyzed: de mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the term “thus.”

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Therefore, in terms of the path of seeing,

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la//
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la//
translated: Regarding the truths of suffering and so on,🔽the nature of Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge,

original: chos shes rjes su shes bzod dang // shes pa'i skad cig bdag nyid 'di //
analyzed: chos shes rjes su shes bzod dang // shes pa'i skad cig bdag nyid 'di //
translated: acceptance, and knowledge is

original: kun shes tshul la mthong ba'i lam //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: kun shes tshul la mthong ba'i lam // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the path of seeing in the system of complete knowledge.

original: 'di ni kun shes pa'i tshul la mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni kun shes pa'i tshul la mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid do //
translated: This is the path of seeing in the system of complete knowledge, which has the nature of sixteen moments.

original: gang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la /
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la /
translated: Regarding the truths of suffering and so on,

original: so sor skad cig ma bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: so sor skad cig ma bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: it has the nature of four moments for each.

original: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa ni chos dang / rjes su bzod pa dang shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa ni chos dang / rjes su bzod pa dang shes pa'o //
translated: Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge are Dharma acceptance and knowledge.

original: de nyid kyi skad cig ma ni de'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi skad cig ma ni de'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The moment of that is its nature.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: They are the perseverance for the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering, the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering, and the subsequent knowledge with regard to suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the truths of origin, cessation, and path.

original: de nyid ni skad cig ma bcu drug ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni skad cig ma bcu drug ste /
translated: They are the sixteen moments.

original: go rims bzhin du bstan bcos las //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du bstan bcos las //
translated: As it says in the treatise:

original: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
analyzed: gzugs rtag ma yin mi rtag min //
translated: Form is not permanent and not impermanent.🔽It is beyond extremes, pure,🔽unproduced, unceasing, and so forth.🔽It is like space, free from attachment,🔽free from grasping,

original: mtha' las 'das dang rnam dag dang // ma skyes ma 'gags la sogs dang // mkha' 'dra chags pa spangs pa dang // yongs su 'dzin las grol ba dang // ngo bo nyid kyis brjod med dang // gang phyir 'di'i don brjod pa yis //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das dang rnam dag dang // ma skyes ma 'gags la sogs dang // mkha' 'dra chags pa spangs pa dang // yongs su 'dzin las grol ba dang // ngo bo nyid kyis brjod med dang // gang phyir 'di'i don brjod pa yis //
translated: and inexpressible by nature.🔽Because its meaning cannot be given to others by expressing it,

original: gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang // dmigs pa med par byed pa dang // shin tu rnam dag nad mi 'byung //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang // dmigs pa med par byed pa dang // shin tu rnam dag nad mi 'byung //
translated: it is free from reference points,🔽and it is utterly pure, free from arising.

original: ngan song chad dang 'bras bu ni ;
analyzed: ngan song chad dang 'bras bu ni ;
translated: The result of the severance of the lower realms

original: / mngon du byas la mi rtog nyid //
analyzed: / mngon du byas la mi rtog nyid //
translated: is the actualization of non-conceptuality.🔽The non-arising of consciousness🔽in regard to the sign, the signless,

original: mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel dang // dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la //🔽shes pa skye ba med pa ni //
analyzed: mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel dang // dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la // shes pa skye ba med pa ni //
translated: the real, the nominal, and both,

original: kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
analyzed: kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
translated: is the moment of complete understanding.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽de la / rtag pa ma yin mi rtag min //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / de la / rtag pa ma yin mi rtag min //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dang po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma dang po'o //
translated: Therein, “neither permanent nor impermanent” is the first moment.

original: mtha' las 'das pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: “Beyond extremes” is “utterly pure,” which is the second.

original: rnam par dag pa ni yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ste gsum pa'o //
translated: “Pure” is “thoroughly pure,” which is the third.

original: ma skes pa dang ma 'gags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: ma skes pa dang ma 'gags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: “Unborn and unceasing” and so forth is the fourth.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: “Like space” is the fifth.

original: chags pa spangs pa zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa spangs pa zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
translated: “Free from attachment” is the sixth.

original: @110a * // yongs su 'dzin pa las grol ba zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: @110a * // yongs su 'dzin pa las grol ba zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
translated: “Liberated from grasping” is the seventh.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis brjod du med pa zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis brjod du med pa zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: “Inconceivable by nature” is the eighth.

original: brjod du med pa dang grol ba zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: brjod du med pa dang grol ba zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: “Inconceivable” and “liberated” are the ninth.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang phyir 'di'i gzhan dag la sbyin du med pa zhes bya ba de ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: gang phyir 'di'i gzhan dag la sbyin du med pa zhes bya ba de ni dgu pa'o //
translated: “Since it cannot be given to others,” is the ninth.

original: dmigs pa med par nyed pa ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par nyed pa ni bcu pa'o //
translated: “Not conceptualizing” is the tenth.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes ba ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes ba ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: “Very pure” is the eleventh.

original: nad mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o //🔽ngan song chad pa dang mi rtog pa zhes bya ba la ngan song chad pa ni bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: nad mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o // ngan song chad pa dang mi rtog pa zhes bya ba la ngan song chad pa ni bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: “Not arising” is the twelfth.

original: mi rtog pa ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtog pa ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: “Severing bad migrations” and “nonconceptual” are the thirteenth and fourteenth.

original: 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba rtogs pa dang / mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel ba ni bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba rtogs pa dang / mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel ba ni bco lnga pa'o //
translated: “Manifesting the result” and “unconnected with signs” are the fifteenth.

original: dngos po dang ming gnyis la shes pa skye ba med pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po dang ming gnyis la shes pa skye ba med pa ni /
translated: “The nonarising of consciousness in relation to things and names” is the sixteenth.

original: de dag ni kun shes pa nyid kyis bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug go //
analyzed: de dag ni kun shes pa nyid kyis bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma bcu drug go //
translated: These are the sixteen moments of the path of seeing, which are the self-consecration of the knowledge of all things.

original: de la dang 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skad cig ma gnyis gsungs te ;🔽gzugs la sogs pa rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de la dang 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skad cig ma gnyis gsungs te ; gzugs la sogs pa rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: In this regard, the second and third moments are indicated by “in this way” and so forth.

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: Form and so forth are neither permanent nor impermanent,

original: bcings pa yang ma yin grol ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bcings pa yang ma yin grol ba yang ma yin te /
translated: neither bound nor liberated.

original: rang nyid med pa de la ni rtag pa la sogs pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: rang nyid med pa de la ni rtag pa la sogs pa mi rigs te /
translated: Since they do not exist in themselves, permanence and so forth are not tenable.

original: de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: This is the acceptance of the knowledge of the teaching of suffering.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni rtag tu shin tu rnam par dag pa de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni rtag tu shin tu rnam par dag pa de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
translated: Form and so forth are always completely pure. This is the knowledge of the teaching of suffering.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba nas yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni skad cig ma gsum pa ste /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba nas yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni skad cig ma gsum pa ste /
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Subhūti, “Excellent, excellent, Subhūti!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is completely pure because all phenomena are completely pure.

original: de ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'i bzod pa'o ;
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa'i bzod pa'o ;
translated: That is the acquiescence in the knowledge of the path of suffering.

original: / rab 'byor gzugs skye ba med pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: / rab 'byor gzugs skye ba med pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, the non-production of form, etc.,

original: yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bzhi pa ste /🔽de yang de dag rnam par dag pas skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bzhi pa ste / de yang de dag rnam par dag pas skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: up to the purity of the perfection of wisdom, is the fourth.

original: de ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'o//
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'o//
translated: And that is the purity of the knowledge of the path of suffering.

original: rab 'byor nam mkha' zhes bya ba nas yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni lnga pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor nam mkha' zhes bya ba nas yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni lnga pa ste /
translated: Subhuti, space, etc., up to the purity of the perfection of wisdom, is the fifth.

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar skye ba la sogs pa med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar skye ba la sogs pa med de /
translated: All dharmas are like space, without production, etc.

original: nam mkha' ltar rnam par dag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar rnam par dag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is pure like space, because it is pure like space.

original: de ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod @110b pa'o ;
analyzed: de ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod @110b pa'o ;
translated: That is the acquiescence in the knowledge of the path of the origin of suffering.

original: / rab 'byor gzugs gos pa med pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: / rab 'byor gzugs gos pa med pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, the non-defilement of form, etc.,🔽up to the purity of the perfection of wisdom, is the sixth.

original: yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'o bar gyis ni drug pa dang bdun pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'o bar gyis ni drug pa dang bdun pa ste /
translated: The sixth and seventh are indicated by the words “pure” and “very pure”.

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar gos pa med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar gos pa med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are like space, unstained.

original: nam mkha' ltar gos pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar gos pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Because they are like space, unstained, the perfection of wisdom is pure.

original: de ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'o //🔽chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni kun 'byung la chos shes pa'o // chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the knowledge of the Dharma with regard to the origin.🔽All phenomena are like space, ungraspable.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: Because they are like space, ungraspable, the perfection of wisdom is pure.

original: de ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: This is the acceptance of subsequent knowledge with regard to the origin.

original: nam mkha' dang brag ca zhes bya ba nas yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa bstan te /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang brag ca zhes bya ba nas yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni brgyad pa dang dgu pa dang bcu pa bstan te /
translated: The eighth, ninth, and tenth are indicated by the words “like space”, “like an echo”, up to “pure”.

original: tshig tu med pa dang / brjod du med pa ni ji ltar brag ca ni ri dang / ri sul du nam mkha' ltar cung zad kyang brjod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: tshig tu med pa dang / brjod du med pa ni ji ltar brag ca ni ri dang / ri sul du nam mkha' ltar cung zad kyang brjod pa med pa'o //
translated: That which cannot be expressed and cannot be described is like an echo, which is like space in a mountain or a valley, not describing anything at all.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang nam mkha' ltar brjod du med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang nam mkha' ltar brjod du med pa ste /
translated: In the same way, all dharmas are inexpressible like space.

original: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: This is the purity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: This is the subsequent knowledge of the origin.

original: rtogs par byed pa ni brjod pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa ni brjod pa ste /
translated: The expression is the expression of the object.

original: brjod pa gang gis pha rol la don rtogs par byed pa ni brjod pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa gang gis pha rol la don rtogs par byed pa ni brjod pa'o //
translated: The expression by which one makes the object known to others is the expression.

original: brag ca ni nam mkha' ltar cung zad kyang brjod pa med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang nam mkha' ltar brjod du med pa des na shes rab kyis pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: brag ca ni nam mkha' ltar cung zad kyang brjod pa med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang nam mkha' ltar brjod du med pa des na shes rab kyis pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Just as an echo is inexpressible like space, in the same way all dharmas are inexpressible like space. Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is pure.

original: de ni 'gogs pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'gogs pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: This is the receptivity to the knowledge of the dharmas in the cessation.

original: gang mi dmigs pa de ni dmigs su med pa ste /
analyzed: gang mi dmigs pa de ni dmigs su med pa ste /
translated: What is not apprehended is not apprehended.

original: 'dir brag ca'i sgra ni sgra dang sgra brnyan gnyi ga la 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'dir brag ca'i sgra ni sgra dang sgra brnyan gnyi ga la 'jug ste /
translated: Here, the echo is used for both sound and echo,

original: 'di'i dbye ba ston par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i dbye ba ston par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not show their distinction.

original: tshig gi med pa yang yin la brjod du med pa yang yin zhes bsdu'o ;
analyzed: tshig gi med pa yang yin la brjod du med pa yang yin zhes bsdu'o ;
translated: The non-existence of words is also included in the inexpressibility.

original: / brag ca yang yin la tshig med pa yang yin brjod du med pa yang yin zhes gsum yang bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: / brag ca yang yin la tshig med pa yang yin brjod du med pa yang yin zhes gsum yang bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The echo is also included in the non-existence of words and the inexpressibility.

original: de dag kyang yin la dmigs pa yang yin zhes bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang yin la dmigs pa yang yin zhes bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The object is also included in the existence.

original: gang gi phyir nam mkha' yang de dag dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nam mkha' yang de dag dang 'dra ste /
translated: And because space is like that,

original: de ni mtshon cha sngo bsangs kyi bsdu ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni mtshon cha sngo bsangs kyi bsdu ba bzhin no //
translated: it is included in the blue sword.

original: de dag gi dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: That is its nature.

original: des yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: des yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: It is purified by that,

original: de'i phyir ji ltar nam mkha' ni cang zad kyang dmigs su med pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang dmigs su med na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar nam mkha' ni cang zad kyang dmigs su med pa nyid yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang dmigs su med na /
translated: therefore, just as space is nothing whatsoever and is not apprehended, so all dharmas are not apprehended.

original: des nam mkha' ltar dmigs su med pas yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: des nam mkha' ltar dmigs su med pas yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is purified by being like space and not apprehended.

original: de ni 'gogs pa la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'gogs pa la chos shes pa'o //
translated: That is the knowledge of dharmas in relation to cessation.

original: rab 'byor zhes bya @111a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya @111a * //
translated: Subhūti!

original: ba nas pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcu gcig pa bstan te /
analyzed: ba nas pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcu gcig pa bstan te /
translated: The eleventh is indicated by the passage beginning “The purity of the perfections” and ending “the purity of the perfections.”

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyis gos pa ni nye bar gos pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyis gos pa ni nye bar gos pa'o //
translated: The defilement of the defiled dharmas is defilement.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos kyis mgos pa ni gos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos kyis mgos pa ni gos pa med pa'o //
translated: The purity of the purified dharmas is non-defilement.

original: nye bar gos pa dang gos pa med pa ni nye bar gos pa dang gos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar gos pa dang gos pa med pa ni nye bar gos pa dang gos pa med pa'o //
translated: The defilement and non-defilement of those is defilement and non-defilement.

original: de dag kyang yin la chos kyang yin pas na chos de dag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang yin la chos kyang yin pas na chos de dag go //
translated: And since they are dharmas, they are those dharmas.

original: chos kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas chos thams cad do //
analyzed: chos kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas chos thams cad do //
translated: And since they are all dharmas, they are all dharmas.

original: de dag gis gos pa med pa ni gos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis gos pa med pa ni gos pa med pa'o //
translated: The non-defilement of those is non-defilement.

original: gnyi ga dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The non-apprehension of both is non-apprehension.

original: gnyi ga mi dmigs pa ni gnyi ga yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga mi dmigs pa ni gnyi ga yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The non-apprehension of both is the purity of both.

original: de dag ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: That is the acquiescence in the subsequent cognition of cessation.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said this, and so on up to

original: dus mi bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcu gnyis pa bstan te /
analyzed: dus mi bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcu gnyis pa bstan te /
translated: The twelfth is indicated by the passage up to “I will not do it at the wrong time.

original: gang gi phyir rnyed pa legs par rnyed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnyed pa legs par rnyed pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the acquisition is well acquired?

original: rna lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rna lam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning “in the ear” explains this.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: “At the wrong time” means at the time of death.

original: de ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'o //🔽de dag la lha'i bu zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ni 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'o // de dag la lha'i bu zhes bya ba nas /
translated: This is the subsequent knowledge of cessation.

original: dgra je lji bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcu gsum pa bstan te /
analyzed: dgra je lji bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcu gsum pa bstan te /
translated: The passage beginning “the gods” up to “the enemy is weakened” indicates the thirteenth.

original: yum chen mo dag la ni rnam par dbye ba bdun par brjod la /
analyzed: yum chen mo dag la ni rnam par dbye ba bdun par brjod la /
translated: In the great mothers, the seventh division is mentioned.

original: 'dir gnyis par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gnyis par byas pa yin te /
translated: Here, it is made the second.

original: de yang shin tu dang ba dang ldan na gnyis pa zhes bya bar kha cig 'dod do //🔽dus dang dngos po dang las dang 'gro ba na ni las ma yin yang las kyi ming can te /
analyzed: de yang shin tu dang ba dang ldan na gnyis pa zhes bya bar kha cig 'dod do // dus dang dngos po dang las dang 'gro ba na ni las ma yin yang las kyi ming can te /
translated: Some assert that if one possesses great clarity, it is called the second.🔽When it is time, it is not an action, but it has the name of an action.

original: las ma yin yang las kyi ming du 'gro'o zhes la la dag 'dod do //
analyzed: las ma yin yang las kyi ming du 'gro'o zhes la la dag 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that even though it is not an action, it goes by the name of an action.

original: de bas kyang zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i rin po che bsrung bas kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bas kyang zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i rin po che bsrung bas kyang ngo //
translated: And even more than that means even more than protecting the unsurpassed jewel.

original: rin po che chen po 'di nyid bsrung ba chen po yin gyi /
analyzed: rin po che chen po 'di nyid bsrung ba chen po yin gyi /
translated: This very great jewel is the great protection.

original: 'di las gzhan pa'i bsrung ba ni med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pa'i bsrung ba ni med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn't it that there is no protection other than this?

original: de'i phyir yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, Subhūti, and so on.

original: gal te yang rin po che chen po de lta yin pa yang gi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: gal te yang rin po che chen po de lta yin pa yang gi sgra'i don to //
translated: Even if that great jewel is so, the meaning of the word and is...

original: dgra ni phyir rgol ba'o //
analyzed: dgra ni phyir rgol ba'o //
translated: An enemy is an adversary.

original: ci tsam du gces pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci tsam du gces pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As much as is cherished means...

original: ji ltar khyad par du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar khyad par du gyur pa'o //
translated: How special it is!

original: 'dir bsod nams khyad par du gyur pa bstan pas ni ngan song chad par don gyis bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir bsod nams khyad par du gyur pa bstan pas ni ngan song chad par don gyis bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, by teaching the special merit, the severance of the lower realms is implicitly taught.

original: de ni lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //🔽rab 'byor 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de ni lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o // rab 'byor 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: That is the acceptance of the knowledge of the dharmas on the path.

original: med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcu bzhi pa bstan te /
analyzed: med cing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bcu bzhi pa bstan te /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this, and so on, up to it does not exist and is not apprehended - this teaches the fourteenth...

original: ci'i phyir bla na med pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bla na med pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called unsurpassed?

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i @111b phyir zhugs par gyur pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i @111b phyir zhugs par gyur pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “because it is engaged for the sake of benefit and happiness.”

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par 'grel pa ni chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The commentary on just this is “all phenomena,” etc.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: By the method of fearlessness means by the method of permanence.

original: nye bar gnas pa ni nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa ni nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: It abides means it is present.

original: gal te phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir nye bar gnas na de lta na ni rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir nye bar gnas na de lta na ni rnam par rtog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is present for the sake of benefit and happiness, then it would be conceptual.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽zhum par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //🔽mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / zhum par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa med pa'o // mi sbyor zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom, etc.🔽It does not become timid means it does not become attached.🔽It does not engage means it does not abide.

original: yongs su mi 'dzin zhes bya ba ni yang dag par mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su mi 'dzin zhes bya ba ni yang dag par mi shes pa ste /
translated: It does not grasp means it does not understand.

original: de'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa ni rnam pa gsum du rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa ni rnam pa gsum du rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: Therefore, non-conceptuality is non-conceptuality in three aspects.

original: de ni lam la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni lam la chos shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the Dharma with regard to the path.

original: 'bras bu mngon du bya ba la mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel pa de ni skad cig ma bco lnga pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon du bya ba la mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel pa de ni skad cig ma bco lnga pa ste /
translated: The fifteenth moment is when one is not connected with signs in the realization of the result.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas rab 'byor ma skyes pa zhes bya ba nas ma gos pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te ;
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas rab 'byor ma skyes pa zhes bya ba nas ma gos pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te ;
translated: With that in mind, it is said from “Subhūti, unarisen” up to “unstained.”

original: 'bras bu skyes pa la mi dmigs pa ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa la mi dmigs pa ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The non-observation of the arisen result is unarisen.

original: rgyu des na bcom ldan 'das ma ni 'bras bu skyes pa'i mtshan ma'i dri mas ma gos pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na bcom ldan 'das ma ni 'bras bu skyes pa'i mtshan ma'i dri mas ma gos pa'o //
translated: By that cause, the Blessed One is unstained by the stain of the sign of the arisen result.

original: 'di ci zhig gis ma gos pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci zhig gis ma gos pa yin zhe na /
translated: By what is this unstained?

original: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: It is said, “Subhūti,” and so on. “Thus” is the reason.

original: gang gi phyir ma gos pa de'i phyir 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma gos pa de'i phyir 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Because it is unstained, therefore this is the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the perfection of the transcendence of conceptualization.

original: gal te nye bar gos par gyur na ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nye bar gos par gyur na ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to become defiled, it would not be the perfection of wisdom.

original: ji ltar ma gos pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma gos pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it undefiled?

original: de'i phyir rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Subhūti, it is thus, etc.”

original: 'bras bu rnams skye ba na yang chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma'i dri ma nub pa'i phyir ma gos pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams skye ba na yang chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma'i dri ma nub pa'i phyir ma gos pa'o //
translated: Even when the fruits are produced, it is undefiled because the stain of the signs of all things is extinguished.

original: de ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: This is the acquiescence to the knowledge of the path.

original: dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la shes pa skye ba med pa de ni skad cig ma bcu drug pa ste /
analyzed: dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la shes pa skye ba med pa de ni skad cig ma bcu drug pa ste /
translated: The non-production of the knowledge of the thing, the name, and both is the sixteenth moment.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas gal te zhes bya ba nas spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas gal te zhes bya ba nas spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
translated: With reference to that, it is said, “If, etc., it would practice.”

original: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni shin tu phra ba'i dngos po dang ming gnyis la 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni shin tu phra ba'i dngos po dang ming gnyis la 'du shes pa'o //
translated: “Thus” means the perception of the two, the very subtle thing and the name.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus pa'i don ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus pa'i don ston par byed pa'o //
translated: “Thus” means teaching the meaning in brief.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma chen mo dag las ni 'di nyid rgyas par ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma chen mo dag las ni 'di nyid rgyas par ston to //
translated: The Great Mother Perfection of Wisdom Sutras teach this in detail.

original: de ltar yang mi shes /
analyzed: de ltar yang mi shes /
translated: Thus, one does not know.

original: de yang rnam par mi rtog /
analyzed: de yang rnam par mi rtog /
translated: Also, one does not conceptualize.

original: @112a * // de ltar yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: @112a * // de ltar yang mi dmigs /
translated: Thus, one does not apprehend.🔽Thus, one does not proliferate.

original: de ltar yang spros par mi byed na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar yang spros par mi byed na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: One practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid thob par yang mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid thob par yang mi byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
translated: Up to: One does not attain the state of omniscience.

original: de la de ltar yang mi shes zhes bya ba ni chos nyid tsam snang gi chos thams cad snang ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la de ltar yang mi shes zhes bya ba ni chos nyid tsam snang gi chos thams cad snang ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: There, “one does not know thus” means that only the mere reality of things appears, but all things do not appear.

original: de ni dngos po shes pa mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dngos po shes pa mi skyed pa'o //
translated: That does not generate the cognition of things.

original: de ltar yang rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba ni brjod pa thams cad snang ba med pas /
analyzed: de ltar yang rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba ni brjod pa thams cad snang ba med pas /
translated: “Also, one does not conceptualize” means that since all expressions do not appear,

original: ming gi shes pa mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: ming gi shes pa mi skyed pa'o //
translated: the cognition of names does not arise.

original: ma 'dres pa dri ma med pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa dri ma med pa /
translated: Unmixed, stainless,

original: nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas pa chos nyid shes pa la ni rig par bya ba dang ; rig par byed pa'i bye brag mi snang ba ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar mtha' yas pa chos nyid shes pa la ni rig par bya ba dang ; rig par byed pa'i bye brag mi snang ba ste /
translated: The knowledge of reality, which is like space, is infinite. There is no appearance of a distinction between that which is to be known and the knower.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par shes pa skye ba med do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par shes pa skye ba med do //
translated: The knowledge of subject and object does not arise.

original: dngos po dang ming dang / gnyis su snang ba 'di gsum yang phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang ming dang / gnyis su snang ba 'di gsum yang phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba ste /
translated: These three things, entity, name, and dualistic appearance, are to be abandoned because they are erroneous.

original: phyin ci log ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni spros pa'o //
translated: Error is conceptual proliferation.

original: de'i phyir de dag med pa nyid kyang spros par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag med pa nyid kyang spros par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, their nonexistence also does not become conceptual proliferation.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla ste /
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de ni lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: This is the subsequent knowledge with regard to the path.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid 'di yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa nyid la sogs pa'i tshul yod na ni /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid 'di yang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa nyid la sogs pa'i tshul yod na ni /
translated: This knowledge of all aspects also exists in the manner of not abiding in either cyclic existence or nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin la /
translated: If it exists in that way, it is the knowledge of all aspects of the bodhisattvas.

original: de med na ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi thams cad shes pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: de med na ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi thams cad shes pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa rdzogs so /
translated: If it does not exist in that way, it is the knowledge of all aspects of the śrāvakas and so on.🔽The section on the knowledge of all aspects is complete.

original: // / de ltar thams cad shes pa nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar thams cad shes pa nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the characteristics of the three knowledges,

original: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir thob par byed pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i phyir thob par byed pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
translated: in order to summarize, he says up to “there is no attainment.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / thams cad shes pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge of all things.

original: de zhes bya ba ni de nyid rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni de nyid rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: “That” refers to those three aspects.

original: 'di dag ni le'u rnam pa dgus rgya cher bstan te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni le'u rnam pa dgus rgya cher bstan te /
translated: These are taught extensively in nine chapters.

original: le'u gcig dang phyed dang bdun dang / phyed dang gnyis ni go rims bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: le'u gcig dang phyed dang bdun dang / phyed dang gnyis ni go rims bzhin du bstan to //
translated: One and a half chapters and seven and a half chapters are taught in order, respectively.

original: chos gang yang zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang yang zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: “Any dharma” refers to the mind and mental factors that are associated.

original: 'jug par byed pa ni dmigs pa la nye bar 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa ni dmigs pa la nye bar 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: “Engaging” means placing in the object.

original: nges par 'jog par byed pa ni de nyid la 'jog cing zhi gnas skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'jog par byed pa ni de nyid la 'jog cing zhi gnas skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: “Determining” means placing in that and generating śamatha.

original: yang dag par ston par byed pa ni lhag mthong skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par ston par byed pa ni lhag mthong skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The exhibitors are those who generate insight.

original: nges par ston par byed pa na mngon sum du byed pas @112b so ;
analyzed: nges par ston par byed pa na mngon sum du byed pas @112b so ;
translated: The demonstrators are those who make it manifest.

original: / yongs su thob par byed pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i chos thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: / yongs su thob par byed pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i chos thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The attainers are those who attain the dharmas that are the fruits of the path.

original: nges par thob par byed pa ni de nyid mthar phyin par 'dren pa ste /
analyzed: nges par thob par byed pa ni de nyid mthar phyin par 'dren pa ste /
translated: The definitive attainers are those who lead to the culmination of that attainment.

original: thams cad kyang med do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang med do zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: All of these are nonexistent.

original: de thams cad ga las she na /
analyzed: de thams cad ga las she na /
translated: Where are they all?

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ston pa thos nas lha rnams kyis gang byas pa de ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro // 'di ston pa thos nas lha rnams kyis gang byas pa de ni /
translated: In the nonapprehension of all dharmas.🔽Having heard this teaching, the gods did what was to be done.

original: de nas lha'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The text says, Then the gods...

original: skye bo mang po'i tshogs dag dga' ba skyes nas ca co ni ku co'o //
analyzed: skye bo mang po'i tshogs dag dga' ba skyes nas ca co ni ku co'o //
translated: The multitude of people are those who are delighted and make a great noise.

original: de nyid ni ga zha yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni ga zha yin te /
translated: This is gazing.

original: skad shin tu mthon por 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: skad shin tu mthon por 'byin pa'o //
translated: It is making a very loud sound.

original: 'di ni chos kyi 'khor lo lan gnyis su bskor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi 'khor lo lan gnyis su bskor ba ma yin te /
translated: This is not the second turning of the wheel of Dharma.

original: gnyi ga yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are not apprehended.

original: chos gang la yang med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos gang la yang med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no dharma whatsoever.

original: chos kyi 'khor los gzhan pa yang ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor los gzhan pa yang ngo //
translated: The wheel of Dharma is different from that.

original: gang las chos thams cad la chags pa med pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i dmigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las chos thams cad la chags pa med pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i dmigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: From which all dharmas are without attachment, because of being free from the objective support of attachment.

original: gang bla na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: gang bla na med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: That which is unsurpassed, etc. is easy to understand.

original: chos thams cad ni dmigs pa med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni dmigs pa med de /
translated: All dharmas are without objective support.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yin pa de yang med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub par 'gyur ba'i chos gang yin pa de yang med do zhes ston to //
translated: Because there is no dharma whatsoever that would become enlightened.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par byang ba'i chos gang zhig gang la ston par 'gyur ba ni med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par byang ba'i chos gang zhig gang la ston par 'gyur ba ni med do //
translated: Because there is no dharma whatsoever that would be purified and would be taught.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Non-arising is non-production.

original: chos gang yang zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o//
analyzed: chos gang yang zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o//
translated: Any dharma whatsoever is defiled.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ni rnam par byang ba rnams kyi dper brjod pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ni rnam par byang ba rnams kyi dper brjod pa'o //
translated: The three samadhis beginning with emptiness are mentioned as examples of purification.

original: bstan pa ni don dam pa bstan pa'o //🔽sus kyang bstan pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: bstan pa ni don dam pa bstan pa'o // sus kyang bstan pa med ces bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The teaching is the teaching of the ultimate.🔽It is said, No one teaches it, and so on, up to It is not made into an object of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i gnas su byas pa med do zhes bya ba ga las shes she na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas su byas pa med do zhes bya ba ga las shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: gang zag gi dngos po 'di nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: gang zag gi dngos po 'di nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: It is thought, Because this very entity of the person does not exist.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the characteristics of the three aspects of omniscience,

original: sbyor ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba bstan par bya ste /
translated: the application should be taught.

original: de yang rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa yin la /
translated: And that is the complete and perfect realization of all aspects.

original: de bstan pa'i ched du bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i ched du bstan bcos las /
translated: For the sake of teaching that, the treatise states:🔽The aspects, together with the applications,

original: rnam pa sbyor ba bcas pa dang // yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
analyzed: rnam pa sbyor ba bcas pa dang // yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
translated: the qualities, the faults, and their characteristics,🔽liberation, the factors conducive to penetration,

original: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob ma phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob ma phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
translated: the assembly of irreversible disciples,🔽existence and peace as equality,

original: srid dang zhi ba mnyam nyid dang // zhing dag bla na med pa ni //
analyzed: srid dang zhi ba mnyam nyid dang // zhing dag bla na med pa ni //
translated: and the unsurpassable fields

original: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa ste //
translated: are the complete and perfect realization of all aspects.

original: 'di ni thabs mkhas bcas pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs mkhas bcas pa yin //
translated: This is together with skillful means.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation of the eleven topics.

original: rnam pa dag dang / sbyor ba dag dang / yon tan @113a * //
analyzed: rnam pa dag dang / sbyor ba dag dang / yon tan @113a * //
translated: The aspects, the applications, the qualities,

original: dag dang / skyon dag dang / mtshan nyid dag dang / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: dag dang / skyon dag dang / mtshan nyid dag dang / thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: the faults, the characteristics, the factors conducive to liberation, the factors conducive to penetrative insight, the irreversible saṅgha, the sameness of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: the purification of the buddhafield, and skillful means.

original: dngos po bcu gcig ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po bcu gcig ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'o //
translated: These eleven topics are the complete realization of all aspects.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bshad pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bshad pa la /
translated: The explanation of the topics as they are presented.🔽The explanation of the first aspect.

original: dang po'i rnam pa bshad pa ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: dang po'i rnam pa bshad pa ni bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise says:

original: gzhi dang ye shes rnam pa yi //
analyzed: gzhi dang ye shes rnam pa yi //
translated: The basis, the wisdom, the aspects,

original: rnam pa shes bya mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa shes bya mtshan nyid do //
translated: The objects of knowledge, and the characteristics.

original: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir //
analyzed: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir //
translated: Because of the three kinds of omniscience,

original: de ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is held to have three aspects.

original: gzhi ni mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhi ni mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The basis is nonapprehension.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: the four noble truths, and so on.

original: de'i ye shes de nyid kyi rnam pa ni rnam pa gang gis de yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ye shes de nyid kyi rnam pa ni rnam pa gang gis de yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The aspects of that very knowledge are the aspects by which it is fully known.

original: de dag gi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni ming ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni ming ngo //
translated: The characteristics of those aspects are their names.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa rnams zhes bya ba mang po'i tshig yin yang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa rnams zhes bya ba mang po'i tshig yin yang /
translated: Although the phrase “those who have the knowledge of all aspects” is plural,

original: rigs kyi dbang du byas nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbang du byas nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: in terms of their lineage, it means “the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: de rnam pa gsum ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de rnam pa gsum ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is that threefold?

original: thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid dang / lam shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of the path, and the knowledge of entities.

original: de la dang po thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun te /
analyzed: de la dang po thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun te /
translated: Among those, the first, the knowledge of all aspects, has twenty-seven aspects.

original: 'dir bstan bcos las /🔽med pa'i rnam pa nas bzung ste //
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos las / med pa'i rnam pa nas bzung ste //
translated: Here, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge says:🔽From the aspect of nonexistence

original: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar //
translated: up to the aspect of nonfluctuation,🔽four for each truth

original: bden pa so so la bzhi dang // lam la de ni bco lngar bshad //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: bden pa so so la bzhi dang // lam la de ni bco lngar bshad //🔽ces gsungs te /
translated: and fifteen for the path are explained.

original: 'di ni ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba med pa'i rnam pa nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'di ni ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba med pa'i rnam pa nas brtsams nas /
translated: This is the perfection of non-existence.

original: mi g-yo ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa'i bar ro //
translated: The perfection of non-movement is from the aspect of non-movement.

original: de dag las sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dag la bzhi bzhi dang / lam gyi bden pa la ni lhag ma bco lnga'o //
analyzed: de dag las sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dag la bzhi bzhi dang / lam gyi bden pa la ni lhag ma bco lnga'o //
translated: Among those, there are four each for the truths of suffering, origination, and cessation, and fifteen remaining for the truth of the path.

original: ma mchis pa yang yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin pas na ;
analyzed: ma mchis pa yang yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin pas na ;
translated: Because it is non-existent and also a perfection,

original: ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: it is the perfection of non-existence.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma dag la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma dag la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the following.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi gzhi ni med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / dben pa dang / mi rdzi ba'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi gzhi ni med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / dben pa dang / mi rdzi ba'o //
translated: Among those, the basis of suffering is non-existence, sameness, isolation, and non-subjugation.

original: nam mkha' ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ma mchis pa bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa med @113b pa ste ;
analyzed: nam mkha' ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' ma mchis pa bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa med @113b pa ste ;
translated: The phrase non-existence of space means the non-existence of form, etc., as if they were non-existent space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs can gyi rdzas med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs can gyi rdzas med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as space is the characteristic of the non-existence of material substances,

original: gzugs la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: so form, etc. are the non-existence of their own characteristics.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su ma mchis pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi chos thams cad dmigs su med par mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su ma mchis pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi chos thams cad dmigs su med par mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The equality of all things in being unapprehendable refers to the equality of the unapprehendability of all things, whether of the aspect of suffering or of the aspect of happiness.

original: shin tu stong pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi ngo bos stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu stong pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi ngo bos stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The extreme emptiness refers to the emptiness of the personal entity.

original: gnod par byed pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The harmful refers to suffering.

original: gnod par byar rung ba yin pa'i phyir brdzi ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gnod par byar rung ba yin pa'i phyir brdzi ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: It is the nature of the weak because it is suitable to be harmed.

original: mi brdzi ba'i bdag nyid ni bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: mi brdzi ba'i bdag nyid ni bdag med pa ste /
translated: The unbreakable nature is the insubstantiality of the personal entity.

original: de'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir mi brdzi ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir mi brdzi ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: It is the perfection of the unbreakable because it has that as its aspect.

original: chos thams cad gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyis mi dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa rnams dmigs su med pa nyid kyis mi dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: The unapprehendability of all things refers to the unapprehendability of all things, whether of the aspect of suffering or of the aspect of happiness, by reason of the unapprehendability of the harmful and the weak.

original: kun 'byung gi gzhi ni /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi gzhi ni /
translated: The basis of origination is

original: 'di ltar gnas ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas ni rgyu ste /
translated: thus the abode, which is the cause,

original: sngon gyi phung po rnams so //
analyzed: sngon gyi phung po rnams so //
translated: the previous aggregates.

original: ngo bo nyid ni bdag nyid kyi dngos po ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni bdag nyid kyi dngos po ste /
translated: The essence is one's own entity,

original: lus kyi las so //
analyzed: lus kyi las so //
translated: the bodily action.

original: brjod pa ni ngag gi las so //
analyzed: brjod pa ni ngag gi las so //
translated: The expression is the verbal action.

original: ming ni yid kyi las dang nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni yid kyi las dang nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The name is the mental action and the afflictions.

original: 'di dag med pa'i go rims bzhin du gnas med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / brjod pa med pa dang / ming med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag med pa'i go rims bzhin du gnas med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa dang / brjod pa med pa dang / ming med pa ste /
translated: The absence of these is, in order, the absence of abode, the absence of essence, the absence of expression, and the absence of name.

original: de dag gi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Because they have no essence, they are perfections.

original: ming ma mchis shing lus ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: ming ma mchis shing lus ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la ;
translated: As for without name and without body,

original: ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po'o //
translated: name is the formless aggregates.

original: lus ni gzugs can gyi phung po ste /
analyzed: lus ni gzugs can gyi phung po ste /
translated: Body is the form aggregate.

original: de gnyis med pa ni ming med cing lus med pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis med pa ni ming med cing lus med pa'o //
translated: The absence of those two is without name and without body.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ni lus kyi las so //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ni lus kyi las so //
translated: Coming and going is bodily action.

original: de med pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa'o //
translated: The absence of that is without coming and going.

original: brjod pa'i rgyu ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i rgyu ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of expression is conceptualization.

original: de med pa ni rtogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni rtogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of that is non-realization.

original: 'gog pa'i gzhi ni 'di ltar 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i gzhi ni 'di ltar 'gro ba'am /
translated: The basis of cessation is thus: going,

original: zad pa 'am /
analyzed: zad pa 'am /
translated: exhaustion,

original: skye ba 'di dag med pa ni go rims bzhin du 'gro ba med pa dang / gzung ba med pa dang / zad pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'di dag med pa ni go rims bzhin du 'gro ba med pa dang / gzung ba med pa dang / zad pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and arising. The absence of these is, respectively, non-going, non-apprehension, non-exhaustion, and non-arising. Because of the absence of their intrinsic reality, it is the perfection.

original: chos thams cad 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are non-going,

original: 'gro ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the very absence of going.

original: chos thams cad ni gzung du med pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gzung du med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are ungraspable,

original: chos kyis chos mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyis chos mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because phenomena do not grasp phenomena.

original: zad pa nyid ni chos te rgyu dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa nyid ni chos te rgyu dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Exhaustion is a phenomenon, because it is not endowed with a cause.

original: de mi ldan pa ni mi zad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
