analyzed: de mi ldan pa ni mi zad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of that is endowed with non-exhaustion.

original: mngon par grub pa ni skyes pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par grub pa ni skyes pa ste /
translated: Manifest establishment is arising.

original: de med pa ni mngon par ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni mngon par ma grub pa'o //
translated: The absence of that is non-manifest establishment.🔽The fifteen of the path are the agent, the knower,

original: lam gyi bco lnga ni byed pa po dang / shes pa @114a * //
analyzed: lam gyi bco lnga ni byed pa po dang / shes pa @114a * //
translated: and the seer.

original: po dang / mthong ba po med pa dang / 'pho ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: po dang / mthong ba po med pa dang / 'pho ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang /
translated: The path is without defilement and without purification, because it is seen as without increase and decrease.🔽The path is without stain, because it is seen as without attachment.🔽The path is without conceptualization, because it is seen as without conceptualization.🔽The path is without pride, because it is seen as without pride.🔽The path is without agitation, because it is seen as without agitation.

original: rnam par byang ba med pa dang / gos pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang ; rlom pa med pa dang / g-yo ba med pa ste byed pa po med pa la sogs pa ni byed pa po med pa'i phyir de ni pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa dang / gos pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang ; rlom pa med pa dang / g-yo ba med pa ste byed pa po med pa la sogs pa ni byed pa po med pa'i phyir de ni pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The path is without action, because it is seen as without action.

original: lam ni byed pa po med pa ste des byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni byed pa po med pa ste des byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path is without a creator, because it is not observed as a creator.

original: lam ni shes pa po dang mthong ba po med pa ste des shes pa po dang mthong ba po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni shes pa po dang mthong ba po med pa ste des shes pa po dang mthong ba po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path is without a knower and a seer, because it is not observed as a knower and a seer.

original: lam ni 'pho ba med pa ste des 'chi 'pho dang skye ba med pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni 'pho ba med pa ste des 'chi 'pho dang skye ba med pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The path is without transference, because it is seen as without death, transference, and birth.

original: lam ni 'jig pa med pa ste dus gsum gyi chos rnams rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni 'jig pa med pa ste dus gsum gyi chos rnams rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path is non-perishing, because it is the realization that the phenomena of the three times are essentially imperishable.🔽Like a dream, etc.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa'o //
translated: The path is a dream, because it is seen as an object, although nothing is seen.🔽The path is an echo, because it is perceived as sound, although there is no sound.🔽The path is a mirage, because it is seen as an object, although there is no object.🔽The path is an optical illusion, because it is seen as a reflection.🔽The path is a magical creation, because it appears, although there is no sign.🔽The path is a reflection, because it is seen as a form.🔽The path is an echo, because it is perceived as sound, although there is no sound.🔽The path is a mirage, because it appears to those who are tormented by thirst, although there is no mass of water.🔽The path is a magical creation, because it appears, although there is no sign.🔽The path is a reflection, because it is seen as a form.🔽The path is an optical illusion, because it is seen as an object, although there is no object.

original: lam ni rmi lam ste mthong bar bya ba med kyang don mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni rmi lam ste mthong bar bya ba med kyang don mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The path is a dream, because it is seen as an object, although nothing is seen.🔽The path is a magical creation, because it appears, although there is no sign.

original: lam ni brag ca ste sgra med kyang sgrar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽lam ni mig yor te gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: lam ni brag ca ste sgra med kyang sgrar dmigs pa'i phyir ro // lam ni mig yor te gzugs brnyan no //
translated: The path is an echo, because it is perceived as sound, although there is no sound.🔽The path is a mirage, because it appears to those who are tormented by thirst, although there is no mass of water.🔽The path is a magical creation, because it appears, although there is no sign.🔽The path is a reflection, because it is seen as a form.

original: de ni don med kyang don mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni don med kyang don mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The path is an optical illusion, because it is seen as an object, although there is no object.🔽The path is a dream, because it is seen as an object, although nothing is seen.🔽The path is a magical creation, because it appears, although there is no sign.🔽The path is an echo, because it is perceived as sound, although there is no sound.

original: lam ni smig rgyu ste chu'i phung po med kyang /🔽skom gyis gdungs pa'i 'jig rten rnams la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni smig rgyu ste chu'i phung po med kyang / skom gyis gdungs pa'i 'jig rten rnams la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The path is a mirage, because it appears to those who are tormented by thirst, although there is no mass of water.🔽The path is a magical creation, because it appears, although there is no sign.🔽The path is a reflection, because it is seen as a form.

original: lam ni sgyu ma ste mtshan ma med kyang snang ba'i phyir ro //🔽skye ba ma mchis shing rnam par go bar mi bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir lam ni lnga po dag kyang skye ba med par ston pa ste /
analyzed: lam ni sgyu ma ste mtshan ma med kyang snang ba'i phyir ro //🔽skye ba ma mchis shing rnam par go bar mi bgyid pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir lam ni lnga po dag kyang skye ba med par ston pa ste /
translated: The path is an optical illusion, because it is seen as

original: snang ba'i rgyu med par yang de lta de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba'i rgyu med par yang de lta de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it appears like this, even without a cause for appearance.

original: lam ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ste des 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ste des 'dod chags la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path is uncontaminated, because it does not apprehend desire, etc.

original: lam ni rnam par byang ba med pa ste des kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni rnam par byang ba med pa ste des kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path is unpurified, because it does not apprehend sentient beings who are afflicted.

original: lam ni gos pa med pa ste des nam mkha' ltar chos rnams la gos pa med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni gos pa med pa ste des nam mkha' ltar chos rnams la gos pa med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The path is unsoiled, because it sees phenomena as unsoiled, like space.

original: lam ni spros pa med pa ste spros pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni spros pa med pa ste spros pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path is unembellished, because it is the antidote to embellishment.

original: lam ni rlom sems med pa ste rlom sems can thams cad yang dag par bcom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni rlom sems med pa ste rlom sems can thams cad yang dag par bcom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The path is non-conceited, because it completely conquers all conceitedness.

original: lam ni g-yo ba med pa ste chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid pas rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni g-yo ba med pa ste chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid pas rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The path is unmoving, because it is permanent, being the nature of the dharmadhātu.

original: de ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: This is the aspect of the knowledge of all things.

original: de nas lam shes pa @114b nyid kyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug ni gang bstan bcos las /🔽rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin //
analyzed: de nas lam shes pa @114b nyid kyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug ni gang bstan bcos las / rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin //
translated: Next, the thirty six aspects of knowledge of the path are taught in the treatise.

original: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
analyzed: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
translated: They are proclaimed as eight, seven,

original: lnga dang bcu drug ces bsgrags so //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lnga dang bcu drug ces bsgrags so // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: five and sixteen in order

original: rgyu ni kun 'byung ste /🔽de bas kun 'byung ba dang / lam dag ni dang por bstan te /
analyzed: rgyu ni kun 'byung ste / de bas kun 'byung ba dang / lam dag ni dang por bstan te /
translated: with respect to cause, path,🔽suffering and cessation.🔽Cause means origin because origin is the cause of suffering.

original: 'bras bu'i thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore origin and path are taught first because they are the method for attaining the result.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa ni phyis bstan te 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa ni phyis bstan te 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Suffering and cessation are taught later because they are the result.

original: de dag gi rnam pa ni go rims bzhin du brgyad dang / bdun dang / lnga dang / bcu drug tu bsgrags pa ni gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa ni go rims bzhin du brgyad dang / bdun dang / lnga dang / bcu drug tu bsgrags pa ni gsungs pa ste /
translated: Their aspects are proclaimed, stated, as eight, seven, five and sixteen in order with respect to cause, path, suffering and cessation.

original: mdo las so //
analyzed: mdo las so //
translated: They are stated in the sutras.

original: de la kun 'byung gi brgyad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / kun nas ldang ba med pa dang / zhi ba dang / skyon med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems can med pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun 'byung gi brgyad ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / kun nas ldang ba med pa dang / zhi ba dang / skyon med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems can med pa'o //
translated: freedom from afflictions,🔽and freedom from sentient beings.

original: ji lta yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta yin zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Faultlessness is the three: freedom from desire, freedom from hatred, and freedom from delusion.

original: kun 'byung ni sngon gyi phung po lnga rnams so //
analyzed: kun 'byung ni sngon gyi phung po lnga rnams so //
translated: Origination is the previous five aggregates.

original: yongs su brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la chags pa ni 'dod chags te /
analyzed: yongs su brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos rnams la chags pa ni 'dod chags te /
translated: Desire is attachment to imputed entities.

original: gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste kun 'byung ngo //
translated: Freedom from desire is freedom from desire, which is origination.

original: chos thams cad ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi slad du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi slad du zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because all phenomena are not distorted suchness.

original: log pa nyid du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: log pa nyid du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'o //
translated: They are empty of the nature imputed as distorted.

original: kun nas ldang ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The 'arising' is the cause of the afflictions, which is discursive thought.

original: de 'di la yod pa ma yin pas kun nas ldang ba med pa ste kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de 'di la yod pa ma yin pas kun nas ldang ba med pa ste kun 'byung ngo //
translated: Since that does not exist here, there is no arising, which is the origin.

original: chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: 'All dharmas are non-conceptual' means that there is no grasping.

original: zhi ba ni kun 'byung 'gog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhi ba ni kun 'byung 'gog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: 'Peace' means the cessation of the origin, that is the meaning.

original: de ga las she na /
analyzed: de ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma ni chos thams cad mi snang ba ste don dam par snang ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma ni chos thams cad mi snang ba ste don dam par snang ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The 'sign of all dharmas' is the non-appearance of all dharmas, because ultimately there is no appearance, there is no observation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dod chags med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / zhe sdang med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gti mug med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dod chags med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / zhe sdang med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gti mug med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is the perfection of non-attachment, the perfection of non-aversion, and the perfection of non-delusion.

original: yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug zad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug zad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The 'perfection of qualities' is the perfection of the exhaustion of attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad med pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste kun 'byung ngo //🔽yongs su rtog pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni nyan kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad med pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste kun 'byung ngo // yongs su rtog pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni nyan kun 'byung ngo //
translated: The absence of all afflictions is the absence of afflictions, which is the origin.🔽The absence of conceptualization is the absence of conceptualization by the śrāvakas.

original: yongs su rtog pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyis yod par rtogs so //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa ma mchis zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyis yod par rtogs so //
translated: The absence of conceptualization is the absence of conceptualization by the śrāvakas.

original: gzhan yang @115a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang @115a * //
translated: Moreover,

original: sems can nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: sentient beings are subject to afflictions and suffering.

original: de med pas na sems can med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pas na sems can med pa'o //
translated: Because of the absence of that, there are no sentient beings.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni chos dang zang zing gi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni chos dang zang zing gi stong pa nyid do //
translated: The limit of reality is the emptiness of phenomena and material things.🔽 The seven of the path are the immeasurables, non-conceptuality of the two extremes, non-differentiation, non-grasping at the best, non-conceptuality, immeasurability, and non-attachment.🔽 The three of the result are the result of separation, the result of human effort, and the result of dominance.🔽 The three of the result are the result of separation, the result of human effort, and the result of dominance.🔽 The three of the result are the result of separation, the result of human effort, and the result of dominance.

original: lam gyi bdun ni tshad med pa dang / mtha' gnyis su mi rtog pa dang / tha mi dad pa dang / mchog tu mi 'dzin pa dang / mi rtog pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bdun ni tshad med pa dang / mtha' gnyis su mi rtog pa dang / tha mi dad pa dang / mchog tu mi 'dzin pa dang / mi rtog pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / chags pa med pa'o //
translated: The three of the result are the result of separation, the result of human effort, and the result of dominance.🔽 The three of the result are the result of separation, the result of human effort, and the result of dominance.🔽 The three of the result are the result of separation, the result of human effort, and the result of dominance.🔽 The three of the result are the result of separation, the result of human effort, and the result of dominance.🔽 The three of the result are the result of separation, the result of human effort, and the result of dominance.🔽 The three of the result are the result of separation, the result of human effort, and the result of dominance.🔽 The three of the result are the result of separation, the result of human effort, and the result of dominance.🔽 The three of the result are the result of separation, the result of human effort, and the result of dominance.🔽 The three of the result are the result of separation, the result of human effort, and the result of dominance.🔽 The three of the result are the result of separation, the result of human effort, and the result of dominance.🔽 The three of the result are the result

original: lam ni tshad med pa ste chos thams cad kyi kun nas ldang ba'i kun nas ldang ba med pa ni brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽lam ni mtha' gnyis su mi rtog pa ste chos thams cad la mngon par ma chags pa zhes bya ba de ni ji ltar snang ba de'i stong pa nyid snang zhing rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: lam ni tshad med pa ste chos thams cad kyi kun nas ldang ba'i kun nas ldang ba med pa ni brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // lam ni mtha' gnyis su mi rtog pa ste chos thams cad la mngon par ma chags pa zhes bya ba de ni ji ltar snang ba de'i stong pa nyid snang zhing rtogs pa'o //
translated: The path is the highest,🔽because it does not touch the inferior vehicles.🔽Non-discrimination is the path.🔽The sameness of discrimination is the path.

original: tha dad pa med pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa ni lam mo //
translated: The path is immeasurable,

original: dbyer ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni dbye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyer ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni dbye ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not measured by the aggregates, etc.🔽The path is uncountable,🔽because it is not counted by the elements, etc.🔽The path is unobtainable,🔽because it is not obtained by the sense-fields, etc.🔽The path is non-dual,🔽because it is not dualized by the vehicles.

original: lam ni mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: lam ni mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The path is non-differentiation,

original: des dman pa'i theg pa la mi reg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dman pa'i theg pa la mi reg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not differentiated by the perfections.🔽The path is non-division,🔽because it is not divided by the emptinesses.

original: mi rtog pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: mi rtog pa ni lam mo //
translated: The path is non-discrimination,

original: rnam par rtog pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not discriminated by the doors of concentration.🔽The path is non-production,🔽because it is not produced by the powers.🔽The path is non-cessation,🔽because it is not ceased by the forces.

original: dpag tu med pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ni lam mo //
translated: The path is non-defilement,🔽because it is not defiled by the members of enlightenment.🔽The path is non-purification,🔽because it is not purified by the members of the path.🔽The path is non-perception,🔽because it is not perceived by the fruits.🔽The path is non-apprehension,🔽because it is not apprehended by the vehicles.🔽The path is non-discrimination,🔽because it is not discriminated by the stages.🔽The path is non-disturbance,🔽because it is not disturbed by the meditative concentrations.🔽The path is non-attachment,🔽because it is not attached to the dhāraṇī-doors.🔽The path is non-contention,🔽because it is not contended by the doors of liberation.🔽The path is non-production,🔽because it is not produced by the emptiness of emptiness.🔽The path is non-cessation,🔽because it is not ceased by the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽The path is non-defilement,🔽because it is not defiled by the emptiness of the conditioned.🔽The path is non-purification,

original: chos nyid tshad ma mchis pa nyid kyi slad du zhes bya ba ni chos nyid tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid tshad ma mchis pa nyid kyi slad du zhes bya ba ni chos nyid tshad med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the immeasurable reality means because of the object of immeasurable reality.

original: chags pa med pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: chags pa med pa ni lam mo //
translated: The path is without attachment.

original: chos thams cad la ma chags pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la ma chags pa zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: All dharmas are without attachment means without an object.

original: sdug bsngal gyi lnga ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi lnga ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: The five of suffering are impermanence, suffering, emptiness, selflessness, and marklessness.

original: sdug bsngal ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: Suffering is the five aggregates with outflows.

original: de la mi rtag pa ni rtag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa ni rtag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, impermanence is not permanent.

original: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal te /
translated: Suffering is suffering.

original: bde ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: It is like space because it is the opposite of happiness.

original: sdug bsngal ni stong pa nyid de chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni stong pa nyid de chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Suffering is emptiness because all dharmas are not observed.

original: sdug bsngal ni bdag med pa nyid de ji ltar snang ba'i chos thams cad la mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni bdag med pa nyid de ji ltar snang ba'i chos thams cad la mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Suffering is non-self, because of the absence of attachment to all phenomena as they appear.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos gsum ni skye ba dang ; rga ba dang / mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos gsum ni skye ba dang ; rga ba dang / mi rtag pa'o //
translated: The three conditioned phenomena are origination, aging, and impermanence.

original: de med pa ni mtshan nyid med pa ste sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de med pa ni mtshan nyid med pa ste sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Their non-existence is the absence of characteristics, which is suffering.

original: mngon par ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snang ba dang / ji ltar don dam pa ni 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snang ba dang / ji ltar don dam pa ni 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-origination is the ultimate, because of the unconditionedness of phenomena as they appear and as they are ultimately.

original: 'gog pa'i ni bcu drug ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i ni bcu drug ste /
translated: The cessation has sixteen aspects.

original: de'i phyir 'gog pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gog pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, cessation is the purification of emptiness,

original: stong @115b pa nyid dang tha mi dad cing tha dad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong @115b pa nyid dang tha mi dad cing tha dad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not different from emptiness and the differentiation of difference is not observed.

original: de bas na nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' yas mu med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na nam mkha' bzhin du mtha' yas mu med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, like space, it is infinite and boundless.

original: dus gsum dang rgya cher yongs su ma chad pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug yin la /
analyzed: dus gsum dang rgya cher yongs su ma chad pa'i phyir stong pa nyid bcu drug yin la /
translated: The sixteen aspects of emptiness are due to the non-restriction of the three times and the extensive.

original: des na go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: des na go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, they are to be connected in order.

original: de ni 'dir ro gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dir ro gcig pa yin no //
translated: This is one taste here.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste mtha' yas mu med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste mtha' yas mu med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is the perfection of all emptinesses, because it is limitless and boundless.

original: de ni nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bar gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bar gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of perfection in the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, up to the emptiness of essential nature.

original: de bas na 'gog pa'i bden pa ni rnam pa bcu drug yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'gog pa'i bden pa ni rnam pa bcu drug yin te /
translated: Therefore, the truth of cessation has sixteen aspects.

original: de ni lam shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de ni lam shes pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: This is the aspect of knowledge of the path.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa ni brgya rtsa bcu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa ni brgya rtsa bcu ste /
translated: The aspect of knowledge of all aspects is one hundred and ten.

original: gang gi phyir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bstan bcos las /
translated: Because it is said in the treatise:

original: kun mkhyen nyid gsum bye brag gis //
analyzed: kun mkhyen nyid gsum bye brag gis //
translated: By the distinction of the three omnisciences,

original: lam gyi bden pa dang mthun par //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa dang mthun par //
translated: In accordance with the truth of the path,

original: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste //
translated: Beginning with the establishment of mindfulness,

original: tha ma sangs rgyas nyid rnam par //
analyzed: tha ma sangs rgyas nyid rnam par //
translated: Up to the end, buddhahood itself,🔽For the disciples, the bodhisattvas,

original: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin te //
analyzed: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin te //
translated: And the buddhas, respectively,

original: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
analyzed: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
translated: There are thirty-seven and thirty-four.

original: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed //
translated: The thirty-seven are accepted as the wings of enlightenment.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to that,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi phyogs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas le'u rdzogs pa'i bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi phyogs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas le'u rdzogs pa'i bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: the Lord said, “The wings of enlightenment are the applications of mindfulness, etc.,” up to the conclusion of the chapter.

original: 'di ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the applications of mindfulness, etc., are called “perfections of enlightenment.”

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sde tshan rnam pa bdun re re nas phye bas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa sde tshan rnam pa bdun re re nas phye bas /
translated: The seven groups of the applications of mindfulness, etc., are each divided into seven,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun du 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun du 'gyur te /
translated: so that there are thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: de dag re re la yang mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'o ;
analyzed: de dag re re la yang mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'o ;
translated: And each of these is a perfection in the aspect of nonapprehending.

original: / lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i bar gyis pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi lam la brten pa'o //
analyzed: / lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'i bar gyis pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi lam la brten pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the application of mindfulness to the body, etc., up to the perfection of right concentration, are based on the path of the disciples.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment are the aspects of the knowledge of all the aspects.

original: de nas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ni stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / smon pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ni stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / smon pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: Then, the three doors of liberation are the perfection of emptiness, the perfection of signlessness, and the perfection of wishlessness.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the doors of liberation are not apprehended.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni dang po'i rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gnyis pa'i rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu @116a * //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni dang po'i rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gnyis pa'i rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu @116a * //
translated: The eight liberations are the perfection of the first liberation, the perfection of the second liberation,

original: phyin pa dang / sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: phyin pa dang / sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of the liberation of beauty, the perfection of the liberation of the sphere of infinite space, the perfection of the liberation of the sphere of infinite consciousness,

original: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: cung zad med pa'i skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: The perfection of the liberation of the sphere of nothingness, the perfection of the liberation of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, and the perfection of the liberation of the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eight liberations are non-apprehensible.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni de'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i bar dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni de'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i bar dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The nine serial steps of meditative absorption are the perfection of abiding in the first concentration, up to the perfection of abiding in the fourth concentration, the perfection of abiding in the sphere of infinite space, up to the perfection of abiding in the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the first concentration and so forth are non-apprehensible.

original: sdug bsngal gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / kun 'byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'gog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bden pa bzhi mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / kun 'byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / 'gog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bden pa bzhi mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: the perfection of the transcendence of suffering, the perfection of the transcendence of the origin, the perfection of the transcendence of cessation, the perfection of the transcendence of the path, and the perfection of the nonapprehension of the four noble truths.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten perfections:🔽the perfection of generosity, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patient acceptance, the perfection of vigor, the perfection of meditation, the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of skillful means, the perfection of aspiration, the perfection of power, and the perfection of knowledge.

original: de'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas thabs dang smon lam dang / stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /🔽de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas thabs dang smon lam dang / stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te / de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of generosity is the nonapprehension of the giver, the recipient, and the gift.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam la gnas pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam la gnas pa'i rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is the nonapprehension of immorality, the nonapprehension of morality, the nonapprehension of the transgression of morality, the nonapprehension of the cultivation of morality, and the nonapprehension of the one who cultivates morality.🔽The perfection of patient acceptance is the nonapprehension of anger, the nonapprehension of patience, the nonapprehension of the one who is angry, the nonapprehension of the one who is patient, and the nonapprehension of the object of patient acceptance.🔽The perfection of vigor is the nonapprehension of laziness, the nonapprehension of vigor, the nonapprehension of the one who is lazy, the nonapprehension of the one who is vigorous, and the nonapprehension of the object of vigor.🔽The perfection of meditation is the nonapprehension of distraction, the nonapprehension of meditation, the nonapprehension of the one who is distracted, the nonapprehension of the one who is concentrated, and the nonapprehension of the object of meditation.

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni stobs bcu ste de'i phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni stobs bcu ste de'i phyir gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the nonapprehension of stupidity, the nonapprehension of wisdom, the nonapprehension of the one who is stupid, the nonapprehension of the one who is wise, and the nonapprehension of the object of wisdom.🔽The perfection of skillful means is the nonapprehension of the unskillful, the nonapprehension of skillful means, the nonapprehension of the one who is unskilled, the nonapprehension of the one who is skillful, and the nonapprehension of the object of skillful means.🔽The perfection of aspiration is the nonapprehension of the unaspired, the nonapprehension of aspiration, the nonapprehension of the one who does not aspire, the nonapprehension of the one who

original: mi brdzi ba'i slad du'o zhes bya ba de ni yang stobs kyi don to //
analyzed: mi brdzi ba'i slad du'o zhes bya ba de ni yang stobs kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of power is also included in the phrase in order to be unassailable.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste ;
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste ;
translated: The perfection of fearlessness has four aspects:🔽the perfection of fearlessness in perfect enlightenment, the perfection of fearlessness in the destruction of the defilements, the perfection of fearlessness in the teachings of deliverance,

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / zag pa zad pa la mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / zag pa zad pa la mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: and the perfection of fearlessness in the teachings of obstacles.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu @116b phyin pa'i shin tu ma zhum pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa'i don to //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu @116b phyin pa'i shin tu ma zhum pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of fearlessness is included in the phrase without shrinking.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: The knowledge through higher knowledge has four aspects: the perfection of knowledge through higher knowledge of the Dharma, the perfection of knowledge through higher knowledge of the meaning, the perfection of knowledge through higher knowledge of inspired speech,🔽and the perfection of knowledge through higher knowledge of inspired confidence.

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the analytical knowledges.

original: chos thams cad dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa rnams shes shing yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa rnams shes shing yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge and discernment of all the dharmas, of the meanings, of the languages, and of the eloquence.

original: de la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med par nus pa'o //
analyzed: de la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med par nus pa'o //
translated: The expression “without attachment and without obstruction” means that one is able to be without attachment and without obstruction with regard to them.

original: de ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the analytical knowledges.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang yin la ma 'dres pa yang yin pas na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang yin la ma 'dres pa yang yin pas na /
translated: The perfection of the powers of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: The powers are the powers of the Buddhas.🔽The expression “powers of the Buddhas” is a tatpurusa compound.

original: gzhan dag dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: They are the powers of the Buddhas because they are not held in common with others.

original: thams cad kyang yin la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad do /
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad do /
translated: The expression “all the powers of the Buddhas” is a bahuvrihi compound.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha” is as follows.

original: de dag gi rnam pa nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa nyid kyi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: They are “perfections” because they are the very forms of those qualities.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'khrul pa med pa dang / ca co med pa dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang / thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mnga' ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'khrul pa med pa dang / ca co med pa dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang / thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga' ba dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mnga' ba dang /
translated: They are as follows:🔽Three perfections are indicated by the terms “absence of error,” “absence of chatter,” and “absence of loss of mindfulness.”🔽Three perfections are indicated by the terms “absence of a non-concentrated mind,” “absence of a different kind of perception,” and “absence of an uncontemplated equanimity.”

original: so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang / 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ; shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa mi mnga' ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang /
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga' ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum dang / 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ; shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa mi mnga' ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang /
translated: Six perfections are indicated by the terms “absence of a loss of aspiration,” “absence of a loss of effort,” “absence of a loss of mindfulness,” “absence of a loss of concentration,” “absence of a loss of wisdom,” and “absence of a loss of liberation.”

original: lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba gsum dang / dus gsum thams cad la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes 'jug pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ste de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba gsum dang / dus gsum thams cad la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes 'jug pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ste de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The three perfections of the eighteen special attributes of a Buddha are: all actions of body, speech, and mind are preceded by knowledge and follow after knowledge; and the perfection of the knowledge that penetrates all three times without attachment or obstruction.

original: bgrang ba'i tshul las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba la 'dra bar sems pa ni bgrang ba'o //
analyzed: bgrang ba'i tshul las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba la 'dra bar sems pa ni bgrang ba'o //
translated: Far beyond the way of enumeration means that the way of enumeration is the counting of similarities.

original: de'i tshul ni ldan pa ste 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshul ni ldan pa ste 'dres pa'o //
translated: The way of that is the combination, the mixture.

original: de las shin tu 'das pa ni 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de las shin tu 'das pa ni 'das pa ste /
translated: Far beyond that is beyond.

original: de ni ma 'dres pa'i don to //🔽ji lta @117a * //🔽ba'i chos de kho na bzhin du gsungs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ma 'dres pa'i don to // ji lta @117a * // ba'i chos de kho na bzhin du gsungs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: That is the meaning of the unmixed.🔽The thus of the thus-gone is the Dharma, because it is the Dharma that is thus.

original: de'i de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid de de'i ngo bo nyid de ni pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid de de'i ngo bo nyid de ni pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The thusness of that is the thus-gone itself, and its essence is the perfection.

original: chos thams cad ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bka'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bka'o //
translated: All dharmas are the word of all Buddhas.

original: de dag gis ma log pa de bzhin nyid ni bden pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: de dag gis ma log pa de bzhin nyid ni bden pa nyid kyi phyir ro ;
translated: Because their non-erroneous suchness is the truth.🔽The perfection of self-arising is the perfection of the mind.

original: / rang byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la byung zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'jug pa'i don la 'jug ste /
analyzed: / rang byung gi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la byung zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'jug pa'i don la 'jug ste /
translated: The word “arising” has the meaning of engagement.

original: don gzhan la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: don gzhan la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i don to //
translated: It is included in the meaning of “engagement in another object.”

original: rang zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid de sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid de sems zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Self” means “itself,” which has the meaning of “mind.”

original: sems kyi chos thams cad la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir rang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems kyi chos thams cad la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir rang 'byung ngo //
translated: Because it engages all dharmas of the mind, it is self-arising.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Its essence is its perfection.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yum chen mo las chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yum chen mo las chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in the Great Mother, it is said, “Because of mastery over all dharmas.”

original: 'di'i don bstan pa ni don gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i don bstan pa ni don gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of this is taught in order to eliminate other meanings.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma las gtan tshigs 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma las gtan tshigs 'di gsungs so //
translated: This reason is stated in the Bhagavatī.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba la chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: Because all dharmas are without own-being. All dharmas are without own-being because they are without own-being in themselves.

original: gal te 'di ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na ni de'i tshe sems phyin ci log par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'di ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na ni de'i tshe sems phyin ci log par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If this were to exist with own-being, then the mind would not be perverted.

original: gang gi phyir sems phyin ci log pa de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dbang bsgyur ro zhes bsams so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems phyin ci log pa de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dbang bsgyur ro zhes bsams so //
translated: But because the mind is perverted, therefore the Tathagatas have mastery over it.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ste don gcig go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ste don gcig go //
translated: The knowledge of all modes is called Buddhahood.

original: de'i phyir yum chen mo dag las sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa zhes tha mar gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yum chen mo dag las sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa zhes tha mar gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, in the great Prajnaparamita it is said at the end: “The knowledge of all modes is the knowledge of Buddhahood.”

original: 'dir ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bstan te //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bstan te //
translated: Here it is taught as the perfection of the knowledge of all modes.

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad do //
translated: The knowledge of all modes is the knowledge of all dharmas in all their modes.

original: de dag mkhyen pa ni de'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de dag mkhyen pa ni de'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The knowledge of those is its nature.

original: de nyid de de'i slad du'o //
analyzed: de nyid de de'i slad du'o //
translated: That is it. For that reason.

original: sangs rgyas kyi lam la brten pa sum cu rtsa dgu ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi lam la brten pa sum cu rtsa dgu ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The thirty-nine based on the Buddha path are the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam kun mkhyen nyid rnam pa la //
analyzed: rnam kun mkhyen nyid rnam pa la //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is summarized

original: gcig tu bsdus na brgya dang bcu//
analyzed: gcig tu bsdus na brgya dang bcu//
translated: as one hundred and ten aspects.

original: thams cad mkhyen nyid rnam gsum la //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen nyid rnam gsum la //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is threefold,

original: brgya dang bdun cu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: brgya dang bdun cu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: with one hundred and seventy-three aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma la rnam pa 'di rnams kyis bstod de des na bstod pa'i don gyi le'u ni bstod pa'i le'u'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma la rnam pa 'di rnams kyis bstod de des na bstod pa'i don gyi le'u ni bstod pa'i le'u'o //
translated: The Bhagavati is praised with these aspects. Therefore, the chapter on the meaning of praise is the chapter on praise.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas @117b zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u dgu pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas @117b zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u dgu pa'o /
translated: This concludes the ninth chapter in the Ornament of the Essence, the commentary on the eighth chapter.

original: // / rnam pa bstan nas de dag gi sbyor ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / rnam pa bstan nas de dag gi sbyor ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having explained the aspects, now the application of those will be explained.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das ma thos pa yang rnyed par dka' na /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das ma thos pa yang rnyed par dka' na /
translated: In that regard, if it is difficult to obtain the Bhagavati that has not been heard,

original: rab tu sbyor bar bya ba lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos las ;
analyzed: rab tu sbyor bar bya ba lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir bstan bcos las ;
translated: To demonstrate this, the treatise states:

original: sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la bkur sti byas //
translated: Those who have served the buddhas,

original: de las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun //
analyzed: de las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun //
translated: planted roots of virtue with them,

original: dge ba'i bshes kyis mgon bcas pa //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes kyis mgon bcas pa //
translated: and are protected by spiritual friends

original: 'di mnyan pa yi snod yin no //
analyzed: 'di mnyan pa yi snod yin no //
translated: are vessels for listening to this.🔽Those who rely on the buddhas, ask questions of them,

original: sangs rgyas bsten dang kun 'dri dang // sbyin dang tshul khrims sogs spyod pas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bsten dang kun 'dri dang // sbyin dang tshul khrims sogs spyod pas //
translated: and engage in generosity, ethics, and so forth🔽are vessels for receiving,

original: len dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: len dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i //
translated: upholding, and so on.

original: snod du dam pa rnams bzhed do //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: snod du dam pa rnams bzhed do // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what the sublime ones accept.

original: gang dag sngon gyi sangs rgyas la lhag par bya ba byas shing bsod nams bsags pa dang // tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pas dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das yum 'di nyan pa la thos pa snang ba'i snod yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag sngon gyi sangs rgyas la lhag par bya ba byas shing bsod nams bsags pa dang // tshul khrims dang thos pa la sogs pas dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das yum 'di nyan pa la thos pa snang ba'i snod yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Those who have served the buddhas of the past, accumulated merit, planted roots of virtue through ethics, learning, and so forth, and are protected by spiritual friends are vessels for listening to this Transcendent Conqueror’s mother. They are vessels for the light of learning. Others are not.

original: gang yang sngon gyi skye ba bdag tu sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur dang / yongs su 'dris pa dang ldan pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pas de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das yum 'dzin pa nas de bzhin nyid du sgrub pa'i bar gyi snod du 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang sngon gyi skye ba bdag tu sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur dang / yongs su 'dris pa dang ldan pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pas de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das yum 'dzin pa nas de bzhin nyid du sgrub pa'i bar gyi snod du 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, those who have served many buddhas in their former lives, who are endowed with intimacy, and who practice the six perfections in this life become vessels for this perfection of wisdom, from its retention up to its realization as suchness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das yum 'di 'dzin pa nas de bzhin nyid du rna lam du grag cing rtogs pa ni nges par de dag gis lhag par bya ba byas pa la sogs pa yon tan gsum dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das yum 'di 'dzin pa nas de bzhin nyid du rna lam du grag cing rtogs pa ni nges par de dag gis lhag par bya ba byas pa la sogs pa yon tan gsum dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, those who retain this Mother of the Victorious Ones, up to those who hear and understand it as such, definitely possess the three qualities of having done what is to be done, and so forth.

original: de dag 'dzin pa la sogs pa snang ba dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub pa de dag ni lhag par bya ba byas pa la sogs pa yon tan gsum dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas pa la sogs par nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag 'dzin pa la sogs pa snang ba dang / de bzhin nyid du sgrub pa de dag ni lhag par bya ba byas pa la sogs pa yon tan gsum dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byas pa la sogs par nges pa yin te /
translated: Those who appear to retain it, up to those who establish it as suchness, definitely possess the three qualities of having done what is to be done, and so forth, and have served the buddhas, and so forth.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du sems te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du sems te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, thought this:

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gang gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la rnal 'byor du bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gang gsungs pa la /
translated: “Thus, one should practice yoga in this perfection of wisdom.”

original: de bzhin nyid du slob pa dang zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du slob pa dang zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyis so //
translated: “Training in suchness” is through śamatha.

original: bsgrub pa dang zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gis so //
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gis so //
translated: “Accomplishment” is through vipaśyanā.

original: rnal 'byor du byed pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor du byed pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis so //
translated: “Yoga” is through both śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: dad pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa yin pa'i @118a * //
analyzed: dad pa ma mchis pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa yin pa'i @118a * //
translated: “Lacking faith” and so on: because it was taught by the Tathāgata,

original: phyir ro // de kho na nyid ma yin par yang dag par yid ches pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: phyir ro // de kho na nyid ma yin par yang dag par yid ches pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: faith is the conviction that it is the truth.

original: 'dzin par 'dod pa ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par 'dod pa ni bzod pa'o //
translated: “Wishing to uphold” is patience.

original: spong bar mi 'dod pa ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: spong bar mi 'dod pa ni bzod pa'o //
translated: “Not wishing to abandon” is patience.

original: tshig dang don nyan par 'dod pa ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: tshig dang don nyan par 'dod pa ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: “Wishing to listen to the words and meaning” is aspiration.

original: brtson 'grus ni spro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni spro ba'o //
translated: “Effort” is enthusiasm.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bar du gcod pa chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo'i gnyen po ni bag yod pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bar du gcod pa chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo'i gnyen po ni bag yod pa'o //
translated: heedfulness is the antidote to the obstacles to the roots of virtue, namely, attachment, hostility, confusion, and laziness.

original: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung gis nges pa'i dngos po la 'di nyid yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung gis nges pa'i dngos po la 'di nyid yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin pa ni mos pa'o //
translated: Interest is the firm grasping of a thing ascertained by direct perception, inference, or trustworthy testimony, with the thought, “It is just this, not anything else.”

original: mi 'phrogs pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa'i rten byed pa'i las can te /
translated: Its function is to provide a basis that cannot be taken away.

original: de gtso bor byed pa ni pha rol rgol ba la sogs pas mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gtso bor byed pa ni pha rol rgol ba la sogs pas mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the primary factor in preventing one’s interest from being taken away by opponents.

original: yongs su dris pa dang / yongs su dri bar bgyis pa zhes bya ba ni the tshom gyi gnas thams cad yongs su dris pa dang / gang gis the tshom gyi lan de byas pas ni yongs su dris par byas pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dris pa dang / yongs su dri bar bgyis pa zhes bya ba ni the tshom gyi gnas thams cad yongs su dris pa dang / gang gis the tshom gyi lan de byas pas ni yongs su dris par byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase “having asked questions and having had them resolved” means that all the bases of doubt are asked about, and the one who resolves the doubts is the one who has had them resolved.

original: de ltar ngo mtshar ci che zhes bya ba ni 'dir ci zhig ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ngo mtshar ci che zhes bya ba ni 'dir ci zhig ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase “what is there to wonder at here?” means “what is so amazing about this?”

original: 'di la mos par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la mos par mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be connected with “one will not have faith in this.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la de ltar zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa phan tshun rgyu nyid du nges par bstan pa la phyag bya ba'i don te de ni rnyed
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la de ltar zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa phan tshun rgyu nyid du nges par bstan pa la phyag bya ba'i don te de ni rnyed
translated: ” Thus, in the perfection of wisdom, thus, in the perfection of wisdom and omniscience, the meaning of homage is taught as the mutual causality of the perfection of wisdom and omniscience.

original: par dka' ba nyid do //
analyzed: par dka' ba nyid do //
translated: That is difficult to obtain.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas spobs pa skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sbyor ba'i skabs 'byed do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas spobs pa skyes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sbyor ba'i skabs 'byed do //
translated: Then the Blessed One, up to eloquence arose.

original: sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: With the application in mind, in the treatise:

original: gzugs la sogs la mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs la mi gnas phyir //
translated: Because of not abiding in form and so on,

original: de la gnas pa bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la gnas pa bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the negation of abiding in that,

original: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir//
analyzed: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir//
translated: Because of the profundity of its suchness,

original: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of the difficulty of fathoming those,

original: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun ring rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun ring rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of their immeasurability, and because of realization after a long time with great difficulty,

original: lung bstan phyir mi ldog nyid dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas dang // byang chub nyid dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med phyir //
analyzed: lung bstan phyir mi ldog nyid dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas dang // byang chub nyid dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med phyir //
translated: because of enlightenment, because of swiftness,🔽and because of the nonincrease and nondecrease of others’ welfare.

original: chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong ;🔽/ gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
analyzed: chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong ; / gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
translated: One does not see virtue and nonvirtue, etc.🔽One does not see the inconceivability of form, etc.🔽One does not conceive of the signs of form, etc.,

original: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog //
translated: nor of their nature.

original: 'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // de ni dag pa'i mtshams dang bcas //
analyzed: 'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // de ni dag pa'i mtshams dang bcas //
translated: It gives the jewel of the fruit, and it is the limit of purity.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽de ni zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te / de ni zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: rnam pa bstan nas de nyid kyi @118b skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bstan nas de nyid kyi @118b skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “This” refers to the practice, because it is the context of the teaching.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa ni sbyor ba ste /🔽de la bkag pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa ni sbyor ba ste / de la bkag pa gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not dwelling in form, etc.” is the practice, because it is the context of the teaching.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la mi sbyor ba ni sbyor ba de la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la mi sbyor ba ni sbyor ba de la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not joining with form, etc.” is the practice, because it is the context of the teaching.

original: de bzhin nyid kyang zab pa'i phyir zab pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang zab pa'i phyir zab pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: “Suchness” is the practice, because it is the context of the teaching.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la gting dpag dka' ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la gting dpag dka' ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Likewise, it is the application to form, etc., which is difficult to fathom.

original: de bzhin nyid du tshad med pa yin pa'i phyir tshad med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du tshad med pa yin pa'i phyir tshad med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is the application to the immeasurables because of the immeasurability of suchness.

original: dang zhes bya ba ni de la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni de la sbyor ba bkag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
translated: The word “and” is to be connected with “the application to the unapprehendable” in the root text.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni zab pa'i phyir dang / rtogs par dka' pa' phyir dang / tshad med pa'i phyir de dag la sbyor ba bkag pa'i sbyor ba gsum ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni zab pa'i phyir dang / rtogs par dka' pa' phyir dang / tshad med pa'i phyir de dag la sbyor ba bkag pa'i sbyor ba gsum ste /
translated: The three applications that are the negations of the applications to the profound, the difficult to fathom, and the immeasurable are as follows.

original: zab pa nyid du mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / rtog par dka' ba nyid du mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / tshad med pa nyid du mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: zab pa nyid du mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / rtog par dka' ba nyid du mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / tshad med pa nyid du mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application that is not an application to the profound, the application that is not an application to the difficult to fathom, and the application that is not an application to the immeasurable.

original: gang sbyor ba zab pa la sogs pas spangs pa'i phyir ngan song du yun ring du gnas nas tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas mngon par rtogs pa ni de ni tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gang sbyor ba zab pa la sogs pas spangs pa'i phyir ngan song du yun ring du gnas nas tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas mngon par rtogs pa ni de ni tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: That which is difficult to realize after a long time due to a long delay in realization because of abiding for a long time in unfortunate realms due to profound abandonment, etc. is the application that is difficult to realize after a long time.

original: lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sbyor bas ring po mi thogs par lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lung bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sbyor bas ring po mi thogs par lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: That which is called prediction is the application that is predicted because of the attainment of a prediction after a short time due to that application.

original: de ni lung bstan pa thob pa'i sbyor ba'o //🔽phyir mi ldog pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de ni lung bstan pa thob pa'i sbyor ba'o // phyir mi ldog pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: That is the application that is predicted.🔽That which is called irreversibility is the application that is irreversible because of the attainment of irreversibility.

original: phyir mi ldog pa nyid thob pa de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa nyid thob pa de ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: That is the application that is irreversible.

original: nges 'byung zhes bya ba ni yun ring por bar du gcod pa'i sa las nges par 'das pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: nges 'byung zhes bya ba ni yun ring por bar du gcod pa'i sa las nges par 'das pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: That which is called definite emergence is the application that is definitely emerging because of the definite transcendence of the level of obstruction after a long time.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: That is the application that is definitely emerging.

original: bar chad dang ldan pa ni bar chad dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bar chad dang ldan pa ni bar chad dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: That which is associated with obstacles is the application that is associated with obstacles.

original: bar chad med par lung bstan pa ni bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba'o //🔽byang chub nye dang zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir nye bar rtogs pa de ni nye bar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bar chad med par lung bstan pa ni bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba'o // byang chub nye dang zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir nye bar rtogs pa de ni nye bar mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application of uninterrupted prediction is the uninterrupted application.🔽The application of near enlightenment is the application of near complete enlightenment, because of the near realization.

original: myur ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: myur ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The application of quick enlightenment is the application of quick complete enlightenment, because of the quick enlightenment.

original: gang gi phyir ring po mi thogs par 'dis byang chub 'di rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ring po mi thogs par 'dis byang chub 'di rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of the quick realization of enlightenment by this one,

original: de ni myur bar rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ni myur bar rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: it is the application of quick complete enlightenment.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba ni gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba ni gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application of the benefit of others is the application of the benefit of others.🔽The application of the non-decrease of the aggregates, etc. is the application of the non-decrease of the aggregates, etc.

original: gang du phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med par mthong ba de ni 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med pa'i sbyor ba'o //🔽chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong //
analyzed: gang du phung po la sogs pa rnams kyi 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med par mthong ba de ni 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med pa'i sbyor ba'o // chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong //
translated: Because of the non-perception of the increase and decrease of the aggregates, etc.🔽The non-perception of dharma, non-dharma, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe chos la sogs pa nyid kyis chos rnams mi mthong @119a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe chos la sogs pa nyid kyis chos rnams mi mthong @119a * //
translated: is the non-perception of dharma, etc. by dharma, etc.

original: ba de'i tshe ni chos la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'o //🔽gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //🔽zhes bya ba ni gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bar de dag mi mthong ba ni gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa mi mthong ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ba de'i tshe ni chos la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba'o // gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong // zhes bya ba ni gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bar de dag mi mthong ba ni gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa mi mthong ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: At that time, it is the application of non-apprehending phenomena and so forth.🔽Not seeing the inconceivability of form and so on is the application of not seeing the inconceivability of form and so on.

original: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog //
translated: Not conceptualizing the signs of form and so on, and their nature, is the application of not conceptualizing the signs of form and so on, and their nature.

original: ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ni de'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa ma 'ongs pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ni de'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The nature of form and so on in the future is their nature.

original: gsum po 'di dag la stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnam par mi rtog pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag la stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnam par mi rtog pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Not conceptualizing these three as emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness is the application of not conceptualizing emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: 'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya ba'i 'bras bu rin po che de dag sbyin par byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das yum 'di nyid kyi sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu rin chen sbyin byed dang // zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya ba'i 'bras bu rin po che de dag sbyin par byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das yum 'di nyid kyi sbyor ba ste /
translated: The application of this very Mother of the Victor is the giving of the precious fruit.

original: 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pa'i sbyor ba'o ;
analyzed: 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pa'i sbyor ba'o ;
translated: The application of the precious fruit is given.

original: / dag pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma 'di nyid dag pa'i phung po'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: / dag pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma 'di nyid dag pa'i phung po'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: Purity is the application of the pure aggregates of this very Mother of the Victor.🔽The application of complete purity is

original: rnam par dag pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application of purification.

original: mtshams dang bcas zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba ni dus ji tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das yum bris pa la sogs pa 'grub pa de de tsam gyis 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams dang bcas zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba ni dus ji tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das yum bris pa la sogs pa 'grub pa de de tsam gyis 'grub pa'o //
translated: The application with a boundary is the accomplishment of the drawing of the Mother of the Victor and so forth in just that much time by which it is accomplished.

original: brtson 'grus brtan pa gang gis sbyor ba byed pa ni mtshams dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtan pa gang gis sbyor ba byed pa ni mtshams dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application with a boundary is the application by one who is diligent and steadfast.

original: de ltar 'di dag ni sbyor ba nyi shu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag ni sbyor ba nyi shu rtsa gsum mo //
