translated: Thus, these are the twenty-three applications.

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de dag rim gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de dag rim gyis gsungs te /
translated: The phrase Kausika, a bodhisattva, a great being, etc. is stated in order to show that.

original: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa'o //🔽gzugs la mi gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa zhes bya ba ni yid la byed pa'o // gzugs la mi gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase he should practice means mental attention.🔽The phrase he should not stand in form, etc. is the teaching.

original: gzugs mi gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa ste mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs mi gnas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa ste mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase he should not stand in form, etc. is the explanation, which means he should not settle down in form, etc.

original: gang gi phyir mi gnas pa de'i phyir rnal 'byor du byed pa ni sbyor ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi gnas pa de'i phyir rnal 'byor du byed pa ni sbyor ba thob pa'o //
translated: Since he does not stand in form, etc., therefore the phrase he should practice means that he should attain the yoga.

original: de ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: That is, he should practice the non-standing in form, etc.

original: koo shi ka gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi sbyor ba ming dang mtshan ma dag la'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi sbyor ba ming dang mtshan ma dag la'o //
translated: Kausika, the phrase he should not practice in form, etc. refers to names and signs.

original: de ltar na mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni yang dag par mi shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni yang dag par mi shes so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the phrase he should not stand means he should not fully understand.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom does not stand in form, etc. This is because it is non-conceptual.

original: 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa la mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application of non-application to form, etc.

original: @119b de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas zab mo zhes bya ba yan chad kyis ni zab pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: @119b de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas zab mo zhes bya ba yan chad kyis ni zab pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: Then, the Lord said, etc., up to profound.

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the Lord said, the perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zab pa ni de bzhin nyid kyis zab pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zab pa ni de bzhin nyid kyis zab pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The profundity of form, etc. is due to the profundity of suchness.

original: 'di ni zab pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zab pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application of profundity.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rtogs par dka'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rtogs par dka'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is difficult to fathom, etc. This is because form, etc. is difficult to fathom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nges par rtogs par nus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nges par rtogs par nus pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is the perfection of wisdom not able to be fathomed?

original: ci'i phyir rtogs par dka' zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtogs par dka' zhe na /
translated: Why is it difficult to understand?

original: gzung bar dka'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzung bar dka'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “difficult to grasp,” etc.

original: gang gi phyir nges pa las ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nges pa las ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Because from ascertainment there is grasping of signs.

original: de las ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de las ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: From that there is conceptualization.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is non-conceptual.

original: de'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba'o //
translated: Therefore it is difficult to understand.

original: 'di ni rtogs par dka' ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rtogs par dka' ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application of the difficulty of understanding.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa tshad med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa tshad med pa'i phyir te /
translated: “Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable,” because form, etc. are immeasurable.

original: de bas na tshad med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na tshad med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Therefore it is the application of the immeasurable.

original: gzugs zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni zab pa la mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni zab pa la mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: “Form is profound,” etc. up to “thus did he speak” is the application of non-application to the profound.

original: 'dir mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: “It does not dwell here” means non-attachment.

original: rnal 'byor du mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor du mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par mi shes pa'o //
translated: “Not practicing yoga” means not knowing correctly.

original: rnal 'byor du byed du byed pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor du byed du byed pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba ste /
translated: “Practicing yoga” means application.

original: de ni zab pa las mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / de bzhin du rtogs par dka' ba la mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / de bzhin du tshad med pa la mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zab pa las mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / de bzhin du rtogs par dka' ba la mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba dang / de bzhin du tshad med pa la mi sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: That is the application of not applying to the profound, and similarly, the application of not applying to what is difficult to realize, and similarly, the application of not applying to the immeasurable.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas rtogs pa'i sbyor ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas rtogs pa'i sbyor ba gsungs so //
translated: Having thus spoken, etc., up to “what is the offense?” teaches the application of realization after a long time with great difficulty.

original: 'dir nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
translated: Here, “what is the offense?” is the question.

original: lan ni yum chen mo dag las gsungs pa dran par byed de de nyid kyi don bsdus nas bshad pa ni de thos nas ma dad cing spong ste des na ngan song du yun ring bas tshegs chen pos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub po //
analyzed: lan ni yum chen mo dag las gsungs pa dran par byed de de nyid kyi don bsdus nas bshad pa ni de thos nas ma dad cing spong ste des na ngan song du yun ring bas tshegs chen pos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub po //
translated: Having heard that, one has no faith and rejects it, and thus one is reborn in the lower realms for a long time, and one fully awakens to highest genuine full Awakening only after a long time and with great hardship.

original: de ni tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'o //🔽de skad ces smras pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs @120a * //
analyzed: de ni tshegs chen pos yun ring po nas mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'o // de skad ces smras pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs @120a * //
translated: This is the application of slow full Awakening with great hardship.

original: pa nas lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur bar rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni lung bstan pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: pa nas lung bstan pa thob par 'gyur bar rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni lung bstan pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: The application of prediction is stated in the passage beginning with “Subhūti, if someone says…” and ending with “…one should know that one will obtain a prediction.”

original: de'i phyir gcig gam gnyis zhes bya ba ni yang dag par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig gam gnyis zhes bya ba ni yang dag par brjod pa'o //
translated: “One or two” is a correct statement.

original: gcig gam gnyis ma yin zhes bya ba ni log pa'i brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gam gnyis ma yin zhes bya ba ni log pa'i brjod pa'o //
translated: “Not one or two” is a false statement.

original: mnyes par byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mnyes par byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “One will please them” means “one will obtain them.”

original: thugs dbyung bar byed par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mgu bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thugs dbyung bar byed par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mgu bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: “He will not be disheartened” means he will be pleased.

original: ji srid thob pa zhes bya ba la phyis zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: ji srid thob pa zhes bya ba la phyis zhes bya ba ni lhag ma ste rtogs par sla'o //
translated: “For as long as he has not attained” is easy to understand.

original: de ni lung bstan pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ni lung bstan pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application with prediction.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo zhes bya ba nas bsags pa legs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo zhes bya ba nas bsags pa legs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: “Whoever, having received this deep perfection of wisdom” up to “well stored” teaches the application of the irreversible.

original: rnyed par 'gyur ba ni thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnyed par 'gyur ba ni thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “He will obtain” means he will attain.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba ni mang du'o //
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba ni mang du'o //
translated: “For the most part” means for the most part.

original: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
translated: “Adverse” means contrary.

original: g-yos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: g-yos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “He will be shaken” means he will turn back.

original: rab tu 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i tshul gyis sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i tshul gyis sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Application in the mode of engagement” means application by the method of engagement.

original: rtog pa med pa ni rab tu gnon pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa ni rab tu gnon pa'o //
translated: “Without conceptualization” means without suppression.

original: de ltar sems rab tu 'jug pa dang / rab tu gnon pa ste 'di ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar sems rab tu 'jug pa dang / rab tu gnon pa ste 'di ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba'o // bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, the application of the mind and the application of the mind to the utmost are the application of the irreversible.🔽Bhagavan, it is like this, up to in order to attain.

original: dper na zhes bya ba nas thob pa'i slad du zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba nas thob pa'i slad du zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: This teaches the application of the emergence.

original: 'di la dpag tshad brgya'i tshad yod pas na dpag tshad brgya pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la dpag tshad brgya'i tshad yod pas na dpag tshad brgya pa'o //
translated: Since it has the measure of one hundred yojanas, it is called one hundred yojanas.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application of the emergence.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba nas mnyan pa thob pa'i slad du zhes bya ba'i bar chad med pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba nas mnyan pa thob pa'i slad du zhes bya ba'i bar chad med pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: Having said this, up to in order to attain the hearing, teaches the application of the uninterrupted.

original: ldum bu ni yal ga'o //
analyzed: ldum bu ni yal ga'o //
translated: A bush is a branch.

original: ldum bu dang dri dag gis mtshan pa ni rtse mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ldum bu dang dri dag gis mtshan pa ni rtse mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The bush and scent are the peak, etc.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba ni gal te yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba ni gal te yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word also means if it is so.

original: bsnyen te zhes bya ba ni nges par phyin pa 'am thob pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen te zhes bya ba ni nges par phyin pa 'am thob pa'o //
translated: Approaching means arriving at a certain place or attaining.

original: mi ring ngo zhes bya ba yang ngo //
analyzed: mi ring ngo zhes bya ba yang ngo //
translated: Not far away means not far away from that.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application without obstacles.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba nas mgu ba skyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub dang nye ba'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste zhes bya ba nas mgu ba skyes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub dang nye ba'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One said, It is like this... up to joy arises. This teaches the application of approaching enlightenment.

original: lo ma dang 'dab ma lhags pa ni rnyings pa ste /
analyzed: lo ma dang 'dab ma lhags pa ni rnyings pa ste /
translated: Fallen leaves and branches means withered.

original: gang dag la lo ma lhags pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la lo ma lhags pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those that have fallen leaves are called that.

original: lhag ma @120b ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma @120b ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni byang chub dang nye ba'i sbyor ba'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub dang nye ba'i sbyor ba'o // bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the application of approaching enlightenment.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas khyod spobs par gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas khyod spobs par gyur to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One said, It is like this... up to you have become eloquent. This teaches the application of quickly attaining complete enlightenment.

original: sbrum ma ni sbrum ma'i bud med do //
analyzed: sbrum ma ni sbrum ma'i bud med do //
translated: A pregnant woman is a woman who is pregnant.

original: bskyod na zhes bya ba ni skyo ba'o //
analyzed: bskyod na zhes bya ba ni skyo ba'o //
translated: “To move” means to be weary.

original: snyom pa zhes bya ba ni na ba'o //
analyzed: snyom pa zhes bya ba ni na ba'o //
translated: “To be tired” means to be sick.

original: smra ba nyid ni smra ba'o //
analyzed: smra ba nyid ni smra ba'o //
translated: “To speak” means to speak.

original: yang na smra bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na smra bar byed pa'o //
translated: Or, it means to cause to speak.

original: stobs ni mthu'o //
analyzed: stobs ni mthu'o //
translated: “Power” means strength.

original: sdug bsngal ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni tshor ba'o //
translated: “Suffering” means feeling.

original: 'grogs pa ni skyes pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'o //
analyzed: 'grogs pa ni skyes pa dang lhan cig nyal ba'o //
translated: “To associate” means to sleep with a man.

original: ji ltar 'grogs pa la dad che bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'grogs pa la dad che bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one not become greatly devoted to association?

original: sngon gyi tshul bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sngon gyi tshul bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “as before,” and so on.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i rgyu'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i rgyu'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “Inappropriate attention” means the conceptualization that is the cause of passion.

original: kun du bstan pa zhes bya ba ni de bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du bstan pa zhes bya ba ni de bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “To demonstrate” means to generate that.

original: nges par bstan pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nges par bstan pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la spyod pa'o //
translated: “To teach” means to teach one who is passionate.

original: bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par phrad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par phrad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “To cultivate” means to meet properly.

original: mang du byas pas zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du de ltar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang du byas pas zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du de ltar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “To do much” means to do that again and again.

original: dga' ba ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is intense joy.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de ni myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ni myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application to quickly manifest complete enlightenment.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas chos ston par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas chos ston par 'dod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: Then, the Bhagavān, with this thought in mind, said to the venerable Śāriputra, “Śāriputra, it is like this: for example, Śāriputra, in the great ocean there is no increase or decrease of the water element, and the water element is not cut off.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan dag la phan 'dogs pa ngo mtshar du gyur pa ste /🔽ci zhig la ngo mtshar du gyur pa yin zhe na /🔽'di ltar 'di dag kho na ma yin gyi yang dag par ston pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par byed pa nas legs par yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su gzung ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan dag la phan 'dogs pa ngo mtshar du gyur pa ste / ci zhig la ngo mtshar du gyur pa yin zhe na / 'di ltar 'di dag kho na ma yin gyi yang dag par ston pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par byed pa nas legs par yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su gzung ba'i phyir dang /
translated: The water element in the great ocean is immeasurable, and the water element in the great ocean is inexhaustible.🔽Śāriputra, in the same way, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha does not think, ‘These sentient beings I should liberate from saṃsāra, and these sentient beings I should not liberate from saṃsāra.’🔽Śāriputra, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha does not think, ‘I should teach the Dharma to these sentient beings, and I should not teach the Dharma to these sentient beings.’

original: yang dag par bdag gir bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bdag gir bya ba'o //
translated: Śāriputra, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha does not think, ‘I should inspire these sentient beings to attain complete buddhahood, and I should not inspire these sentient beings to attain complete buddhahood.’🔽Śāriputra, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha does not think, ‘I should inspire these sentient beings to attain the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, or unsurpassed, complete enlightenment, and I should not inspire these sentient beings to attain the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, or unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.’🔽Śāriputra, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha does not think, ‘I should inspire these sentient beings to attain the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, or unsurpassed, complete enlightenment, and I should not inspire these sentient beings to attain the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, or unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.’🔽Śāriputra, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha does not think, ‘I should inspire

original: legs par sbyangs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po dag las mnyan pa'i phyir yang dag par gtod pa la sbyor bar byed pa'o ;🔽/ legs par yongs su gtad pa ni de la de dag bslab pa'i phyir sbyor bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: legs par sbyangs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po dag las mnyan pa'i phyir yang dag par gtod pa la sbyor bar byed pa'o ; / legs par yongs su gtad pa ni de la de dag bslab pa'i phyir sbyor bar byed pa ste /
translated: Well-trained means that he applies himself to the right entrustment in order to listen to the great bodhisattvas.

original: snying brtse ba'i phyir zhes 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: snying brtse ba'i phyir zhes 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyor ro //
translated: Well-entrusted means that he applies himself to train in that, as it will be said below, because of compassion.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla ste /
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de ni gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi don gyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: That is the application for the benefit of others.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @121a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @121a * //
translated: Subhūti said... up to practices the perfection of wisdom.

original: la spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: la spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application of non-increase and non-decrease.

original: chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba nas bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa mi mthong ba'i sbyor ba gsungs te ;
analyzed: chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba nas bsgoms pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa mi mthong ba'i sbyor ba gsungs te ;
translated: Not seeing any dharma... up to the cultivation will be completed - this teaches the application of not seeing dharma, non-dharma, and so on.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa ni mtshon pa ste /🔽dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa ni mtshon pa ste / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Dharma and non-dharma are the illustrations.🔽One does not see even the dharmas such as virtue, nonvirtue, and indeterminate, because they are empty and void.

original: de ni stong pa dang / gsog yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don te 'di ni chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'o//
analyzed: de ni stong pa dang / gsog yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don te 'di ni chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'o//
translated: This is the application to dharma, non-dharma, etc.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir mthong ba med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes bya ba nas pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir mthong ba med pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Subhūti said, etc., up to “practices the perfection” is the application of non-seeing because of inconceivability.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rin po che'i phung po'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par ni rtog pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rin po che'i phung po'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par ni rtog pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra, etc., up to “the perfection of wisdom is a heap of jewels” is the statement of the application of discrimination.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos kyang zhes bya la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyang thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos kyang zhes bya la /
translated: The qualities of a buddha are also called the qualities of an omniscient one.

original: kyang gi sgra ni chos gzhan rnams lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni chos gzhan rnams lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
translated: The word “also” means that there is no need to mention other qualities.

original: chos gzhan rnams la mi rtog ces bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: chos gzhan rnams la mi rtog ces bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: “ Not conceptualizing other qualities” means being nonconceptual.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba rnams mi rtog pa'i phyir dang / de'i mtshan ma mi snang ba'i phyir dang / gzugs la sogs pa don du gnyer ba mi mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i gzung bar bya ba rnams mi rtog pa'i phyir dang / de'i mtshan ma mi snang ba'i phyir dang / gzugs la sogs pa don du gnyer ba mi mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because one does not conceptualize objects such as form, etc., because their signs do not appear, and because one does not see the pursuit of form, etc.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnams yang dag par rig pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rnams yang dag par rig pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: This is because of the three doors of liberation, i.e., emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, respectively, which are the imagined, the perfected, and the other-dependent natures.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di nyid zab pa nyid du bstan te 'di ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di nyid zab pa nyid du bstan te 'di ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Then, beginning with “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is the heap of jewels,” he teaches just this as profound. This is the application to non-conceptuality.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rin po che'i phung po'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rin po che ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rin po che'i phung po'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu rin po che ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is the heap of jewels. The jewel of the result is perfect complete enlightenment,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i bar gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i bar gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: up to the turning of the wheel of Dharma.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu rin po che sbyin par byed pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu rin po che sbyin par byed pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application to the bestowal of the jewel of the result.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas dag pa'i phung po'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par @121b dag pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas dag pa'i phung po'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par @121b dag pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One, Subhūti said, up to the pure heap. He teaches the application to purity.

original: de dag nyid 'bras bu yin te nam mkha' bzhin du rnam par dag par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid 'bras bu yin te nam mkha' bzhin du rnam par dag par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those very [perfections] are the result, because they are seen as pure like space.

original: 'di ni rnam par dag pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par dag pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application to purity.

original: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu 'am zhes bya ba nas bar chad mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sa mtshams dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu 'am zhes bya ba nas bar chad mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sa mtshams dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba gsungs te /
translated: The passage from “Blessed One, son of good family” up to “cannot obstruct” teaches the application with its boundary.

original: bris sam zhes bya ba ni bri bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: bris sam zhes bya ba ni bri bar nus pa'o //
translated: “If one writes” means that one is able to write.

original: bri bar bya zhes bya ba ni de tsam nyid kyi dus kyis bri bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bri bar bya zhes bya ba ni de tsam nyid kyi dus kyis bri bar bya ba yin no //
translated: “One should write” means that one should write at that very time.

original: yi dam la brten par byas na bgegs med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: yi dam la brten par byas na bgegs med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If one relies on the vow, there is no obstacle. This is the intended meaning.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa 'di ga las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa 'di ga las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Why is that?” means “From where is this understanding?”

original: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: “It is like this” and so forth is the answer.

original: 'di lta bu ni chos nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'di lta bu ni chos nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: “It is like this” is the nature of things. This is the intended meaning.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni gal te yang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba ni gal te yang ngo //
translated: “However” means “even if.”

original: mi nus so zhes bya ba ni mi nus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi nus so zhes bya ba ni mi nus pa med pa'o //
translated: “Cannot” means that there is no inability.

original: yi dam ma nyams pa'i zhes bya ba ni yi dam ma zhig pa yin te de ni byang chub las ma 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yi dam ma nyams pa'i zhes bya ba ni yi dam ma zhig pa yin te de ni byang chub las ma 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “without violating the pledge” means without breaking the pledge, because that is not beyond enlightenment.

original: 'di ni mtshams dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshams dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the application that is accompanied by the boundary.

original: sbyor ba bstan nas yon tan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba bstan nas yon tan brjod par bya ste /
translated: Having taught the application, he now teaches the virtues.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /🔽bdud kyi mthu bcom la sogs pa //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las / bdud kyi mthu bcom la sogs pa //
translated: In this regard, the treatise states:

original: yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi'o //
translated: The virtues are the fourteen aspects

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te //
translated: Of the destruction of the power of Mara, and so on.

original: yon tan ni sbyor ba'i yon tan te bdud kyi mthu bcom pa la sogs pa phan yon bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni sbyor ba'i yon tan te bdud kyi mthu bcom pa la sogs pa phan yon bcu bzhi'o //
translated: The virtues are the virtues of the application, which are the fourteen benefits, such as the destruction of the power of Mara.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba nas yongs su gzung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dang po gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba nas yongs su gzung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dang po gsungs te /
translated: The first is stated in the passage beginning with the words “Then the Blessed Lady” and ending with “will be protected.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthu zhes bya ba ni des bdud kyi mthu rnam par 'joms pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthu zhes bya ba ni des bdud kyi mthu rnam par 'joms pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The phrase “the power of the Buddha” means that by it the power of Mara is destroyed.

original: nye bar mthong ba med pas 'dri ba ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar mthong ba med pas 'dri ba ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is not directly perceived, he asks, “Why is that?”

original: dgongs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi bsnyel bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dgongs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi bsnyel bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “It will be understood” means it will not be forgotten.

original: yongs su gzung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun pas bzhugs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yongs su gzung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun pas bzhugs pa'i phyir te /
translated: “It will be taken up” means it will be retained through concordance.

original: 'di ni bdud kyi mthu 'joms pa'i yon tan yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bdud kyi mthu 'joms pa'i yon tan yin no //
translated: This is the quality of conquering the power of Mara.

original: sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba nas mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi dgongs pa'i yon tan gsungs so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba nas mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi dgongs pa'i yon tan gsungs so //
translated: “ Shariputra, up to ‘I am not able’” teaches the quality of the intention of the wisdom of the Buddha.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par gzigs te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par gzigs pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par gzigs te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis rnam par gzigs pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
translated: “ Having said this” up to “he looked with the eye of the Buddha” teaches the quality of looking with the eye of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthu ni stobs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthu ni stobs so //
translated: The power of the Buddha is strength.

original: @122a * // byin gyi rlabs ni nus pa lhag par bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: @122a * // byin gyi rlabs ni nus pa lhag par bskyed pa'o //
translated: The blessing is the generation of superior ability.

original: yongs su bzung ba ni bdag gir byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba ni bdag gir byed pa'o //
translated: Possession is the state of being one's own.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan yongs su gzung ba de dag gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan yongs su gzung ba de dag gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: For what reason do they possess the Buddha's blessing and the Buddha's virtues?🔽 Therefore, it is said,

original: de'i phyir de dag ni mkhyen to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni mkhyen to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: They are known, etc.

original: mkhyen pa ni yang dag par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa ni yang dag par dgongs pa'o //
translated: Known means fully considered.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ni bdag gir mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ni bdag gir mdzad pa'o //
translated: Blessed means made one's own.

original: gzigs pa ni sha'i spyan gyis so //
analyzed: gzigs pa ni sha'i spyan gyis so //
translated: Seen means with the fleshly eye.

original: rnam par gzigs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis so //
analyzed: rnam par gzigs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis so //
translated: Seen means with the eye of a Buddha.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi rnam par gzigs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi rnam par gzigs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: This is the virtue of the Buddha's seeing.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ces bya ba nas nye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub dang nye bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag ces bya ba nas nye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub dang nye bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning Those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas and ending will become so teaches the virtue of approaching enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam gyi don du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam gyi don du'o //
translated: As it is said, for the sake of the path to perfect enlightenment.

original: 'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba'i yon tan no //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye ba'i yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality of being close to perfect complete enlightenment.

original: sh'a ri'i bu gang dag ces bya ba nas nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni don chen po la sogs pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu gang dag ces bya ba nas nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni don chen po la sogs pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning with Śāriputra, those who and ending with are present teaches the qualities of great meaning and so on.

original: don chen po zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la byang chub sems dpa'i sa'o //
analyzed: don chen po zhes bya ba ni phyi ma la byang chub sems dpa'i sa'o //
translated: Great meaning refers to the bodhisattva stage in the future.

original: phan yon chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan yon chen po ni byang chub sems dpa'i phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Great benefit refers to the excellence of the bodhisattva.

original: 'bras bu chen po ni phyi nas bla na med pa'i byang chub po //
analyzed: 'bras bu chen po ni phyi nas bla na med pa'i byang chub po //
translated: Great result refers to the unsurpassed enlightenment in the future.

original: rnam par smin pa chen po ni srid pa tha ma la rigs dang dus kyi mtshan nyid la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa chen po ni srid pa tha ma la rigs dang dus kyi mtshan nyid la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Great maturation refers to the excellence of family, time, characteristics, and so on in the final existence.

original: 'bad pa ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: Effort refers to practice.

original: yongs su g-yo ba ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su g-yo ba ni bya ba'o //
translated: Movement refers to action.

original: 'di ni don chen po la sogs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: 'di ni don chen po la sogs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality of great meaning and so on.

original: sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i mdo sde 'di dag ni zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i mdo sde 'di dag ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage beginning with Śāriputra, these sūtras endowed with the perfection of wisdom and ending with are present teaches the qualities of being the supreme of all sūtras and so on.

original: ches nyung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni yul dpyad pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
analyzed: ches nyung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni yul dpyad pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
translated: The passage up to “will be very few” teaches the good qualities of the object of analysis.

original: mdo sde zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Sūtra” refers to the Perfection of Wisdom and so on.

original: 'das nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'das nas zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: “ Passed into nirvāṇa” means completely passed into nirvāṇa.

original: bar ta ni zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs so //
analyzed: bar ta ni zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs so //
translated: “ In the east” means in the east.

original: yul dbus kyi grong khyer chen po bcu drug tu bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan na /
analyzed: yul dbus kyi grong khyer chen po bcu drug tu bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan na /
translated: When the Bhagavān taught the Dharma in the sixteen great cities of the central land,

original: de las gzhan du ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan du ji ltar 'byung zhe na /
translated: how did it spread elsewhere?

original: de'i snying po gsar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i snying po gsar du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning with “The essence of that” teaches this.🔽“ The essence of that” means the essence of the Dharma and Vinaya.

original: snying po gsar pa ni mngon par gsar pa'o //
analyzed: snying po gsar pa ni mngon par gsar pa'o //
translated: “ Newly arisen” means newly manifest.

original: gdul bya 'dis chos 'dul ba de thob par 'gyur ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gdul bya 'dis chos 'dul ba de thob par 'gyur ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is called “the Dharma and Vinaya that this disciple will obtain.”

original: bstan pa'i chos nyid @122b yin pa'i phyir chos kyang yin /
analyzed: bstan pa'i chos nyid @122b yin pa'i phyir chos kyang yin /
translated: Because it is the nature of the teaching, it is the Dharma.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa 'dul ba'i phyir 'dul ba yang yin pas chos 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa 'dul ba'i phyir 'dul ba yang yin pas chos 'dul ba'o //
translated: Because it tames afflictions and so on, it is the Vinaya. Therefore it is the Dharma and Vinaya.

original: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i dus ni lo lnga stong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i dus ni lo lnga stong ngo //
translated: The Bhagavat having passed into parinirvana, the period of the duration of the true Dharma is five thousand years.

original: de'i phyir nub pa'i dus ni de'i dus dang nye ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nub pa'i dus ni de'i dus dang nye ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the period of its disappearance is close to that period.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na dgongs so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na dgongs so zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: What will happen then? He says, “it is intended.”

original: byang phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang phyogs zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The “northern region” is for the sake of analyzing the other directions.

original: byang phyogs kyi gnas zhes bya ba ni de'i yang dbus kyi char ro //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi gnas zhes bya ba ni de'i yang dbus kyi char ro //
translated: The “northern region” is the central part of that.

original: rgyas par spyod pa ni rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas par spyod pa ni rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Extensive practice” is extensive development.

original: byang phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis lho phyogs pa la sogs pa rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang phyogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis lho phyogs pa la sogs pa rnam par dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “northern” is for the sake of analyzing the southern and other directions.

original: mang ngam zhes bya ba ni nyung ngu'i phyogs la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: mang ngam zhes bya ba ni nyung ngu'i phyogs la ltos pa'o //
translated: “Many” is in relation to the position of few.

original: shin tu mang ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par du mang ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu mang ba zhes bya ba ni khyad par du mang ba'o //
translated: “Very many” is a special many.

original: ji ltar yang zhes bya ba ni gal te yang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar yang zhes bya ba ni gal te yang ngo //
translated: “In whatever way” is also.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'dir rgyu zhes bstan pa 'grib par bshad de /
analyzed: 'dir rgyu zhes bstan pa 'grib par bshad de /
translated: Here, the teaching is explained as the cause.

original: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa dang / snying po gsar du thob pa dang / nub ba'i dus dang nye ba dang ston par byed pa nyung ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mya ngan las 'das pa dang / snying po gsar du thob pa dang / nub ba'i dus dang nye ba dang ston par byed pa nyung ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One's nirvana, the attainment of a new essence, the approach of the time of disappearance, and the few teachers.

original: de lta mod kyi 'di ni bstan pa'i stobs ni 'bri ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'di ni bstan pa'i stobs ni 'bri ba ma yin no //
translated: However, this is not a decrease in the power of the teaching.

original: 'di ni bstan pa'i stobs kyi yon tan no //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan pa'i stobs kyi yon tan no //
translated: This is the virtue of the power of the teaching.

original: theg pa la yun ring mo nas zhugs pa zhes bya ba nas skye bo mang po'i don byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dkar po'i chos yongs su rdzogs pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
analyzed: theg pa la yun ring mo nas zhugs pa zhes bya ba nas skye bo mang po'i don byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dkar po'i chos yongs su rdzogs pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning those who have long entered the vehicle up to will benefit many beings speaks of the virtue of perfecting virtuous qualities.

original: dris pa ni zhus pa'o //
analyzed: dris pa ni zhus pa'o //
translated: Questioning means asking.

original: yongs su dris pa ni de'i rgyu'o //🔽yongs su dri ba byas pa ni yongs su shes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dris pa ni de'i rgyu'o // yongs su dri ba byas pa ni yongs su shes par byas pa'o //
translated: Asking means its cause.🔽Asking means making it known.

original: yongs su shes par 'dri ba ni yongs su 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes par 'dri ba ni yongs su 'dri ba ste /
translated: Asking about what is to be known means asking about what is to be known.

original: de bzhin du byed pa'i phyir yongs su dri ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du byed pa'i phyir yongs su dri ba nyid do //
translated: Asking is the same as asking because it is done in that way.

original: dris pa'i lan btab par byas pa ni yongs su 'dri bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: dris pa'i lan btab par byas pa ni yongs su 'dri bar byas pa'o //
translated: The answer to the question is the complete question.

original: tshul khrims dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims dag ces bya ba la /
translated: As for the purity of morality,

original: mang po'i tshig ni tshogs pa'i don te /
analyzed: mang po'i tshig ni tshogs pa'i don te /
translated: the word “many” means “collection.”

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is “morality, etc.”

original: 'di ni dkar po'i chos yongs su rdzogs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: 'di ni dkar po'i chos yongs su rdzogs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality of the perfection of the good doctrine.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba nas dga' bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba nas dga' bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni /
translated: As for “why is that? ” up to “he will be happy,”

original: smra ba'i skyes bu'i yon tan gsungs te /
analyzed: smra ba'i skyes bu'i yon tan gsungs te /
translated: it explains the quality of the speaker.

original: tshe rabs 'phos kyang zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma 'das kyang yang dag par spyod pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs 'phos kyang zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma 'das kyang yang dag par spyod pa la sbyor ro //
translated: “Even if he changes his life” means that even if he passes from this life to the next, he will be connected with right practice.

original: mngon par dga' ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “He will be happy” means that he will be happy in this life.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //🔽'di ni @123a * //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o // 'di ni @123a * //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: smra ba'i skyes bu'i yon tan no //
analyzed: smra ba'i skyes bu'i yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality of the speaker.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba nas dbye ba lta ci smos zhes bya bas ni mi phyed pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba nas dbye ba lta ci smos zhes bya bas ni mi phyed pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
translated: As for “the perfection of wisdom,” up to “what need is there to mention the divisions? ” it explains the quality of indivisibility.

original: 'dun pa 'am sngags kyis zhes bya ba ni bsam pa 'am tshig gis so //
analyzed: 'dun pa 'am sngags kyis zhes bya ba ni bsam pa 'am tshig gis so //
translated: Aspiration or mantra means thought or word.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni mi phyed pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi phyed pa'i yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality of being indivisible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba nas dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni skye bo mang po'i don dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i yon tan gsungs so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba nas dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni skye bo mang po'i don dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i yon tan gsungs so //
translated: By the passage beginning Why is it so? and ending they will plant the roots of virtue, the quality of planting the roots of virtue for many people is taught.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba nas rjes su yi rang bar byas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dam bcas pa bzhin du gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba nas rjes su yi rang bar byas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dam bcas pa bzhin du gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
translated: By the passage beginning Why is it so? and ending he rejoices, the quality of accomplishing the aims of others in accordance with his vow is taught.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni yang dag par gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhug pa tsam mo //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni yang dag par gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhug pa tsam mo //
translated: Thus means in this way. Should be taken up means merely to be introduced to it.

original: yang dag par rab tu dbye bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa rab kyi mthar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dbye bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa rab kyi mthar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Should be properly analyzed means to establish it to the end of meditation.

original: gzhag par gyi'o zhes bya ba ni bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhag par gyi'o zhes bya ba ni bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: Should be set up means to teach it.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni dam bcas pa bzhin du pha rol gyi don sgrub pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: 'di ni dam bcas pa bzhin du pha rol gyi don sgrub pa'i yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality of accomplishing the aims of others in accordance with one's promise.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba nas ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'bras bu rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba nas ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni 'bras bu rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
translated: The passage from In that way up to is endowed teaches the quality of embracing a vast result.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i pha rol gyi don sgrub pa yod na'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i pha rol gyi don sgrub pa yod na'o //
translated: In that way means that when one has the accomplishment of others' aims as it has been explained,

original: mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yum chen mo las bshad pa ji lta bu ste /
analyzed: mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yum chen mo las bshad pa ji lta bu ste /
translated: one becomes endowed with a vast aspiration, as it is explained in the Great Mother.

original: de nyid mdor bsdus nas bshad pa ni de mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid mdor bsdus nas bshad pa ni de mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is summarized and explained in the passage one becomes endowed with a vast aspiration.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i chos rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa byin pa dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po mngon par 'dus byas pas /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i chos rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i sbyin pa byin pa dag ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po mngon par 'dus byas pas /
translated: One gives gifts endowed with vast form, sound, smell, taste, and textures. Through having created vast roots of virtue,

original: rnam par smin pa rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin pa ni sems can gyi don du rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin pa ni sems can gyi don du rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The quality of embracing a vast evolutionary development is that one embraces an evolutionary development for the sake of sentient beings.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu rgya chen po yongs su 'dzin pa'i yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality of embracing a vast result.

original: de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya ba nas phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rgya chen po bsgrub pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing zhes bya ba nas phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rgya chen po bsgrub pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
translated: The quality of accomplishing the vast is indicated by the passage beginning with “in their buddha-fields” and ending with “they become irreversible.”

original: gang zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “That” refers to the fact that they have a vast interest.

original: lhag par dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni kun tu 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: lhag par dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni kun tu 'gro ba'o //
translated: “Special observation” means universal.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni rgya chen po sgrub pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: 'di ni rgya chen po sgrub pa'i yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality of accomplishing the vast.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes @123b bya ba nas le'u rdzogs pa'i bar gyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug nges par thob pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes @123b bya ba nas le'u rdzogs pa'i bar gyis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug nges par thob pa'i yon tan gsungs te /
translated: The quality of attaining the six perfections is indicated by the passage beginning with “having heard this chapter” and ending with the conclusion of the chapter.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i don du ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i don du ste /
translated: For the sake of the perfections means for their sake.

original: de dag yongs su dag pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: de dag yongs su dag pa'i ched du'o //
translated: For the sake of the perfections means for their sake, for the sake of their purification.

original: don du zhes bya ba ni phan pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: don du zhes bya ba ni phan pa'i ched du'o //
translated: For the sake of means for the sake of benefit.

original: tshol zhing zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ga las rnyed snyam pa'o //
analyzed: tshol zhing zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ga las rnyed snyam pa'o //
translated: Seeking means thinking, where can I find this perfection of wisdom?

original: yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ba ni phan tshun kun tu song nas so //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ba ni phan tshun kun tu song nas so //
translated: Thoroughly seeking means going here and there.

original: tshol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'di nas rnyed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshol bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'di nas rnyed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will seek means they will find it here.

original: mdo mngon par brjod pa ni yang dag par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: mdo mngon par brjod pa ni yang dag par brjod pa'o //
translated: The sutra statement is the correct statement.

original: nye bar 'ong ba ni thag nye ba'o //🔽thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa yod na thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar 'ong ba ni thag nye ba'o // thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa yod na thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Approaching means coming near.🔽They will obtain means they will obtain it if they make an effort.

original: gzhol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa med par thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa med par thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will be inclined means they will obtain it without effort.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug nges par thob pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug nges par thob pa'i yon tan no //
translated: This is the quality of attaining the six perfections with certainty.

original: de ltar yon tan bstan nas de skad bshad pa'i sbyor ba la sems gzhag pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan bstan nas de skad bshad pa'i sbyor ba la sems gzhag pa ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Having thus taught the virtues, the mental placement in the yoga of such explanation is retention.

original: de'i yon tan ni phan yon te bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yon tan ni phan yon te bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: Its virtue is the benefit, the fourteenth.

original: 'di ni de dag yongs su brjod pa yang yin la le'u yang yin pas na yongs su brjod pa'i le'u'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag yongs su brjod pa yang yin la le'u yang yin pas na yongs su brjod pa'i le'u'o //
translated: This is the chapter that fully explains them, thus it is the chapter of full explanation.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
translated: Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines Commentary

original: slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u bcu pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u bcu pa'o /
translated: The master Ratnākaraśānti's Ornament of the Essence, called Supreme Essence,

original: // / sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa'i skyon brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / sbyor ba'i bar du gcod pa'i skyon brjod par bya ste /
translated: The faults that interrupt the yoga should be stated.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /🔽skyon ni bcu tshan bzhir bcas pa //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las / skyon ni bcu tshan bzhir bcas pa //
translated: In that regard, the treatise declares:🔽The faults are definitely understood🔽As four sets of ten,

original: drug tu nges par rtogs par bya //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: drug tu nges par rtogs par bya // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Six sets.

original: skyon bzhi bcu rtsa drug ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: skyon bzhi bcu rtsa drug ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of forty-six faults is stated.

original: de'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Lord said, “Subhūti, it is so.

original: ci tsam zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa gang zhes zur gyis 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: ci tsam zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa gang zhes zur gyis 'dri ba ste /
translated: “How much” is a roundabout question about what kind of object.

original: don gyi tshig gi sgra ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyi tshig gi sgra ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The word “object” is not to be expressed.

original: mang du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mang du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “There will be many” is the statement of the application.

original: khyad par shes par 'dod nas zhus pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par shes par 'dod nas zhus pa ni /
translated: The question with the desire to know the distinction is

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so.

original: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan te /
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan te /
translated: The answer beginning with “Subhūti” is

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bzhi bcu rtsa drug go zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i bzhi bcu rtsa drug go zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: the forty-six that will be explained.

original: 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi spyod pa nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi spyod pa nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: “Explained” means the indication of the conduct of sentient beings.

original: spobs pa ring mo zhig na 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yun ring @124a * //
analyzed: spobs pa ring mo zhig na 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yun ring @124a * //
translated: “Eloquence will arise after a long time” means that

original: mo zhi gnas pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mo zhi gnas pha rol tu phyin pa rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: after a long time, the perfection of serenity will be realized.

original: de ni spobs pa yun ring po'i skyon no //
analyzed: de ni spobs pa yun ring po'i skyon no //
translated: That is the fault of long-term eloquence.

original: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas //
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas //
translated: Subhuti, etc.

original: g-yeng bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: g-yeng bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rgod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Distraction means excitement.

original: spobs pa ha cang myur du skye ba ni thabs la mi mkhas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas nga rgyal skye ste /
analyzed: spobs pa ha cang myur du skye ba ni thabs la mi mkhas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas nga rgyal skye ste /
translated: When eloquence arises too quickly, one becomes proud because of one's roots of virtue, and one does not become skilled in means.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la brnyas pas 'di'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang mi skye zhing byang chub kyang yun ring po kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa' gzhan la brnyas pas 'di'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang mi skye zhing byang chub kyang yun ring po kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who despises others do not arise, and enlightenment is far away.

original: 'di ni spobs pa myur ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: 'di ni spobs pa myur ba'i skyon no //
translated: This is the fault of quick eloquence.

original: glal ba zhes bya ba ni kha gdangs pa lus brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: glal ba zhes bya ba ni kha gdangs pa lus brkyang ba'o //
translated: Yawning means opening the mouth and stretching the body.

original: dgod pa zhes bya ba ni gad rgyangs byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgod pa zhes bya ba ni gad rgyangs byed pa'o //
translated: Laughing means to laugh loudly.

original: steg pa zhes bya ba ni dga' bas langs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: steg pa zhes bya ba ni dga' bas langs par byed pa ste /
translated: Boasting means to stand up with joy.

original: 'di ni lus kyi las kyi skyon no //
analyzed: 'di ni lus kyi las kyi skyon no //
translated: This is the fault of physical action.

original: sems rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o //
translated: Mental distraction means not being in meditative equipoise.

original: rnam par shes pa phan tshun chags pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams ni dran par byed pa la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa phan tshun chags pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams ni dran par byed pa la /
translated: “The consciousnesses are mutually attached” means that others are reminded,

original: rang la ni dran pa mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: rang la ni dran pa mi 'thob ste /
translated: but one does not obtain mindfulness oneself.

original: lam ma yin pa tha dad pa dag la yang 'jug cing bstan pa brjod pa de 'di ni sems kyi skyon no //
analyzed: lam ma yin pa tha dad pa dag la yang 'jug cing bstan pa brjod pa de 'di ni sems kyi skyon no //
translated: One enters into different non-paths and expresses the teaching. This is a fault of the mind.

original: rab 'byor phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: rab 'byor phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: “Subhūti, mutually” and so forth.

original: co 'dri ba zhes bya ba ni phan tshun slong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: co 'dri ba zhes bya ba ni phan tshun slong bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Teasing” means mutually encouraging.

original: mig g-yeng ba ni phan tshun du'o //
analyzed: mig g-yeng ba ni phan tshun du'o //
translated: “Eye-wandering” is mutually.

original: mi mthun par gyur na zhes bya ba ni ji srid glegs bam len pa 'ongs pa de srid na tshogs pa dang ldan no zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun par gyur na zhes bya ba ni ji srid glegs bam len pa 'ongs pa de srid na tshogs pa dang ldan no zhes zer ba'o //
translated: “When they are not in agreement” means that as long as the one who comes to take the scriptures is present, they are in agreement.

original: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin pas byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin pas byas pa'o //
translated: This is done by one who is not reasonable.

original: kha ton la sogs pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: kha ton la sogs pa'i skyon no //
translated: This is the fault of recitation and so forth.

original: rab 'byor bdag gis zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gsungs te //
analyzed: rab 'byor bdag gis zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gsungs te //
translated: “Subhūti, I say” up to “one should know” is stated.

original: dang po sems bskyed pa de lta de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'o ;
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa de lta de ltar zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'o ;
translated: The first, as much as one generates mind, is as previously explained.

original: / nges par mi 'byung ba ni thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: / nges par mi 'byung ba ni thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The non-definite is the attainment.

original: 'di ni phyir phyogs pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: 'di ni phyir phyogs pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa'i skyon no //
translated: This is the fault of holding the reason for turning away.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas 'jug par sems so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas 'jug par sems so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, from thus up to one thinks of entering,

original: lus dang ngag gi nges par 'byung ba'i bslab pa mthar phyin par 'gro ba spangs nas sems dben pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi nges par 'byung ba'i bslab pa mthar phyin par 'gro ba spangs nas sems dben pa'o //
translated: the mind is isolated from the training in definite emergence of body and speech, having abandoned going to the end.

original: 'di ni rgyu mtshan nyams pa'i skyon no //🔽rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu mtshan nyams pa'i skyon no // rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas //
translated: This is the fault of the loss of the reason.🔽Subhuti, it is like this, from for example up to one should not falsely project.

original: rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la zan ni zas so //
analyzed: rlom sems su mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs pa la zan ni zas so //
translated: Food is sustenance.

original: btang ste zhes bya ba ni dor ba'o //
analyzed: btang ste zhes bya ba ni dor ba'o //
translated: Abandoned means discarded.

original: kham zhes bya ba ni kham gcig go //
analyzed: kham zhes bya ba ni kham gcig go //
translated: Morsel is one morsel.

original: lo ma dang 'dab @124b ma zhes bya ba ni lo ma'i tshogs so //
analyzed: lo ma dang 'dab @124b ma zhes bya ba ni lo ma'i tshogs so //
translated: Leaf and petal are a collection of leaves.

original: 'dab ma lta bu'i mdo sde dag la mngon par brtson pa'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma lta bu'i mdo sde dag la mngon par brtson pa'o //
translated: and the sutras that are like petals.

original: dul bar bya ba ni dbang po lnga dul bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dul bar bya ba ni dbang po lnga dul bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Discipline is for the sake of disciplining the five senses.

original: zhi bar bya ba ni sems dul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi bar bya ba ni sems dul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Pacification is for the sake of disciplining the mind.  ,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par bya ba ni yang srid pa zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par bya ba ni yang srid pa zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Parinirvana is for the sake of the exhaustion of rebirth.  ,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byed pa ni rgyu mthun pa so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byed pa ni rgyu mthun pa so //
translated: The roots of virtue are the causes.  ,

original: de'i don du sbyor ba ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i don du sbyor ba ni bya ba'o //
translated: Application for the sake of that is the action.  ,

original: des kyang rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kyang rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He should not falsely project that means that he should not falsely project the objective support.  ,

original: 'di ni gya nom pa'i ro myang ba las nyams pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: 'di ni gya nom pa'i ro myang ba las nyams pa'i skyon no //
translated: This is the fault of falling away from the enjoyment of the sublime.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste zhes bya ba nas de lta bu bdud kyi las su rig par bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /🔽snang ba ga la ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste zhes bya ba nas de lta bu bdud kyi las su rig par bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la / snang ba ga la ba ni snang ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Subhuti, it is like this...you should know these to be the deeds of Mara.  ,🔽Where there is light, there is illumination.  ,

original: brtags te zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: brtags te zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'o //
translated: Having examined, means having seen.  ,

original: kha dog dang dbyibs zhes bya ba ni mdog dang rnam pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs zhes bya ba ni mdog dang rnam pa'o //
translated: Color and shape are hue and form.

original: 'di ni theg pa mchog las nyams pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: 'di ni theg pa mchog las nyams pa'i skyon no //
translated: This is the fault of falling away from the supreme vehicle.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste zhes bya ba nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa la //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste zhes bya ba nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa la //
translated: Subhuti, it is like this...you should understand these as the works of Mara.

original: bdag gcig pu dul ba dang / zhi ba dang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: bdag gcig pu dul ba dang / zhi ba dang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: The words tamed, peaceful, and liberated are in the vocative case, following the praise.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nang du yang dag par 'jog pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nang du yang dag par 'jog pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The words this also and so on refer to the concentration of mental placement.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid dul ba dang / zhi ba dang ; yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsngags pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid dul ba dang / zhi ba dang ; yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsngags pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The words this and so on refer to the praise of self-taming, peace, and liberation.

original: de'i 'og ma rnams ni rtogs sla'o //🔽tshe 'di nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: de'i 'og ma rnams ni rtogs sla'o // tshe 'di nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: The following is easy to understand.🔽In this very life...

original: tshe 'di nyid ni thob pa'i skye ba'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid ni thob pa'i skye ba'o //
translated: In this very life refers to the birth obtained in this life.

original: len pa med pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: len pa med pa zhes bya ba ni cung zad kyang yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The phrase without appropriation means that one does not grasp anything at all.

original: skye bo so so la yod pa'i phyir rtag tu'o//
analyzed: skye bo so so la yod pa'i phyir rtag tu'o//
translated: The phrase constantly means that it is present in the individual.

original: nyin re zhing yod pa'i phyir rgyun mi 'chad pa ste de ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyin re zhing yod pa'i phyir rgyun mi 'chad pa ste de ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase without interruption means that it is present every day. The phrase because it is constant and uninterrupted means that it is present in the individual and that it is present every day.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla ste /
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de ni ched du bya ba nyams pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: de ni ched du bya ba nyams pa'i skyon no //
translated: This is the error of failing to accomplish one's purpose.

original: 'di ni bcu tshan dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bcu tshan dang po'o //
translated: This is the first group of ten.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: The passage from the sutra that begins Subhuti, it is thus and ends with the words one should know is being commented on.

original: shing mkhan zhes bya ba ni thig skud 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: shing mkhan zhes bya ba ni thig skud 'chad pa'o //
translated: The phrase the carpenter refers to the one who cuts the string.

original: ri rab kyi steng na grong khyer ba lta na sdug ces bya ba gser las grub pa de'i dbus na brgya byin gyi khang bzangs rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: ri rab kyi steng na grong khyer ba lta na sdug ces bya ba gser las grub pa de'i dbus na brgya byin gyi khang bzangs rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: In the middle of the city of Sudarśana, which is made of gold and is located on the summit of Mount Meru, there is a palace of Śakra called Vaijayanta.

original: ngos re re la yang dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu yod pa mtha' skor du dpag tshad stong yod do //
