analyzed: ngos re re la yang dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu yod pa mtha' skor du dpag tshad stong yod do //
translated: Each side is yojanas, and the circumference is yojanas.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba ni ri rab kyi phyi rol @125a * //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba ni ri rab kyi phyi rol @125a * //
translated: The sun and moon move in space at a distance of yojanas from the center of Meru.

original: gyi phyed nas nam mkha' la 'gro ste /
analyzed: gyi phyed nas nam mkha' la 'gro ste /
translated: They move in a golden circle, the diameter of which is yojanas.🔽The palace of the sun is made of a crystal-like substance; the palace of the moon is made of a substance like pure water.

original: shel gyi rang bzhin gyi gzhal med khang zlum po go rims bzhin du dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gcig dang / lnga bcu ste /
analyzed: shel gyi rang bzhin gyi gzhal med khang zlum po go rims bzhin du dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gcig dang / lnga bcu ste /
translated: The diameter of the two palaces is yojanas.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.

original: dbus thig gis bcal na de dag gi dbus pas rnam par rgyal ba'i khang bzangs kyi sa'i tshad ni shin tu che ste /🔽de'i tshad kyang bor nas de dag gi gzhal med khang gi tshad ni brjod par bya'o //🔽sprul pa ni khyad par can du bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbus thig gis bcal na de dag gi dbus pas rnam par rgyal ba'i khang bzangs kyi sa'i tshad ni shin tu che ste / de'i tshad kyang bor nas de dag gi gzhal med khang gi tshad ni brjod par bya'o // sprul pa ni khyad par can du bya ba'o //
translated: The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.

original: thob par byed pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //🔽'di ni thabs la rmongs pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: thob par byed pa ni mngon du byed pa'o //🔽'di ni thabs la rmongs pa'i skyon no //
translated: The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the south of Meru; the palace of the moon moves to the north.🔽The palace of the sun moves in the sky to the

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas de ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas de ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: up to No, Lord.

original: 'jig rten du 'khor lo bskor bas na 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten du 'khor lo bskor bas na 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: He is called wheel-turner because he turns the wheel in the world.

original: 'khor lo de yang lcags kyi ngo bo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'khor lo de yang lcags kyi ngo bo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa /
translated: And that wheel is of iron essence, with a thousand spokes,

original: lte ba dang / mu khyud dang bcas pa nam mkha' la 'gro ba ste /🔽lcags sam / zangs ma 'am /
analyzed: lte ba dang / mu khyud dang bcas pa nam mkha' la 'gro ba ste / lcags sam / zangs ma 'am /
translated: with a hub and a rim, and moves through the air.🔽 It is made of iron, copper,

original: dngul lam / gser ci rigs par ro //
analyzed: dngul lam / gser ci rigs par ro //
translated: tin, or silver, as is appropriate.

original: kha dog ni 'dzam bu na da'i 'od lta bu'o ;
analyzed: kha dog ni 'dzam bu na da'i 'od lta bu'o ;
translated: Its color is like the light of the Jyotipāla gem.

original: / dbyibs ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: / dbyibs ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Its shape is that of the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: gzi brjid ni mi thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i 'do dang 'od kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: gzi brjid ni mi thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i 'do dang 'od kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Its splendor is the power and light-circle that overpower all men.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Its miracle is its perfection.🔽 And it is called wheel because it is the cause of the enjoyment of the earth's bounty and of the prevention of its oppression.

original: rin po che sna bdun gyi khyad par ni 'khor lo rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / rta rin po che dang / bud med rin po che dang / blon po rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang /
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyi khyad par ni 'khor lo rin po che dang / glang po rin po che dang / rta rin po che dang / bud med rin po che dang / blon po rin po che dang / khyim bdag rin po che dang /
translated: The seven special precious things are the precious wheel, the precious elephant, the precious horse, the precious wife, the precious jewel, the precious steward and the precious minister.🔽

original: nor bu rin po che'o //
analyzed: nor bu rin po che'o //
translated: The seven jewels are the jewel of the wheel, the jewel of the elephant, the jewel of the horse, the jewel of the queen, the jewel of the householder, the jewel of the minister, and the jewel of the military commander.

original: bul ba ni rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: bul ba ni rmongs pa ste /
translated: Slowness is delusion.

original: yongs su mi gsal ba'i phyir dang / slo chung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yongs su mi gsal ba'i phyir dang / slo chung ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is slowness because it is not clear and it is slow.

original: de ni bul ba'i rgyu gang las byang chub 'byung ba de ni byang chub yang dag par 'byung ba'o ;
analyzed: de ni bul ba'i rgyu gang las byang chub 'byung ba de ni byang chub yang dag par 'byung ba'o ;
translated: The arising of enlightenment from that slowness is the arising of enlightenment.

original: / thob pa ni rnyed pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: / thob pa ni rnyed pa tsam gyis so //
translated: Attainment is merely the acquisition of the Dharma.

original: bsgrub pa ni thob pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa ni thob pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment is the practice of what has been attained.

original: bor ba ni spangs pa ste rgyab kyis bltas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bor ba ni spangs pa ste rgyab kyis bltas par gyur pa'o //
translated: Abandonment is the rejection of what has been attained.

original: de ni 'khor los sgyur ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir dang / sprul pa'i sku las nyams pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: de ni 'khor los sgyur ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir dang / sprul pa'i sku las nyams pa'i skyon no //
translated: This is the fault of the degeneration of the emanation body, because it is similar to the universal monarch.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: The Blessed One said, up to “you should understand these to be the deeds of Māra.”

original: ro ni rdzas drug gi dbye ba ste phan tshun 'dus pa las brgyar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro ni rdzas drug gi dbye ba ste phan tshun 'dus pa las brgyar 'gyur ro //
translated: Taste is the division of the six substances, and from their mutual combination, there are one hundred.

original: de ni kha zas ro brgya pa'o //
analyzed: de ni kha zas ro brgya pa'o //
translated: That is the food with one hundred tastes.

original: drug cu pa zhag drug cus smin pa'o //
analyzed: drug cu pa zhag drug cus smin pa'o //
translated: The sixty is the ripening of the sixty days.

original: de'i cha ni zhag drug cu'i 'bras chan no //
analyzed: de'i cha ni zhag drug cu'i 'bras chan no //
translated: Its part is the rice of the sixty days.

original: btang ba ni sems kyis so //
analyzed: btang ba ni sems kyis so //
translated: Giving is by the mind.

original: bor ba ni @125b lus kyis te de ni kha zas ro brgya pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir longs sbyong rdzogs pa'i las nyams pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: bor ba ni @125b lus kyis te de ni kha zas ro brgya pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir longs sbyong rdzogs pa'i las nyams pa'i skyon no //
translated: Discarding is by the body. That is the fault of the degeneration of the karma of complete enjoyment, because it is similar to the food with one hundred tastes.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /🔽don dam pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la / don dam pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir zab pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, it is like this, up to “you should understand these to be the deeds of Māra.”🔽It is profound because it is the supreme of the ultimate.

original: mchog tu dri ma med par snang ba'i phyir 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dri ma med par snang ba'i phyir 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: It is radiant because it appears as the supreme stainlessness.

original: 'di ni rin thang med pa'i nor bu rin po che dang chos mthun pa'i phyir chos sku las nyams pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: 'di ni rin thang med pa'i nor bu rin po che dang chos mthun pa'i phyir chos sku las nyams pa'i skyon no //
translated: This is a fault of deviating from the dharmakāya, because it is similar to a precious jewel that has no value.

original: de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das ma las /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das ma las /
translated: Then, in the Bhagavatī,

original: tshig rkang pa gnyis kyis phyin ci log lnga bkag ste /
analyzed: tshig rkang pa gnyis kyis phyin ci log lnga bkag ste /
translated: two lines refute the five errors.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, up to

original: bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: you should know these to be the deeds of Māra.

original: spobs pa mang po zhes bya ba ni gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spobs pa rnams so /
analyzed: spobs pa mang po zhes bya ba ni gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la spobs pa rnams so /
translated: Here, “many kinds of eloquence” refers to eloquence about form up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das mang po'i phyir sems 'khrul par byed pa de ni de dang de'i dngos po la spobs pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mang po'i phyir sems 'khrul par byed pa de ni de dang de'i dngos po la spobs pa'i skyon no //
translated: The Bhagavatī says that the many kinds of eloquence that confuse the mind about this and that thing are the fault of eloquence.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: Having said that, up to “you should know these to be the deeds of Māra.”

original: gang su dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yig 'brur zhes bya ba dang / med pa dag yi ge dang yi ge med pa dag la chags pa de thams cad ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: gang su dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yig 'brur zhes bya ba dang / med pa dag yi ge dang yi ge med pa dag la chags pa de thams cad ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: All those who are attached to the syllables of the perfection of wisdom, saying it is written in the letters, and to the non-existence of the letters, saying it is not written in the letters, all that is the work of Mara.

original: 'di ltar de bri bar ni mi bya ste gzugs la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bri bar ni mi bya ste gzugs la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not written, because it is free from form and so on.

original: med pa ma yin te don dam par yid pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ma yin te don dam par yid pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not non-existent, because it is truly existent ultimately.

original: yi ge ni med de chos thams cad la yi ge med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge ni med de chos thams cad la yi ge med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not in the letters, because all phenomena are without letters.

original: yi ge med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yi ge med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not without letters,

original: yi ge 'di dag gis de skyed par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yi ge 'di dag gis de skyed par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is produced by these letters.

original: 'di dag nyid kyis kyang de ston par byed pa'i phyir dang / 'di dag nyid kyis don du gnyer ba dang / khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid kyis kyang de ston par byed pa'i phyir dang / 'di dag nyid kyis don du gnyer ba dang / khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught by these very [letters], and because it is sought and understood by these very [letters].

original: de nyid ni yi ger 'dri ba la mngon par zhen pa dang / med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / yi ge la mngon par zhen pa dang / yi ge med pa la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni skyon bzhi'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni yi ger 'dri ba la mngon par zhen pa dang / med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / yi ge la mngon par zhen pa dang / yi ge med pa la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni skyon bzhi'o //
translated: Those are the four faults called attachment to the written, attachment to the nonexistent, attachment to syllables, and attachment to the absence of syllables.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yul ni mang ba la sogs pa yul brgya phrag stong gi grangs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yul ni mang ba la sogs pa yul brgya phrag stong gi grangs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, and so on. The country has many regions, with hundreds of thousands of villages.

original: grong ni khyim dang skyed mos tshal gnas pa'o //
analyzed: grong ni khyim dang skyed mos tshal gnas pa'o //
translated: The town is where the houses and gardens are located.

original: stong ngam grangs bzung ba na dam pa rnams gnas pa ni grong khyer ro //
analyzed: stong ngam grangs bzung ba na dam pa rnams gnas pa ni grong khyer ro //
translated: When a thousand or more are counted, the abode of the noble ones is the city.

original: grong khyer nyid kyi tshong pa'i lam ni grong rdal lo //
analyzed: grong khyer nyid kyi tshong pa'i lam ni grong rdal lo //
translated: The market town is the path of merchants within the city itself.

original: yul ka shi ka la sogs pa ni ljongs so //
analyzed: yul ka shi ka la sogs pa ni ljongs so //
translated: The region is Kashika and so on.

original: de'i tshogs ni yul sa @126a * //
analyzed: de'i tshogs ni yul sa @126a * //
translated: The country is the collection of those.

original: 'khor ro // rgyal po bzhugs pa'i grong khyer ni rgyal po'i pho brang ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ro // rgyal po bzhugs pa'i grong khyer ni rgyal po'i pho brang ngo //
translated: The king's palace is the city where the king resides.🔽The assembly is the gathering of the people.

original: kun bstan pa ni tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba'i snyan dang gas so //
analyzed: kun bstan pa ni tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba'i snyan dang gas so //
translated: The verse is the arrangement of syllables in a poetic composition.

original: la gcan ni sho gam gyi gnas so //
analyzed: la gcan ni sho gam gyi gnas so //
translated: The mountain is a place for collecting taxes.

original: srang ni lam po che'o //
analyzed: srang ni lam po che'o //
translated: The street is a highway.

original: khyogs ni bzhon pa'i gzhi'i //
analyzed: khyogs ni bzhon pa'i gzhi'i //
translated: The palanquin is a vehicle.

original: 'tsho ba'i don gyi yo byad ni 'tsho ba'i yo byad do //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i don gyi yo byad ni 'tsho ba'i yo byad do //
translated: The requisites for livelihood are the requisites for living.

original: de lta bu byung ba ni sngon byung ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu byung ba ni sngon byung ba'o //
translated: The former occasion is a previous occurrence.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni 'di ltar bya'o zhes bya ba ni don sna tshogs yid la byed pa rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di ltar bya'o zhes bya ba ni don sna tshogs yid la byed pa rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon no //
translated: The fault of distraction is thinking, This should be done like this.

original: 'di ni bcu tshan gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bcu tshan gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second set of ten.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor rgyal po zhes bya ba nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor rgyal po zhes bya ba nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon bstan to //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, from king up to should be known as the work of Māra, the fault of distraction is taught.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pas //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pas //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, and so on.

original: me la sogs pa thob par bya ba yid la byed pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: me la sogs pa thob par bya ba yid la byed pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon no //
translated: The fault of distraction is thinking about attaining fire and so on.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la ;
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la ;
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, and so on up to Moreover, Subhūti, and so on.

original: bar du gcod pa ni bgegs so //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa ni bgegs so //
translated: Obstacles are hindrances.

original: rnyed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa ni chos gos la sogs pa thob pa'o //
translated: Gain is the acquisition of robes, etc.

original: bkur sti ni gus par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti ni gus par byed pa'o //
translated: Honor is the act of respect.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ni snyan pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ni snyan pa'o //
translated: Verse is the pleasant.

original: de myong bar byed pa ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de myong bar byed pa ni dga' ba'o //
translated: To experience that is delight.

original: sems la gdung ba ni chos gos la sogs pa'i bar chad bya ba'i 'di ni gdung ba dang nyams su myong ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: sems la gdung ba ni chos gos la sogs pa'i bar chad bya ba'i 'di ni gdung ba dang nyams su myong ba'i skyon no //
translated: To be tormented in mind is the fault of being tormented and experiencing.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, from “Moreover, Subhuti, the bodhisattva” up to “should recognize these as the works of Mara” is stated.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ni gang yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ni gang yang ngo //
translated: Moreover means whatever.

original: thabs mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis dman pa'i byang chub la lhung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis dman pa'i byang chub la lhung ba med pa'o //
translated: Skillful means is by which one does not fall into inferior enlightenment.

original: de dag thabs la mkhas pa dang bral na mdo sde zab mo dag dang ldan yang lam de spangs pa'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: de dag thabs la mkhas pa dang bral na mdo sde zab mo dag dang ldan yang lam de spangs pa'i skyon yin no //
translated: If they are devoid of skillful means, even if they possess the profound sutras, it is the fault of abandoning that path.

original: de'i 'og tu phal cher tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phal cher tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: After that, the lack of accumulation should be stated.

original: de dag ni chos 'chad pa dang nyan pa de lhan cig tshogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni chos 'chad pa dang nyan pa de lhan cig tshogs pa med pa'o //
translated: These are the absence of the assembly of the teacher and the student together.

original: chos smra ba ni ston par byed pa'i bla ma'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba ni ston par byed pa'i bla ma'o //
translated: The Dharma teacher is the guru who teaches.

original: 'di dag la chos nyan pa'i dgongs pa yid de ni chos nyan pa ste slob ma'o //
analyzed: 'di dag la chos nyan pa'i dgongs pa yid de ni chos nyan pa ste slob ma'o //
translated: The student is the one who listens to the Dharma, who has the intention to listen to the Dharma.

original: tshogs pa'i dngos po tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i dngos po tshogs pa'o //
translated: The assembly is the assembly of the conditions.

original: de la tshig gnyis ka'i yang snyom pa zhes bya ba ni le lo'o //
analyzed: de la tshig gnyis ka'i yang snyom pa zhes bya ba ni le lo'o //
translated: There, the two words “lazy” and “sloth” are synonyms.

original: bya ba mang po dang ldan pa ni khyim gyi ste /
analyzed: bya ba mang po dang ldan pa ni khyim gyi ste /
translated: Having many activities is the householder’s life.

original: de yang le lo nyid do //
analyzed: de yang le lo nyid do //
translated: That is also laziness.

original: 'dun pa dang snyom las kyis tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang snyom las kyis tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: The assembly is not complete because of desire and laziness.🔽Then, the two words “furthermore” are stated.

original: de nas gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis gsungs pa @126b la tha na zhes bya ba ni gzhan med kyang ye shes rtse bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis gsungs pa @126b la tha na zhes bya ba ni gzhan med kyang ye shes rtse bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The word “at least” means that even if there is no other, one should wish for the peak of wisdom.

original: sgra shes pa'i phyir rtogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sgra shes pa'i phyir rtogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Because of knowing the words, one is endowed with realization.

original: don shes pa'i phyir blo dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: don shes pa'i phyir blo dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Because of knowing the meaning, one is endowed with intelligence.

original: gnyis ka 'dzin pa'i phyir dran pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka 'dzin pa'i phyir dran pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Because of grasping both, one is endowed with mindfulness.

original: btang ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: btang ba zhes bya ba ni 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Giving” means “going.”

original: sbyin smos pa byas na khyad par shes pa'i phyir mgo smos pas go ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin smos pa byas na khyad par shes pa'i phyir mgo smos pas go ba'o //
translated: The one who understands through a mere indication is known as the one who understands through a mere indication because he understands the distinction.

original: cung zad rnam par bshad pas ma lus par shes pa'i phyir rnam par spros pas go ba'o //
analyzed: cung zad rnam par bshad pas ma lus par shes pa'i phyir rnam par spros pas go ba'o //
translated: The one who understands through elaboration is known as the one who understands through elaboration because he understands the whole through a little explanation.

original: mi shes pa ni tshig lhur len pa ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni tshig lhur len pa ste /
translated: The one who does not understand is the one who is intent on the letter.

original: des kyang gang brjod pa de nyid shes kyi lhag ma ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang gang brjod pa de nyid shes kyi lhag ma ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: He understands only what is expressed, not the rest.

original: tshogs dang mi ldan pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshogs dang mi ldan pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four who are not endowed with the assembly:

original: yul gzhan du 'gro bar 'dun pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang / mgo smos pas go ba ma yin pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang / rnam par spros pas go ba ma yin pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang / mngon par mi shes pa ma yin pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'gro bar 'dun pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang / mgo smos pas go ba ma yin pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang / rnam par spros pas go ba ma yin pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang / mngon par mi shes pa ma yin pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: the one who is not endowed with the assembly because of his desire to go to another place, the one who is not endowed with the assembly because he does not understand through a mere indication, the one who is not endowed with the assembly because he does not understand through elaboration, and the one who is not endowed with the assembly because he is not one who does not understand.

original: 'di ni bcu tshan gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bcu tshan gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third group of ten.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, etc.

original: zang zing ni rdzas so //
analyzed: zang zing ni rdzas so //
translated: Material things are substances.

original: de lhur len pa ni zang zing 'di dag la 'du ba ni lhur len pa'o //
analyzed: de lhur len pa ni zang zing 'di dag la 'du ba ni lhur len pa'o //
translated: To be intent on them is to be intent on these material things.

original: chos gos la sogs pa lhur len pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa lhur len pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: To be intent on robes, etc. is the same.

original: ci tsam gyis rang nyid 'tsho ba de tsam 'dod pa ni 'dod pa chung ba'o //
analyzed: ci tsam gyis rang nyid 'tsho ba de tsam 'dod pa ni 'dod pa chung ba'o //
translated: To desire only what is necessary for one's own livelihood is to have few desires.

original: chog shes pa ni nor mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: chog shes pa ni nor mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: To be satisfied is to not desire wealth.

original: khyim na gnas pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rab tu dben pa'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir rab tu dben pa'o //
translated: To be secluded is to have no connection with householders.

original: de yan chad kyis ni rab tu byung ba la sbyin pa'i nus pa med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de yan chad kyis ni rab tu byung ba la sbyin pa'i nus pa med pa bstan to //
translated: Up to here it has been shown that the renunciate has no ability to give.

original: yang na sbyin par mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni ser snas bzung ba'i phyir nor yod kyang ngo //
analyzed: yang na sbyin par mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni ser snas bzung ba'i phyir nor yod kyang ngo //
translated: Or, not wanting to give means that even though one has wealth, one does not give because one is seized by avarice.

original: de ni zang zing don du gnyer la sbyin pa don du mi gnyer ba'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zang zing don du gnyer la sbyin pa don du mi gnyer ba'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: This is the absence of the collection of those who do not desire to give, who desire material things, but do not desire to give.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba nas bdud kyi las su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la //
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, up to: you should know these to be the works of Mara.

original: dad pa ni dad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni dad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Faith is the faith in the Dharma.

original: de las nyan par byed pa ni sgra'o //
analyzed: de las nyan par byed pa ni sgra'o //
translated: From that, the listening is the sound.

original: khong du chud par byed pa ni don no //
analyzed: khong du chud par byed pa ni don no //
translated: The understanding is the meaning.

original: nor sbyin par 'dod pa ni nor yongs su gtong bar 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: nor sbyin par 'dod pa ni nor yongs su gtong bar 'dod pa ste /
translated: The desire to give wealth is the desire to give the wealth.

original: ltos pa ni med par sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa ni med par sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The lack of regard is the giving without regard.

original: chos smra ba ni 'chad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos smra ba ni 'chad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The Dharma teacher will not explain the Dharma.

original: dad pa / med pa nyid kyi phyir ram nor mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ram //
analyzed: dad pa / med pa nyid kyi phyir ram nor mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir ram //
translated: Because of the lack of faith, or because of the lack of desire for wealth,

original: chos de la ser sna byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de la ser sna byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because of the stinginess with regard to the Dharma.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa ste /
translated: These three are not in harmony.🔽Because of the lack of faith, there is a lack of harmony.

original: dad pa med pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang / sbyin pa don du gnyer ba la len nga @127a * //
analyzed: dad pa med pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang / sbyin pa don du gnyer ba la len nga @127a * //
translated: Because of the lack of desire for the gift, there is a lack of harmony.

original: don du mi gnyer ba'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang / nyan par 'dod pa la chos chen po la ser sna byed pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: don du mi gnyer ba'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang / nyan par 'dod pa la chos chen po la ser sna byed pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: Because of the stinginess with the great Dharma for one who desires to listen, there is a lack of harmony.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, etc.

original: mdo sde dag ces bya ba ni gang mnyan par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde dag ces bya ba ni gang mnyan par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The “Sūtras” are those that one wishes to hear.

original: chos kyi bar chad ces bya ba ni chos kyis phongs pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi bar chad ces bya ba ni chos kyis phongs pa ste /
translated: “Obstruction to the Dharma” is the lack of Dharma.

original: skye pa snga mar dam pa'i chos spong pa de 'do la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye pa snga mar dam pa'i chos spong pa de 'do la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the presence in that person of the rejection of the holy Dharma in a previous birth.

original: chos kyi bar chad du gyur pa de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi bar chad du gyur pa de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: That very thing is the “obstruction to the Dharma.”

original: med pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par med pa'o //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par med pa'o //
translated: “Nonexistent” means not real.

original: mi 'jug pa ni gzhan 'ong bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'jug pa ni gzhan 'ong bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Not engaged” means not coming.

original: chos smra ba la ma thob pa zhes bya pa ni chos smra ba la thob par ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba la ma thob pa zhes bya pa ni chos smra ba la thob par ma gyur pa'o //
translated: “Not obtaining” the Dharma preacher means not becoming one with the Dharma preacher.

original: bzlog pa ni gtang ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni gtang ba'o //
translated: “The opposite” means giving up.

original: mdo sde med na de don du gnyer bas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde med na de don du gnyer bas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: “Without the Sūtras” means not having the collection of them for the sake of that.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, etc.

original: gang nyan mi 'dod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan la chags pas so //
analyzed: gang nyan mi 'dod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan la chags pas so //
translated: “One who does not wish to hear” is one who is attached to other Dharmas.

original: de'i phyir 'dir ni 'dun pa dang le los tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir ni 'dun pa dang le los tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa ste /
translated: Therefore, here, it is the non-possession of the assembly of aspiration and laziness.

original: gzhan la 'dun pa dang mi 'dun pa'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la 'dun pa dang mi 'dun pa'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: It is the non-possession of the assembly of aspiration and non-aspiration for others.

original: de nas gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gnyid dang lus lci ba'i 'dun pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gnyid dang lus lci ba'i 'dun pas tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: Then, the two words “Subhūti, moreover” indicate the non-possession of the assembly of sleep and the aspiration for heaviness of body.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal gyis 'jig pas srid pa'i sdug bsngal gyi skyon no //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal gyis 'jig pas srid pa'i sdug bsngal gyi skyon no //
translated: The words “Subhūti, moreover” and so on indicate the fault of existence, the suffering of existence, due to being destroyed by the suffering of the lower realms.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsungs pa la /
translated: The words “Subhūti, moreover” and so on were spoken.

original: bde 'gro'i bde ba yang sdug bsngal ba'i phyir srid pa la rgyab kyis ma bltas pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: bde 'gro'i bde ba yang sdug bsngal ba'i phyir srid pa la rgyab kyis ma bltas pa'i skyon no //
translated: Because even the happiness of the higher realms is suffering, there is the fault of not turning away from existence.

original: de nas gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni gcig pu dang 'khor lhur len pa'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang / bsnyen par mi byed pa de dag la skabs mi 'byed pa'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni gcig pu dang 'khor lhur len pa'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang / bsnyen par mi byed pa de dag la skabs mi 'byed pa'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa dang /
translated: Then, again, the words “Subhuti, furthermore” and so on indicate the lack of the assembly of those who are devoted to solitude and to retinues, and the lack of the assembly of those who do not attend upon them.

original: mu ge la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mu ge la sogs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: They do not go to places such as famine, and they do not not go.

original: de la gcig pu dang 'khor lhur len pa'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa ni bcu tshan bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de la gcig pu dang 'khor lhur len pa'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa ni bcu tshan bzhi pa'o //
translated: Therein, the lack of the assembly of those who are devoted to solitude and to retinues is the fourth group of ten.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig gis ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig gis ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / mi 'gro ba'i tshogs pa dang mi ldan pa gsungs so //
translated: Again, with one word, “Subhuti, furthermore,” he speaks of the lack of the assembly of those who go to and do not go to places of danger.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor dge slong chos smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyim @127b la lta ba dang / bya ba mang bas chos nyan pa spong ba'i skyon gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor dge slong chos smra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyim @127b la lta ba dang / bya ba mang bas chos nyan pa spong ba'i skyon gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, a monk who is a Dharma teacher... and so on, explains the fault of abandoning Dharma listeners due to looking at the household and having many activities.

original: de ltar de la sogs pa'i bdud kyi las mang po rtogs par byas nas rnam par spang bar byas te /
analyzed: de ltar de la sogs pa'i bdud kyi las mang po rtogs par byas nas rnam par spang bar byas te /
translated: Thus, having understood these and other many deeds of Māra, one should abandon them.

original: bdud de dag kyang de dag la mngon bar brtson bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdud de dag kyang de dag la mngon bar brtson bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that those Māras will also be diligent in that,

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dge sbyong gi cha byad kyis gzhung lugs 'bral bar byed pa'i skyon gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dge sbyong gi cha byad kyis gzhung lugs 'bral bar byed pa'i skyon gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, in that way... and so on, explains the fault of separating from the scriptural tradition with the guise of an ascetic.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdud rang nyid kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du sprul nas zab mo'i chos spyod pa rnams byang chub dman par lung ston pa'i skyon gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bdud rang nyid kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun dang bcas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi cha byad du sprul nas zab mo'i chos spyod pa rnams byang chub dman par lung ston pa'i skyon gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti... and so on, explains the fault of Māra himself manifesting in the guise of a Buddha with the assembly of monks and prophesying the lesser enlightenment of those who practice the profound Dharma.

original: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba nas le'u rdzogs kyi bar gyis ni don bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba nas le'u rdzogs kyi bar gyis ni don bzhi gsungs te /
translated: The passage from Subhuti, in that way... up to the end of the chapter explains four topics:

original: bdud kyi las mang po dang / de'i rgyu rnas dang bdud la sogs pa las nyan pa dang / blo chung ngu la sogs pa yid ches par byed pa dang / bdud ji ltar de dag la mngon par brtson par byed pa de ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang yongs su 'dzin par mdzad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdud kyi las mang po dang / de'i rgyu rnas dang bdud la sogs pa las nyan pa dang / blo chung ngu la sogs pa yid ches par byed pa dang / bdud ji ltar de dag la mngon par brtson par byed pa de ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang yongs su 'dzin par mdzad pa ma yin no //
translated: the many deeds of Mara, the causes of those, how Mara and so forth listen to the perfection of wisdom, and how the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas do not take care of those who are small-minded and so forth, who are devoted to Mara, and who are engaged in the deeds of Mara.

original: de ni bdud kyi las bzhi bcu rtsa drug ste /
analyzed: de ni bdud kyi las bzhi bcu rtsa drug ste /
translated: There are forty-six deeds of Mara.

original: bdud kyi las nyid bar du gcod pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las nyid bar du gcod pa'o //
translated: The deeds of Mara themselves are obstacles.

original: de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ni de'i le'u'o //
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u ni de'i le'u'o //
translated: A chapter that clarifies that is a chapter on that.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel slob dpon rin chen byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba la le 'u bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel slob dpon rin chen byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba la le 'u bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: This is the eleventh chapter of the commentary on the perfection of wisdom in eight thousand lines called Heart of the Perfection of Wisdom, composed by the master Ratnākaraśānti.

original: // / skyon bstan nas /
analyzed: // / skyon bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the faults,

original: mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The characteristics of the four truths will now be explained.🔽

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise states:

original: gang gis mtshon te mtshan nyid du //
analyzed: gang gis mtshon te mtshan nyid du //
translated: What is indicated is the definition.🔽The object of knowledge, consciousness,

original: shes bya de yang shes pa dang // khyad par byed dang rnam gsum dang // mtshon bya ngo bo nyid gang yang //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: shes bya de yang shes pa dang // khyad par byed dang rnam gsum dang // mtshon bya ngo bo nyid gang yang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: distinctions, the three types, and the🔽nature of what is indicated

original: gang gis mtshon par byed pa de ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang gis mtshon par byed pa de ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: What is indicated is the definition.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: That is also threefold:

original: shes pa dang / khyad par dang / byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / khyad par dang / byed pa'o //
translated: consciousness, distinctions, and function.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The nature of the definition is fourfold:

original: de las dang po shes pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de las dang po shes pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: First, consciousness will be discussed.

original: de la re zhig thams cad shes pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la re zhig thams cad shes pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In this regard, all consciousnesses are considered in terms of the following.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang // 'jig rten 'jig med bdag nyid dang // sems can sems kyi spyod pa dang // de bsdus pa dang phyir bltas dang // mi zad pa yi rnam pa dang // chags bcas sogs dang rgya chen @128a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang // 'jig rten 'jig med bdag nyid dang // sems can sems kyi spyod pa dang // de bsdus pa dang phyir bltas dang // mi zad pa yi rnam pa dang // chags bcas sogs dang rgya chen @128a * //
translated: The Tathagata’s appearance, the world’s non-destruction, the nature of sentient beings, the mind’s activity, its inclusion, its turning away, its inexhaustibility, its aspects of being associated with attachment, etc.,

original: dang // chen por gyur dang tshad med dang // rnam shes bstan du med pa dang // sems ltar med dang shes pa de //
analyzed: dang // chen por gyur dang tshad med dang // rnam shes bstan du med pa dang // sems ltar med dang shes pa de //
translated: its vastness, its greatness, its immeasurability, its non-representation, its non-existence like the mind, and its consciousness,

original: gyo ba la sogs shes bya dang // de las gzhan yang de dag ni //
analyzed: gyo ba la sogs shes bya dang // de las gzhan yang de dag ni //
translated: its knowledge of movement, etc., and also its otherness,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes //
translated: are known as the suchness of consciousness.

original: thub pa de bzhin nyid rtog dang // gzhan bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di //🔽thams cad shes pa nyid skabs kyis //
analyzed: thub pa de bzhin nyid rtog dang // gzhan bstan pa zhes bya ba 'di // thams cad shes pa nyid skabs kyis //
translated: The Sage’s suchness, the suchness of the other, and the teaching,🔽are included in the knowledge of the path.🔽The knowledge of the path is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin // zhes gsungs te /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: shes pa smos pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes pa smos pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is included in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽The

original: bcom ldan 'das ma las de bzhin gshegs ba'i ye shes skyes te de'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas 'jig rten kun rdzob ston par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma las de bzhin gshegs ba'i ye shes skyes te de'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas 'jig rten kun rdzob ston par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavati declares: “The Tathagata’s wisdom is born from that, therefore, the Bhagavat, etc., up to, teaches the conventional of the world.”

original: de la dang po dpe ni bdag gir byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: de la dang po dpe ni bdag gir byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: Therein, the first example is stated up to, “he appropriates.”

original: man par gyur na zhes bya ba ni man par gyur pa yod na'o //
analyzed: man par gyur na zhes bya ba ni man par gyur pa yod na'o //
translated: “If it is injured” means if it is injured.

original: reg pa la gnas pa ni reg pa la spyod pa'o// mi bde ba ni yid du ming 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: reg pa la gnas pa ni reg pa la spyod pa'o// mi bde ba ni yid du ming 'ong ba ste /
translated: “It abides in contact” means it experiences contact. “Unpleasant” means disagreeable.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of suffering.

original: legs par bzung bas 'dzin pa ni gso ba legs par goms pa ci nas kyang nyams brta bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: legs par bzung bas 'dzin pa ni gso ba legs par goms pa ci nas kyang nyams brta bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Well-grasped retention” means the well-practiced retention that is firm in every way.

original: sba ba ni srung ba'o //
analyzed: sba ba ni srung ba'o //
translated: “Protection” means guarding.

original: bcos pa ni dag par byed pa ste nad sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcos pa ni dag par byed pa ste nad sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Treatment” means purification, because it removes illness.

original: sdug bsngal gyi reg pa 'am zhes pa la dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa'i 'dus pa las byung ba ni reg pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi reg pa 'am zhes pa la dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa'i 'dus pa las byung ba ni reg pa ste /
translated: The contact of suffering is the contact that arises from the union of sense faculty, object, and consciousness.

original: de yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pas sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pas sdug bsngal lo //
translated: It is suffering because it is the cause of suffering.

original: mig la zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: mig la zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The eye is the fifth.

original: ye 'drog ni mi rnams kyi phyi nas 'byung ba'i glog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye 'drog ni mi rnams kyi phyi nas 'byung ba'i glog la sogs pa'o //
translated: Misfortune is lightning, etc. that occur after people.

original: bdag gir byed pa ni bdag gir byed pas so//
analyzed: bdag gir byed pa ni bdag gir byed pas so//
translated: It is appropriation because it appropriates.

original: dgongs te zhes bya ba de ga las shes she na /
analyzed: dgongs te zhes bya ba de ga las shes she na /
translated: Why is it known that this is the intention?

original: gang yang de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang yang de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “Whatever is said,” etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sha kya thub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni sha kya thub pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata is Shakyamuni.

original: gang zhes bya ba sha kya thub pa de kho na ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba sha kya thub pa de kho na ma yin pa'o //
translated: Whatever is not just Shakyamuni.

original: bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni yod pa'o //
analyzed: bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni yod pa'o //
translated: Exists means is.

original: 'tsho ba ni yang dag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba ni yang dag par gnas pa'o //
translated: Life is right living.

original: gzhes pa ni sku tshe ji srid yod pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gzhes pa ni sku tshe ji srid yod pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Abides means for as long as life lasts.

original: dgyes pa thob cing dgos pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dgyes pa thob cing dgos pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of attaining delight?

original: ji nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: How? etc.

original: yum ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yum ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the Mother?

original: de'i phyir skyed pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyed pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, the generator.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa 'di'i ston pa ni thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa 'di'i ston pa ni thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The Teacher of this Omniscience is the one who causes it to be obtained.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni skyed pa nyid do//
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni skyed pa nyid do//
translated: Thus means just as the generator.

original: @128b 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba shes pa ste dang po'o //
analyzed: @128b 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba shes pa ste dang po'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the arising of the Tathagata, the first.

original: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa las de'i phyir zhus pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ston par byed pa'o zhes gsungs pa las de'i phyir zhus pa ni /
translated: It is said that this world is taught. Therefore, the question is asked:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One said, Action, etc.

original: lan ni de slad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni de slad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is: Therefore, it is said, etc.

original: 'jig rten zhes gsungs pa ni 'jig rten pa ni rnam par 'jig pa'o //🔽slad cig ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa ni rgyun 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes gsungs pa ni 'jig rten pa ni rnam par 'jig pa'o // slad cig ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa ni rgyun 'gag pa ste /
translated: The world is said to be disintegrating because it is perishable.

original: 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'jig rten no //
translated: Since it is not later, disintegration is the cessation of the continuum, which is the world.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten ston pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten ston pa yin /
translated: How is the world taught?

original: gal te 'jig pa de 'jig rten yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa de 'jig rten yin na /
translated: If disintegration is the world,

original: de 'di las khyad par ci zhig yod ces bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de 'di las khyad par ci zhig yod ces bya bar dgongs so //
translated: What is the difference between that and this?

original: ji ste de yang ston par byed pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten pa'i don las gzhan pa gang gi phyir lhag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ste de yang ston par byed pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten pa'i don las gzhan pa gang gi phyir lhag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is said that it is a teacher, it is something other than the meaning of worldly things, and therefore it is called “superior.”

original: lam ni rab 'byor mi 'jig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lam ni rab 'byor mi 'jig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The path is stated in “Subhūti, it is not destroyed,” and so on.

original: 'o na 'di phan tshun 'gal pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di phan tshun 'gal pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Well, isn’t this a contradiction?

original: mi 'jig rab tu mi 'jig pas na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mi 'jig rab tu mi 'jig pas na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is stated, “It is not destroyed, it is not utterly destroyed.”

original: de bas na 'jig rten dang 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten dang 'gal ba med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction with the world.

original: gang gi phyir 'do yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'do yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: And this should be applied:

original: 'jig rten na ni phung po lnga po de dag go //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni phung po lnga po de dag go //
translated: In the world, those are the five aggregates.🔽The perfection of the tathāgatas is not destroyed, it is not utterly destroyed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi 'jig rab tu mi 'jig pa yin no zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi 'jig rab tu mi 'jig pa yin no zhes ston pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhus pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhus pa'o //
translated: Why is that? and so on is the question.

original: rab 'byor phung po lnga po rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: rab 'byor phung po lnga po rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The answer to that is stated in the passage beginning with “Subhūti, the five aggregates are also empty of the five aggregates.”

original: stong pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rab 'byor mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rab 'byor mtshan ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Just as with emptiness, so also with the signless, etc.

original: ji ltar mi 'jig ces gsungs pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'jig ces gsungs pa la /
translated: How is it that they are not destroyed?

original: de'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug bsdu pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug bsdu pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the conclusion is stated in the passage beginning with “just as, Subhūti.”

original: 'jig rten shes pa de ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten shes pa de ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the world is the second.

original: sems can sems kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems can dpag tu med pa tshad med pa'i spyod pa shes pa bstan te /
analyzed: sems can sems kyi spyod pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems can dpag tu med pa tshad med pa'i spyod pa shes pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the activities of the minds of sentient beings” indicates the knowledge of the activities of sentient beings, which is immeasurable and limitless.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa shes pa med par ni de med de /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa shes pa med par ni de med de /
translated: For without the knowledge of immeasurable and limitless sentient beings, that knowledge would not exist.

original: de bas na rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa shes pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de bas na rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa shes pa bstan nas /
translated: Therefore, the passage beginning with “Furthermore, Subhūti” indicates the knowledge of immeasurable and limitless sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ye shes de'i spyod pa shes pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ye shes de'i spyod pa shes pa gsungs te /
translated: The passage beginning with “Furthermore, Subhūti” indicates the knowledge of the activities of that knowledge.

original: de la ji ltar sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa shes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa shes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that he knows the immeasurable, incalculable sentient beings?

original: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid ni dngos po med pa yin pas tshad med grangs med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de kho na nyid ni dngos po med pa yin pas tshad med grangs med pa'o //
translated: Because reality is non-existent, it is immeasurable and incalculable.

original: ji ltar sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa yin zhe na /🔽sems can med pa de dag gi spyod @129a * //
analyzed: ji ltar sems kyi spyod pa mkhyen pa yin zhe na / sems can med pa de dag gi spyod @129a * //
translated: How is it that he knows the activities of the mind?

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those sentient beings are non-existent, their activities are non-existent.

original: sems can rnams kyi 'jig rten yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'jig rten yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten ston par byed pa'o //
translated: He is the teacher of the world because sentient beings are the world.

original: sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa'i spyod pa shes pa de ni gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can tshad med dpag tu med pa'i spyod pa shes pa de ni gsungs pa'o //
translated: That knowledge of the activities of immeasurable, incalculable sentient beings is the teaching.

original: de bsdus pa dang phyir bltas dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bsdus pa dang phyir bltas dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the collected and the distracted.

original: phyir bltas pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: phyir bltas pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: Distracted means scattered.

original: de'i sems bsdus pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bltas pa ni de bsdus pa dang phyir bltas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sems bsdus pa dang bcas pa'i phyir bltas pa ni de bsdus pa dang phyir bltas pa'o //
translated: Because his mind is collected and distracted, it is the collected and the distracted.

original: de'i phyir sems kyis bsdus pa dang rnam par g-yeng ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyis bsdus pa dang rnam par g-yeng ba shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the knowledge of the collected and the distracted mind.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis gsungs pa la /
translated: Furthermore, the two phrases beginning with “Subhūti” are stated.

original: bsdus pa ni zad pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa ni zad pa'o //
translated: The “contracted” is the exhausted.

original: g-yengs pa ni mi zad pa ste de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'o //
analyzed: g-yengs pa ni mi zad pa ste de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'o //
translated: The “distracted” is the inexhaustible, and that is known just as it is.

original: bsdus pa ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa ste de yang zad pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsdus pa ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin du gnas pa ste de yang zad pa nyid do //
translated: The “contracted” is the nature of wisdom, and that is also exhausted.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin de yang mi zad pa ste mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin de yang mi zad pa ste mi zad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The nature of mind is also inexhaustible, because of being inexhaustible.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas bsdus pa ni zad pa nyid du /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas bsdus pa ni zad pa nyid du /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata knows just as it is that the contracted is exhausted,

original: g-yengs bzhi mi zad pa nyid du /🔽yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen to //
analyzed: g-yengs bzhi mi zad pa nyid du / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen to //
translated: and the distracted is inexhaustible.🔽The “nature of phenomena” and so on.

original: chos nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la chos nyid la ltos nas rnam par g-yeng ba ste /
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la chos nyid la ltos nas rnam par g-yeng ba ste /
translated: The “distracted” is in dependence on the nature of phenomena,

original: phyi rol du bltas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du bltas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it looks externally.

original: rab tu mkhyen pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu mkhyen pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid la ltos pa'o //
translated: “Thoroughly knowing” is in dependence on its own characteristic.

original: de ji lta bu zhe na mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na mi zad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: How is that? It is said “inexhaustible” and so on.

original: mi zad pa ni zad pa med pa'o//
analyzed: mi zad pa ni zad pa med pa'o//
translated: Inexhaustible means not exhausted.

original: rnam par mi zad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par mi zad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it exhausted,

original: de bas na sems bsdus pa med pa ni rnam par g-yengs ba ste de med do //
analyzed: de bas na sems bsdus pa med pa ni rnam par g-yengs ba ste de med do //
translated: Therefore, the undistracted mind is not distracted, and that does not exist.

original: g-yengs ba med pa yang ga las shes na /
analyzed: g-yengs ba med pa yang ga las shes na /
translated: How is it known that there is no distraction?

original: mtshan nyid med pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be without characteristics.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is empty of its own characteristic.

original: sems bsdus pa dang g-yengs pa shes pa de ni bzhi ba'o //
analyzed: sems bsdus pa dang g-yengs pa shes pa de ni bzhi ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of the distracted and undistracted mind is the fourth.

original: mi zad pa'i rnam pa dang zhes bstan bcos las 'don pa ni /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i rnam pa dang zhes bstan bcos las 'don pa ni /
translated: The treatise declares the aspect of inexhaustibility,

original: yum chen mo dag las bshad do //
analyzed: yum chen mo dag las bshad do //
translated: which is explained in the Great Mother sutras.

original: 'di ni dpag tu med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / mi zad pa zhes bya brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ni dpag tu med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / mi zad pa zhes bya brjod de /
translated: This is called immeasurable, limitless, and inexhaustible.

original: sems dpag tu med pa dang / mi zad pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni gzhan las rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems dpag tu med pa dang / mi zad pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni gzhan las rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The explanation of this immeasurable and inexhaustible mind is stated in the sutra beginning with Subhuti...

original: ji ltar na zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
translated: How? is the question.

original: rab 'byor de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no// byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba ni nam yang mig nas pa ma yin pa ste chos nyid ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nas zhes bya ba'i don du dgongs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no// byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba ni nam yang mig nas pa ma yin pa ste chos nyid ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa nas zhes bya ba'i don du dgongs so //
translated: “Empowerment” means never being without the eye of Dharma. The intended meaning of “beginningless and endless” is reality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dus byas kyi @129b mtshan nyid med pas skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dus byas kyi @129b mtshan nyid med pas skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, since it is not a characteristic of the conditioned, it is without arising and ceasing.

original: gnas med pa dang / rten med pa ni de la dbang po drug gi bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas med pa dang / rten med pa ni de la dbang po drug gi bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without location and without support because the six sense faculties do not operate there.

original: tshad med pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o// zad pa med pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa'o// zad pa med pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable because it is limitless. It is inexhaustible because it is endless.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni byin gyi rlabs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni byin gyi rlabs la sogs pa'o //
translated: “By whom” refers to empowerment and so forth.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar nam mkha' dpag tu med cing mi zad pa ni de bzhin du sems kyang ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar nam mkha' dpag tu med cing mi zad pa ni de bzhin du sems kyang ngo //
translated: As for “space” and so forth, just as space is immeasurable and inexhaustible, so too is the mind.

original: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is “Subhūti, thus” and so forth.

original: gzhal du med pa dang mi zad pa shes pa de ni lnga ba'o //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa dang mi zad pa shes pa de ni lnga ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of the immeasurable and inexhaustible is the fifth.

original: gzhal du med pa dang mi zad pa zhes bya ba'i sgas ni ma gsungs pa sdud pa'i don te /
analyzed: gzhal du med pa dang mi zad pa zhes bya ba'i sgas ni ma gsungs pa sdud pa'i don te /
translated: The phrase “immeasurable and inexhaustible” is a mnemonic for what is not stated,

original: des na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa shes pa dang / zhum pa dang yongs su 'dzin pa shes pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zad pa med pa shes pa yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: des na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa shes pa dang / zhum pa dang yongs su 'dzin pa shes pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zad pa med pa shes pa yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: and thus includes the knowledge of the afflicted and unafflicted, the knowledge of the depressed and the exalted, and the knowledge of the perishable and imperishable.

original: de la dang po gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la dang po gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa gsungs te /
translated: In this regard, the first two, beginning with “Moreover, Subhūti,” are stated as the afflicted and unafflicted.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The afflicted is the afflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa'i chos kyis dri ma can du byas pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i chos kyis dri ma can du byas pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The defiled by the dharmas of affliction is the afflicted.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: The unafflicted is the unafflicted.

original: gang gi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams ni des na gnas med pa ste sems kyi chos nyid de la yang dag par gnas med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams ni des na gnas med pa ste sems kyi chos nyid de la yang dag par gnas med de /
translated: Because the afflictions have no basis in that, i.e., they do not really exist in the essential nature of mind,

original: de dag ni glo bur pa nyid nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni glo bur pa nyid nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are adventitious.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for “naturally luminous,” etc.,

original: sems kyi chos nyid rang bzhin kho nas 'od gsal ba ni dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid rang bzhin kho nas 'od gsal ba ni dri ma med pa'o //
translated: the essential nature of mind is naturally luminous, i.e., stainless.

original: 'di ni sems kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa shes pa ste drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa shes pa ste drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth knowledge, that the mind is not afflicted.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyis kyis ni gnyis pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyis kyis ni gnyis pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, etc. The second is stated in two passages.

original: gzhi med pa zhum zhes bya ba la gzhi med pa ni gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi med pa zhum zhes bya ba la gzhi med pa ni gnas med pa'o //
translated: “Without a basis” means without a basis, i.e., without a support.

original: gzhi med pa nyid zhum pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi med pa nyid zhum pa'o //
translated: “Without a basis” is the depression.

original: sems zhum pa la ni rang bzhin med de sems kyi rangs bzhin la ni skye pa med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems zhum pa la ni rang bzhin med de sems kyi rangs bzhin la ni skye pa med pa dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is not depressed, because the mind’s nature is without origination and without cessation.

original: gzung du med pa ni sems de dag gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung du med pa ni sems de dag gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not apprehended means that those minds are not to be apprehended.

original: mi gzung ba ni gzung du med pa'o //
analyzed: mi gzung ba ni gzung du med pa'o //
translated: Not apprehended means not apprehended.

original: rab kyi sgra ni dgag pa'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab kyi sgra ni dgag pa'i don nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word not has the meaning of negation.

original: 'jug pa 'am skye ba zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'jug pa 'am skye ba zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is not engaged or not arisen.

original: 'di ni sems zhum pa dang gzung ba med par shes pe ste bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems zhum pa dang gzung ba med par shes pe ste bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh knowledge of the mind of depression and non-apprehension.

original: @130a *// gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gsum pa gsungs te /
analyzed: @130a *// gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gsum pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, the two phrases beginning with Subhūti state the third [knowledge].

original: ngo bo nyid med pa ni dngos po med pa nyid de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa ni dngos po med pa nyid de /
translated: Non-entityness means non-existence.

original: de med pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: The absence of that is non-entityness.

original: 'di dag gi sems 'dzag par byed pas na zag pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi sems 'dzag par byed pas na zag pa ste /
translated: These are leaks because they cause the mind to leak out.

original: yod pa ma yin pa la kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: It is a conceptualization of what does not exist.

original: de dang ldan pas na zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas na zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Possessing that is with leaks.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir yod pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa rnams la rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yod pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa rnams la rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the imagination of what is unreal is conceived in the realms of desire, form and the formless.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngang tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngang tshul zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of non-substantiality refers to emptiness as the absence of an existent entity.

original: 'di la de lta bu'i ngang tshul yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste de'i phyir lhun gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la de lta bu'i ngang tshul yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste de'i phyir lhun gyis grub pa'o //
translated: He is so described because he has such a nature.

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa rnams su zag pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa rnams su zag pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of his freedom from the realms of desire, form and the formless,

original: des na zag pa dang bral ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na zag pa dang bral ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: he is described as 'free from the outflows'.

original: 'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i sems shes pa ste brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i sems shes pa ste brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the mind with and without outflows, the eighth.

original: chags bcas la sogs dang zhes bya ba la tshogs pa dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba shes pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba shes pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: chags bcas la sogs dang zhes bya ba la tshogs pa dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba shes pa dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba shes pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba shes pa'o //
translated: The phrase with attachment, etc. refers to the cognition of one who is in a group, the cognition of one who is free from attachment, the cognition of one who is angry, the cognition of one who is free from anger, the cognition of one who is ignorant, and the cognition of one who is free from ignorance.

original: de la rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs ba'i tshig dang po gnyis ni sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de la rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs ba'i tshig dang po gnyis ni sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: In this regard, the first two phrases beginning with Moreover, Subhuti, etc., refer to the statement the mind with attachment, etc.

original: sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni sems kyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni sems kyi rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The mind with attachment is not the nature of the mind.

original: de bas na 'dod chags med pa ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags med pa ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of with attachment is without attachment.

original: gang sems kyi bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bral pa ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang sems kyi bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bral pa ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: In the phrase the mind free from attachment, etc., freedom is emptiness.

original: de ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa ma yin te de nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don te 'di ni sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i shes pa ste dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa ma yin te de nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don te 'di ni sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i shes pa ste dgu pa'o //
translated: It is not associated with passion, and that is the meaning of “free from passion.” This is the knowledge of a mind associated with passion and free from passion, the ninth.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs gnyis gsungs pa la de ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs gnyis gsungs pa la de ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The two verses beginning with “Furthermore, Subhūti” are easy to understand.

original: 'di ni zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems shes pa ste bcu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang zhe sdang dang bral ba'i sems shes pa ste bcu pa'o //
