translated: This is the knowledge of a mind associated with aversion and free from aversion, the tenth.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gsum pa bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gsum pa bstan te /
translated: The two verses beginning with “Furthermore, Subhūti” teach the third.

original: 'di ni sems gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba @130b shes pa ste bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba @130b shes pa ste bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of a mind associated with delusion and free from delusion, the eleventh.

original: rgya chen dang / chen por gyur dang / chad med pa dang zhes bstan bcos las gsungs so //
analyzed: rgya chen dang / chen por gyur dang / chad med pa dang zhes bstan bcos las gsungs so //
translated: The treatise declares: “Extensive, vast, and uninterrupted.”

original: rgya chen po ni yangs pa ste 'dod pa'i khams thams cad la dmigs pa'i gnas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgya chen po ni yangs pa ste 'dod pa'i khams thams cad la dmigs pa'i gnas la sogs pa'o //
translated: Vast is the extensive object, such as all the desire realm.

original: chen por gyur pa ni gzugs la dmigs pa ste 'dod pa'i khams las gzugs kyi khams khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa ni gzugs la dmigs pa ste 'dod pa'i khams las gzugs kyi khams khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great is the form realm object, because the form realm is superior to the desire realm.

original: gzugs med pa la dmigs pa dang / rnam pa gsum du dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa ni tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa la dmigs pa dang / rnam pa gsum du dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa ni tshad med pa'o //
translated: Immeasurable is the formless realm object, the object of the three types, and the non-object.

original: de'i phyir gsum du shes pa ni yum chen mo las sems rgya chen por shes pa dang / sims chen por gyur pa shes pa dang / sems tshad med pa shes pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsum du shes pa ni yum chen mo las sems rgya chen por shes pa dang / sims chen por gyur pa shes pa dang / sems tshad med pa shes pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of the three is stated in the Great Mother as the knowledge of the vast mind, the knowledge of the great mind, and the knowledge of the immeasurable mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir ni tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i dbang gis ma gsungs pa bsdus te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'dir ni tshad med pa zhes bya ba'i dbang gis ma gsungs pa bsdus te /
translated: Here in this Blessed Mother, immeasurable is stated by the power of the word, including what is not stated.

original: 'di la brten te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di la brten te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It should be connected as based on this.

original: rgya che ba dang / rgya che ba ma yin pa dang / chen por gyur pa dang / chen por gyur pa ma yin pa dang / tshad med pa de ni 'dir shes pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rgya che ba dang / rgya che ba ma yin pa dang / chen por gyur pa dang / chen por gyur pa ma yin pa dang / tshad med pa de ni 'dir shes pa gsum ste /
translated: The three knowledges here are:🔽the knowledge of the vast and the not vast,

original: rgya che ba dang rgya che ba ma yin pa'i shes pa dang / chen por gyur pa dang / chen por gyur pa ma yin pa'i shes pa /
analyzed: rgya che ba dang rgya che ba ma yin pa'i shes pa dang / chen por gyur pa dang / chen por gyur pa ma yin pa'i shes pa /
translated: the knowledge of the great and the not great,

original: tshad med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: and the knowledge of the immeasurable.🔽Moreover, Subhūti, the Tathāgata, etc.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig dang po gnyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig dang po gnyis gsungs pa la /
translated: The first two phrases are stated.

original: yongs su mi ldong ba ni rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi ldong ba ni rgya che ba'o //
translated: Not turning away is vast.

original: de dang ldan pa dgag pa ni mi ldan pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa dgag pa ni mi ldan pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The negation of possessing that is the manner of not possessing.

original: so sor 'brang ba ma yin pa bkag pas yongs su mi ldang ba'i nang du gtogs par ni chos nyid kyis te /
analyzed: so sor 'brang ba ma yin pa bkag pas yongs su mi ldang ba'i nang du gtogs par ni chos nyid kyis te /
translated: The negation of following is included in not turning away by nature.

original: de bas na rgya che ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rgya che ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not vast.

original: sems de dag mi 'bri zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: sems de dag mi 'bri zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: The statement “those minds do not decrease, etc.”

original: mi 'bri ba ni 'grib pa med pa ste de bas na rgya mi che ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'bri ba ni 'grib pa med pa ste de bas na rgya mi che ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Non-decrease is non-writing; therefore, it is not small.

original: mi 'phel ba ni 'phel ba med pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'phel ba ni 'phel ba med pa ste /
translated: Non-increase is non-growth;

original: de bas na rgya che ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rgya che ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: therefore, it is not great.

original: rnam par grol ba med pa ni khyad par du mi 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba med pa ni khyad par du mi 'gro ba ste /
translated: Non-liberation is non-going-beyond;

original: de bas na rgya che ba ma yin pa dang / rgya mi che ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rgya che ba ma yin pa dang / rgya mi che ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: therefore, it is not great and it is not small.

original: rnam par grol ba med pas zhes bya ba ni 'gyur ba med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba med pas zhes bya ba ni 'gyur ba med pa kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-liberation means that it is unchanging.

original: sems ni sems kyi chos nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sems ni sems kyi chos nyid kyis so //
translated: The mind is the reality of the mind.

original: 'di ni sems rgya che ba ma yin pa shes pa ste bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems rgya che ba ma yin pa shes pa ste bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the mind that is not great, the twelfth.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, etc.

original: 'ong ba ni thag ring po nas nye bar 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'ong ba ni thag ring po nas nye bar 'ong ba'o //
translated: Coming is coming near from afar.

original: nye ba @131a * //
analyzed: nye ba @131a * //
translated: Near

original: nas thag ring por 'gro ba ni 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: nas thag ring por 'gro ba ni 'gro ba'o //
translated: going far is going.

original: 'di dag rnam par dgag pa ni chen por zhugs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag rnam par dgag pa ni chen por zhugs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The negation of these two is not entering the great.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The equality of all phenomena is called “equality.”🔽

original: sems kyi mnyam pa nyid ni chos nyid kyis te /
analyzed: sems kyi mnyam pa nyid ni chos nyid kyis te /
translated: The equality of mind is by nature, and the equality of that is the equality of nature.

original: mnyam pa nyid de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis yod pa de'i phyir ngo bo nyid mnyam pa nyid de de bas na chen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis yod pa de'i phyir ngo bo nyid mnyam pa nyid de de bas na chen por gyur pa'o //
translated: Since those equalities exist by nature, it is the equality of nature. Therefore, it is the great.

original: 'di ni sems chen por gyur pa dang / chen por gyur pa ma yin pa shes pa ste bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems chen por gyur pa dang / chen por gyur pa ma yin pa shes pa ste bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the great mind and the non-great mind, the thirteenth.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni bcu bzhi ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni bcu bzhi ba gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, with the words Subhuti, if a person were to say, 'I will attain full enlightenment,' that person would be speaking falsely, the fourteenth is taught.

original: rten med pas tshad med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rten med pas tshad med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The immeasurable is due to the absence of a basis.

original: gang bum pa la brten cing bum pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i bum pa de dag ni dpag par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gang bum pa la brten cing bum pa'i khongs su gtogs pa'i bum pa de dag ni dpag par bya ba yin na /
translated: If the immeasurable is due to the absence of a basis, then the immeasurable is due to the absence of a basis.

original: sems kyi chos nyid ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir gang du yang brten pa med de de bas na tshad med pa yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i phyir gang du yang brten pa med de de bas na tshad med pa yin no //
translated: Since the nature of mind is equal to space, it is not based anywhere. Therefore, it is immeasurable.

original: 'di ni ye shes tshad med pa shes pa ste bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ye shes tshad med pa shes pa ste bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of immeasurable wisdom, the fourteenth.

original: rnam shes bstan du med pa dang zhes bya ba la rnam par shes pa ni sems so //
analyzed: rnam shes bstan du med pa dang zhes bya ba la rnam par shes pa ni sems so //
translated: Consciousness is taught as indemonstrable. Consciousness is mind.

original: yi ge dag gis ni shes pa lnga bzung ste /
analyzed: yi ge dag gis ni shes pa lnga bzung ste /
translated: The words five include the five knowledges.

original: sems bstan du yod pa dang bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa shes pa dang / sems thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs med pa shes pa dang / sems bla na yod pa dang bla na med pa shes pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang mnyam par bzhag pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: sems bstan du yod pa dang bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa shes pa dang / sems thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs med pa shes pa dang / sems bla na yod pa dang bla na med pa shes pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang mnyam par bzhag pa shes pa dang /
translated: The knowledge of the mind with form and the mind without form, the knowledge of the mind with obstruction and the mind without obstruction, the knowledge of the mind with higher and the mind without higher, the knowledge of the mind not concentrated and the mind concentrated,

original: sems rnam par ma grol ba dang rnam par grol ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par ma grol ba dang rnam par grol ba shes pa'o //
translated: and the knowledge of the mind not liberated and the mind liberated.

original: de la gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i pa'i tshig dang po gnyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de la gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i pa'i tshig dang po gnyis gsungs pa la /
translated: Here, the first two sentences beginning with Moreover, Subhūti... are spoken.

original: mnyam par ston pa zhes bya ba ston pa dang nges par ston pa ni don gcig go / de bas na mnyam par ston pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ston pa zhes bya ba ston pa dang nges par ston pa ni don gcig go / de bas na mnyam par ston pa'o //
translated: Equal teaching means teaching and demonstrating, which have the same meaning. Therefore, it is equal teaching.

original: de ga las shes she na /
analyzed: de ga las shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: gang gi phyir sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni sems kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems kyi ngo bo nyid ni sems kyi chos nyid do //
translated: Because the nature of mind is the reality of mind.

original: de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid 'di la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid 'di la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: This is the nature of that, so it is called that.

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'o //
translated: The middle word is elided.

original: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems kyi mtshan nyid ni 'dzin par byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems kyi mtshan nyid ni 'dzin par byed pa nyid de /
translated: As for “without characteristics,” etc., the characteristic of mind is the state of being a grasper.

original: de med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because that does not exist.

original: / don ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: / don ni rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The object is the nature of a substance.

original: des rnam par dben pa'i phyir sems kyi snang ba'o //
analyzed: des rnam par dben pa'i phyir sems kyi snang ba'o //
translated: Because it is devoid of that, it is the appearance of mind.

original: sems la mi snang ba'i don yang 'dir spyan gsum la snang bar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sems la mi snang ba'i don yang 'dir spyan gsum la snang bar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Here, the object that does not appear to the mind is called “not appearing to the three eyes.”

original: gsum ni sha'i dang / lha'i dang / shes rab kyi spyan no //
analyzed: gsum ni sha'i dang / lha'i dang / shes rab kyi spyan no //
translated: The three are the fleshly eye, the divine eye, and the eye of wisdom.

original: thams cad la zhes bya bas ni chos dang @131b sangs rgyas kyi spyan yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya bas ni chos dang @131b sangs rgyas kyi spyan yang bsdu'o //
translated: “All” includes the Dharma eye and the Buddha eye.

original: 'di ni sems bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa shes pa ste bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa shes pa ste bco lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifteenth knowledge, of the existence and nonexistence of mind.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, he says two phrases beginning with “Subhūti,”

original: med pa la kun brtags pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa la /
analyzed: med pa la kun brtags pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa la /
translated: and he says “imagined in what does not exist.”🔽These are imagined in what does not exist, and he says that.

original: med pa la kun brtags pa 'di dag gis de gsungs pa la de skad ces brjod de de nyid kyi phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: med pa la kun brtags pa 'di dag gis de gsungs pa la de skad ces brjod de de nyid kyi phyir stong pa'o //
translated: He says that because of that, they are empty.

original: dmigs pa nyid dbang du gyur pa ste gsob dag go //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid dbang du gyur pa ste gsob dag go //
translated: They are hollow because they are under the control of the very object that is imagined.

original: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir khong khro ba med pa'o zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir khong khro ba med pa'o zhes dgongs so //
translated: He thinks that they are not to be hated because they are contradicted by valid cognition.

original: gnyis su med pa la sogs pa la gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa la sogs pa la gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: Nonduality, etc. Duality is the two discriminations of apprehended and apprehender.

original: de med par gyur pa dang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de med par gyur pa dang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: They are nondual because they do not exist and are not produced.

original: gyur pa ni gnyis kyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gyur pa ni gnyis kyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: Nonduality is emptiness of duality.

original: 'dis kun du 'byung ba ni de las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis kun du 'byung ba ni de las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He says that they arise from that, meaning that they arise from emptiness.

original: de bas na tshad mas gnod pa byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na tshad mas gnod pa byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, he says that they are not to be hated because they are contradicted by valid cognition.

original: khong khro ba med pa yin te 'di ni sems khong khro ba dang bcas pa dang khong khro ba med pa shes pa ste bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: khong khro ba med pa yin te 'di ni sems khong khro ba dang bcas pa dang khong khro ba med pa shes pa ste bcu drug pa'o //
translated: He is without anger. This is the knowledge of the mind with anger and without anger, the sixteenth.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gsum pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ni gsum pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, Subhuti, etc. , two phrases, he speaks of the third.

original: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bla na yod pa ma yin pa ni de la rlom sems med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bla na yod pa ma yin pa ni de la rlom sems med do //
translated: Subhuti, etc. , the unsurpassed is without conceit in it.

original: rdul phra mo yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rdul phra mo yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The atom is, etc.

original: mi dmigs pa khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir bla na med pa ni spros pa med pa ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir bla na med pa ni spros pa med pa ste /
translated: The unsurpassed is without conceptual proliferation, because of the preeminence of nonapprehension.

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pas so //
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pas so //
translated: The middle term is elided.

original: 'di ni sems bla na yod pa dang bla na med pa shes pa ste bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems bla na yod pa dang bla na med pa shes pa ste bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the mind with conceit and without conceit, the seventeenth.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ni bzhi pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gnyis kyis ni bzhi pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, Subhuti, etc. , two phrases, he speaks of the fourth.

original: rab 'byor sems de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Subhuti, those minds, etc.

original: mnyam pa ni chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: mnyam pa ni chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Equality is the dharma-dhātu.

original: de dang mnyam pa ni de nyid du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa ni de nyid du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Equality with that is the entrance into reality.

original: de ltar ma yin pa ni mi mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin pa ni mi mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa'o //
translated: Not that is inequality.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni byis pa rnams la mnyam par bzhag pa med pa'i phyir te de bas na mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni byis pa rnams la mnyam par bzhag pa med pa'i phyir te de bas na mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o //
translated: Non-equipoise is the absence of equipoise in the childish; therefore, it is non-equipoise.

original: mnyam pa dang mnyam zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs par sla ste 'di ni sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang mnyam par bzhag pa shes pa ste bco brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa dang mnyam zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtogs par sla ste 'di ni sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang mnyam par bzhag pa shes pa ste bco brgyad pa'o //
translated: Equality with equipoise, etc. is easy to understand. This is the knowledge of the equipoise and non-equipoise of mind, the eighteenth.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis ni lnga pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyis kyis ni lnga pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, etc. is the statement of the fifth.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba ni tshig 'og ma'i don te /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba ni tshig 'og ma'i don te /
translated: By nature, etc. means by the nature of liberation, which is the meaning of the following words.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa ni med pa zhes bya ba'i @132a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa ni med pa zhes bya ba'i @132a * //
translated: The absence of intrinsic reality is called non-existence.

original: don to ; / sems kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pas ma dmigs pa'i phyir med pa ste /
analyzed: don to ; / sems kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pas ma dmigs pa'i phyir med pa ste /
translated: The meaning is this: mind and so on are non-existent because the Tathagata does not apprehend them.

original: de bas na rnam par grol ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par grol ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, they are liberated.

original: 'di ni sems rnam par grol ba dang rnam par ma grol ba shes pa ste bcu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems rnam par grol ba dang rnam par ma grol ba shes pa ste bcu dgu pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the mind liberated and not liberated, the nineteenth.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: In the treatise, it is said:

original: sems ltar med dang shes pa ste //
analyzed: sems ltar med dang shes pa ste //
translated: Non-existent like the mind, and knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa de yang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa de yang /
translated: And so on.

original: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, and so on.

original: med pa nas zhes bya ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: med pa nas zhes bya ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Non-existent is easy to understand.

original: 'jig rten ni sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
translated: World refers to the world of sentient beings.

original: 'di ni sems kyi snang ba shes pa ste nyi shu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems kyi snang ba shes pa ste nyi shu ba'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the appearance of the mind, the twentieth.

original: bstan bcos las ;
analyzed: bstan bcos las ;
translated: In the treatise, it is said:

original: g-yo ba la sogs zhes bya dang / zhes bya ba la sems de g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'du shes ni g-yo ba la sogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs zhes bya dang / zhes bya ba la sems de g-yo ba la sogs pa'i 'du shes ni g-yo ba la sogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Motion and so on. The notion of motion and so on in that mind is called motion and so on.

original: shes pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with knowledge.

original: g-yo ba la sogs pa bzhi ni bcom ldan 'das yum chen mo las gsungs te /
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs pa bzhi ni bcom ldan 'das yum chen mo las gsungs te /
translated: prajnaparamita sutra.

original: de la phye ba ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la phye ba ni bya ba'o //
translated: Among them, opening is activity.

original: btsums pa ni dgag pa'o //
analyzed: btsums pa ni dgag pa'o //
translated: Closing is cessation.

original: de gnyis yang dag par phye ba ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis yang dag par phye ba ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: The combination of the two is inclusion.

original: de gnyis brkyang ba ni dgag pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis brkyang ba ni dgag pa ste /
translated: The extension of the two is exclusion.

original: dper na 'byung ba dang / mi 'byung ba dang / 'byung yang 'byung ba dang / mi 'byung yang mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dper na 'byung ba dang / mi 'byung ba dang / 'byung yang 'byung ba dang / mi 'byung yang mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: For example, arising, non-arising, arising and non-arising, and neither arising nor non-arising.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma las ni 'dir dang po dang gsum pa bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma las ni 'dir dang po dang gsum pa bkag pa yin te /
translated: In the Bhagavati sutra, the first and third are negated here.

original: 'byung ba dang ; 'byung yang 'byung zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ; 'byung yang 'byung zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Arising and arising and non-arising are mentioned.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di las dang po dang gsum pa la bya ba yod pas na phye ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di las dang po dang gsum pa la bya ba yod pas na phye ba yin no //
translated: In this Bhagavati sutra, since there is activity in the first and third, they are opened.

original: gnyis pa dang bzhi pa la bya ba med pas na btsums pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang bzhi pa la bya ba med pas na btsums pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no activity in the second and fourth, they are closed.

original: de'i phyir gzhan yang rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis phye ba dang / btsums pa shes pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan yang rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis phye ba dang / btsums pa shes pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Therefore, moreover, Subhūti, the Tathāgata, etc.

original: de thams cad ni phung po lnga la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: de thams cad ni phung po lnga la brten pa yin te /
translated: All of that is based on the five aggregates.

original: de bas na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “he knows them just as they are.”

original: rab 'byor ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhus pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhus pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, how, etc. is the question.

original: de bzhin song ba shi phan chad zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: de bzhin song ba shi phan chad zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The answer is, “The Tathāgata has gone beyond, etc.”

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla ste /
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni phye ba dang btsums pa shes pa ste nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phye ba dang btsums pa shes pa ste nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of opening and closing, the twenty-first.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: In the treatise,

original: yang de dag ni de bzhin nyid rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa la /
analyzed: yang de dag ni de bzhin nyid rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa la /
translated: it is said, “They are consciousness of suchness.”

original: de dag ni phye ba dang btsums pa dag ste /
analyzed: de dag ni phye ba dang btsums pa dag ste /
translated: They are opening and closing.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are its nature.

original: gzhan @132b yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni rab tu mkhyen pa'i gsum pa'i bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan @132b yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni rab tu mkhyen pa'i gsum pa'i bar du gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, the passage beginning with “Subhūti, ” etc., up to the third knowledge, is stated.

original: 'di ni de bzhin nyid ji lta bar phye ba dang / btsums pa shes pa ste nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin nyid ji lta bar phye ba dang / btsums pa shes pa ste nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the twenty-second, the knowledge of the opening and closing of the eyes just as they are in reality.

original: de las gzhan thub pa de bzhin nyid rtogs pa /
analyzed: de las gzhan thub pa de bzhin nyid rtogs pa /
translated: From that, the other is the Sage, who realizes reality.

original: gzhan bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan bstan pa shes pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The other is to be connected with the statement, “the knowledge of teaching. ”

original: de bzhin shes pa ni mchog go / thub pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin shes pa ni mchog go / thub pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of reality is supreme. The Sage is the Tathāgata.

original: gang mngon par byang chub pa de gzhan la bstan pa yang shes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang mngon par byang chub pa de gzhan la bstan pa yang shes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he teaches to others what he has realized.

original: de ni rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas me zad pa nyid du bstan to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni rab 'byor 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas me zad pa nyid du bstan to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: That is stated in the passage beginning with “Subhūti, it is like this, ” etc., up to “the teaching of the extinction of fire. ”

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Reality is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin nyid gcig tu rnam par bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gcig tu rnam par bzhag pa yin no //
translated: Reality is established as one.

original: gang yin pa ni gang kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang yin pa ni gang kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is it? It is just that.

original: de bzhin nyid gcig ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar rgya cher bstan pa'i de bzhin nyid ni gcig pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gcig ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar rgya cher bstan pa'i de bzhin nyid ni gcig pa kho na'o //
translated: There is only one thusness. Thusness is taught in detail as only one.

original: ci 'di la gcig pa nyid ni tha dad pa med pa la bya'am bye brag tsam zhig yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'di la gcig pa nyid ni tha dad pa med pa la bya'am bye brag tsam zhig yin nam /
translated: Here, is oneness to be understood as the absence of difference, or is it just a mere distinction,

original: 'on te ri 'bigs byed bzhin du gcig gi grangs kyis yin zhe na de'i phyir du ma'i dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / bral ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on te ri 'bigs byed bzhin du gcig gi grangs kyis yin zhe na de'i phyir du ma'i dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang / bral ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: or is it like the Himalaya mountain, which is one? Therefore, it is said to be free from the state of multiplicity and non-existence.

original: du ma'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa ni du ma nyid dang / gcig nyid dang / de dag dang bral ba ni de dag rdzas kyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: du ma'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa ni du ma nyid dang / gcig nyid dang / de dag dang bral ba ni de dag rdzas kyi chos nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The state of multiplicity and non-existence is the state of multiplicity and oneness. Being free from them is their substantial nature.

original: tha dad pa med pa tsam de'i gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa tsam de'i gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of oneness is just the absence of difference.

original: de dag gi las she na /
analyzed: de dag gi las she na /
translated: What is their function?

original: du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sna tshogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sna tshogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of multiplicity and diversity.

original: de gnyis ka yang rdzas kyi chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang rdzas kyi chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both of them are substantial entities.

original: mi zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka med pa'o //
analyzed: mi zad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka med pa'o //
translated: Because of its inexhaustibility, it is neither of the two.

original: de dang ldan pa la mi dang / glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa'i dbye ba yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa la mi dang / glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa'i dbye ba yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If it were, then there would be a difference in the suchness of the person, just as there is a difference in the person as elephant, horse, etc.

original: de bzhin nyid nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la ni de med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la ni de med do //
translated: But suchness is like space, and there is no difference in space.

original: gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is different in different states, but not different in general,

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir dang / gnyis su med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir dang / gnyis su med pa'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
translated: then it would not be immutable, and it would not be nondual.

original: dngos po dben pa'i mtshan nyid de las dngos po'i ches kyi dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dben pa'i mtshan nyid de las dngos po'i ches kyi dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of the differentiation of substantial entities from the characteristic of the emptiness of all things.

original: dbyings gcig yin yang gcad na du mar 'gyur ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dbyings gcig yin yang gcad na du mar 'gyur ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as space is one, but is differentiated by the differentiation of the spatial locations of forms,

original: phung po la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin nyid kyang yin no zhe na /🔽gnyis su med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba @133a * //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin nyid kyang yin no zhe na /🔽gnyis su med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba @133a * //
translated: in the same way, the Blessed One has said that the aggregates, etc. are suchness.🔽But if suchness were different in different states, it would not be nondual.

original: gsungs so // ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gcod pa mi rigs so zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: gsungs so // ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gcod pa mi rigs so zhes dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that it is not reasonable to cut off because of the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i ye shes gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i ye shes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, Subhūti, etc. teaches the exalted wisdom of manifest complete enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni de gzhan bstan pa'i shes pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni de gzhan bstan pa'i shes pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, Subhūti, etc. teaches the knowledge of teaching others.

original: lhag ma rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rtogs sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni de bzhin nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa gzhan bstan pa ste nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa gzhan bstan pa ste nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching on the manifest complete enlightenment of suchness, the twenty-third chapter.

original: bstan bcos las /🔽thams cad shes pa nyid skabs kyis //
analyzed: bstan bcos las / thams cad shes pa nyid skabs kyis //
translated: In the treatise, it is said:

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin /
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin /
translated: The characteristic of knowledge is summarized in the section on the knowledge of all aspects.

original: zhes bya ba smos pas ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos pas ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: 'di tsam ni rgyas par bsdus te /
analyzed: 'di tsam ni rgyas par bsdus te /
translated: This much is summarized in detail.

original: gang gis shes na /
analyzed: gang gis shes na /
translated: By knowing what?

original: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas shes pa'i mtshan nyid de'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas shes pa'i mtshan nyid de'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the characteristic of knowledge is in terms of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: stong nyid mtshan ma med bcas dang // smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang // skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // chos nyid dang ni 'khrug med dang // 'du mi byed dang rnam mi rtog / rab dbye mtshan nyid med nyid la //
analyzed: stong nyid mtshan ma med bcas dang // smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang // skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // chos nyid dang ni 'khrug med dang // 'du mi byed dang rnam mi rtog / rab dbye mtshan nyid med nyid la //
translated: non-composition, non-conceptuality,🔽and the absence of differentiation and characteristics.

original: lam shes nyid kyi skabs kyis ni //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi skabs kyis ni //
translated: In the context of the knowledge of the path,

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin //
translated: the characteristics of knowledge are summarized.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: lam shes pa nyid kyi shes pa ni rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyi shes pa ni rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: The knowledge of the knowledge of the path is ninefold.

original: 'di dag ni shes pa la ltos pas bdun pa'i mtha' can no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni shes pa la ltos pas bdun pa'i mtha' can no //
translated: Since these depend on knowledge, they end with the seventh.

original: 'di nyid ni de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: This is stated from Then, Śakra, Lord of the Gods... and so forth.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni ye shes rnams so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni ye shes rnams so //
translated: Dharmas refers to the knowledges.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni lam shes pa nyid kyi shes pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni lam shes pa nyid kyi shes pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: Here refers to the characteristics of the knowledge of the knowledge of the path.

original: 'dir shes pa dag brjod par bya ba yin yang de'i dmigs pa dag brjod de de brjod pas kyang de rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir shes pa dag brjod par bya ba yin yang de'i dmigs pa dag brjod de de brjod pas kyang de rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, although the cognitions are the objects of expression, their objects are expressed, because they are understood by expressing those.

original: de / la /
analyzed: de / la /
translated: That is,🔽emptiness, the absence of signs,🔽and the abandonment of wishes.

original: stong nyid mtshan ma med bcas dang // smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum shes pa'o //
analyzed: stong nyid mtshan ma med bcas dang // smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the three gates of liberation.

original: de ni lha'i bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni lha'i bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The gods, etc. are stated.

original: stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gcig gi tshig ste dmigs pa ni gcig yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gcig gi tshig ste dmigs pa ni gcig yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The word emptiness, etc. is singular because the object is just one.

original: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mang po'i tshig ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni mang po'i tshig ste /
translated: The word characteristics is plural.

original: ye shes ni mtshan nyid tha dad pas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes ni mtshan nyid tha dad pas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Knowledge is different because of different characteristics.

original: gzhag go zhes bya ba ni rnam par bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: gzhag go zhes bya ba ni rnam par bzhag pa ste /
translated: The word establish is posit.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: It is by worldly convention, not ultimately.

original: 'di ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa @133b dang smon pa med pa shes pa dag go //
analyzed: 'di ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa @133b dang smon pa med pa shes pa dag go //
translated: This is the knowledge of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.🔽The unborn, unceasing, etc.

original: skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // zhes bya ba de ni lha'i bu dag skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // zhes bya ba de ni lha'i bu dag skye ba med pa'o //
translated: The sons of gods, this is the unborn,

original: 'gag pa med pa'o //🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa'o // kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: the unceasing,🔽the uncontaminated,

original: rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa'o //
translated: the unpurified,

original: dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'o //
translated: the insubstantial,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: nirvana,

original: chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: the dharma-element,🔽suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid do zhes 'di la mtshan nyid gzhag go zhes bya ba la skye ba med pa la sogs pa brgyad gcig tu bas ba ni stong pa nyid tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid do zhes 'di la mtshan nyid gzhag go zhes bya ba la skye ba med pa la sogs pa brgyad gcig tu bas ba ni stong pa nyid tsam gyi phyir ro //
translated: The eight, beginning with the unborn, are combined into one because of mere emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: Emptiness is the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa la skye ba 'am 'gag pa 'am kun nas nyon mongs pa 'am /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa la skye ba 'am 'gag pa 'am kun nas nyon mongs pa 'am /
translated: In the absence of intrinsic reality, there is no arising, no cessation, no defilement,

original: rnam par byang ba 'am /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba 'am /
translated: no purification,

original: dngos po med do //
analyzed: dngos po med do //
translated: no insubstantiality.

original: dngos po med pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The absence of insubstantiality is nirvana.

original: stong pa nyid chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The emptiness of the dharmadhatu.

original: gang gi phyir chos rnams kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos rnams kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of all dharmas.

original: mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir rtag tu de kho na bzhin du gnas pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir rtag tu de kho na bzhin du gnas pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is thusness because it is unchanging, it always exists just as it is.

original: ji ste mtshan nyid dag la phyogs bzung ste /
analyzed: ji ste mtshan nyid dag la phyogs bzung ste /
translated: If someone were to ask, “What is the point of accepting the characteristics of the dharmadhatu,🔽since it is impermanent, suffering, empty, etc.?”

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa la sogs pa spangs pas ci zhig bya zhes blo dman pas dris pa ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa la sogs pa spangs pas ci zhig bya zhes blo dman pas dris pa ni de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The question is asked by someone of inferior intellect, and the answer is given in the passage beginning with “Why is that?”

original: 'dir stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid ci'i phyir 'dod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid ci'i phyir 'dod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “Why do you accept the characteristics of emptiness, etc.?”

original: lha'i bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni lan te /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag ces bya ba la sogs pa ni lan te /
translated: The answer is given in the passage beginning with “Divine sons!”

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “because” means “for what reason.”

original: gang gi phyir mi gnas pa dang / nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / sus kyang ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi gnas pa dang / nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / sus kyang ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is non-abiding, like space, and because it is not established by anyone.

original: de la nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to establish that it is like space, he says, “These characteristics are not based on form, etc.”

original: gzugs su bgrang ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams su'o //
analyzed: gzugs su bgrang ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams su'o //
translated: “ Enumerated as form” means as the characteristics of form, etc.

original: mi gnas pa nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mi gnas pa nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to establish that it is non-abiding, he says, “These characteristics are not based on form, etc.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not based on form, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang rang bzhin gyis med pa'i phyir dang / de dag la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang rang bzhin gyis med pa'i phyir dang / de dag la yang gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: because form, etc., do not exist inherently, and because form, etc., do not have the characteristics of form, etc.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i 'gog pa ni nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i 'gog pa ni nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: The cessation that is like space is like space.

original: ma bzhag pa nyid rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ma bzhag pa nyid rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir mtshan nyid 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to establish that it is not posited, he says, “These characteristics are not based on form, etc.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gnas med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gnas med pa ste /
translated: Form, etc., are not based on them, because form, etc., do not exist inherently, and because form, etc., do not have the characteristics of form, etc.

original: me rtag pa dang @134a * //
analyzed: me rtag pa dang @134a * //
translated: Fire is not like that,

original: sdug bsngal pa la sogs pa 'di ni de dang 'dra bar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal pa la sogs pa 'di ni de dang 'dra bar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: because it is not eternal, painful, and so on.

original: byis pas kun brtags pa'i phyir de dag la gus par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pas kun brtags pa'i phyir de dag la gus par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they should not be respected, because they are imagined by the childish.

original: 'di ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa shes pa ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa shes pa ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of non-arising, non-cessation, and so on, the fourth.

original: chos nyid dang ni 'khrug med dang ; ; zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshan nyid dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos nyid dang ni 'khrug med dang ; ; zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshan nyid dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The line the nature and non-disturbance refers to the passage beginning the characteristics.

original: bskyod par zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'khrug pa dang / rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bskyod par zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'khrug pa dang / rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of disturbance is turmoil and realization.

original: mtshan nyid 'di dag kho nar zhes bya ba ni de ltar mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di dag kho nar zhes bya ba ni de ltar mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The phrase these characteristics alone means knowing them in this way.

original: gang dang gang mtshan nyid de dang de las bzlog pa de ni gnod par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gang dang gang mtshan nyid de dang de las bzlog pa de ni gnod par byed pa yin na /
translated: If something is contrary to a characteristic, it is a fault.

original: mtshan nyid de ni de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de ni de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: But these characteristics are not like that.

original: 'di ni chos nyid dang 'khrug pa med pa shes pa ste lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid dang 'khrug pa med pa shes pa ste lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the nature and non-disturbance, the fifth.

original: 'du mi byed ces bya ba 'di'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'du mi byed ces bya ba 'di'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the phrase not fabricated,

original: mtshan nyid 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the following is stated: These characteristics...

original: sus kyang ma bzhag go zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: sus kyang ma bzhag go zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: The phrase not posited by anyone is the thesis.

original: 'dus ma byas nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The phrase because of being unfabricated is the reason.

original: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: The phrase like space is the example.

original: gal te de dag de bzhin gshegs pas ma bzhag na /
analyzed: gal te de dag de bzhin gshegs pas ma bzhag na /
translated: If they are not posited by the Tathāgata,

original: de ltar na des ji ltar rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don mdzad de de bzhin gshegs pa yang ji ltar yin zhe na de'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: de ltar na des ji ltar rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don mdzad de de bzhin gshegs pa yang ji ltar yin zhe na de'i phyir de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te rtogs par sla'o //
translated: then how does he perform benefit for self and others, and how is he a Tathāgata? With regard to that, the following is stated: Then the Bhagavān... and so on. It is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni 'du mi byed pa shes pa ste drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'du mi byed pa shes pa ste drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth knowledge, the knowledge of the unfabricated.

original: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the phrase non-conceptually,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba'i bar gsungs pa la /
translated: the following is stated: Then the Bhagavān... up to a buddha.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa rnams te /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa rnams te /
translated: The fully enlightened ones are non-conceptual.

original: de'i phyir zab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zab pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is profound.

original: 'di ni rnam par mi rtog pa shes pa ste bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par mi rtog pa shes pa ste bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the non-conceptual, the seventh.

original: rab dbye mtshan nyid med nyid la /
analyzed: rab dbye mtshan nyid med nyid la /
translated: In the absence of characteristics,

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa nyid shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba shes pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa nyid shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that it is the knowledge of the differentiation of characteristics and the knowledge of the absence of characteristics.

original: de la mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Regarding that, from the perspective of the differentiation of characteristics,

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, It is like this...

original: thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i ye shes ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i ye shes ni chags pa med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The unobstructed wisdom in all respects is the wisdom without attachment.

original: gang gi phyir de dag nyid kyis chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag nyid kyis chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba byas pa yin no //
translated: Because by just that, the differentiation of the characteristics of all phenomena is made.

original: 'di ni rab tu dbye ba shes pa ste @134b brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rab tu dbye ba shes pa ste @134b brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of differentiation, the eighth.

original: mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the absence of characteristics,🔽it is said, The characteristic of phenomena...

original: chags pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: chags pa ma mchis pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The wisdom that is free from attachment,

original: ston pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
analyzed: ston pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la /
translated: up to the teacher.

original: chags pa med pa'i ye shes ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i ye shes ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that is free from attachment is without reference point.

original: de'i spyod yul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i spyod yul ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Its domain is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nyid la gnas pa rnams kyis ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid gzugs sam /
analyzed: de nyid la gnas pa rnams kyis ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid gzugs sam /
translated: Those who abide in that do not reference any characteristics, such as form having the characteristic of being suitable as form,

original: nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid tshor ba'am /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid tshor ba'am /
translated: feeling having the characteristic of experience,

original: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i bar du mtshan nyid thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba'i bar du mtshan nyid thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: up to the wisdom of omniscience having the characteristic of direct perception.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid med pa nyid shes pa ste dgu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid med pa nyid shes pa ste dgu pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the absence of characteristics, the ninth.

original: lam shes nyid kyi skabs kyis ni //🔽shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skabs kyis ni //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi skabs kyis ni // shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skabs kyis ni //
translated: The section on the knowledge of the path🔽is the section on the characteristics of knowledge.

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid bsdus pa yin //
translated: It is a summary of the characteristics of knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: de ni nyid kyis chos brten nas //
analyzed: de ni nyid kyis chos brten nas //
translated: That is the Dharma itself, based on which🔽The respectfulness, the guruhood, the pleasing,🔽The worship of that, the non-deficiency, the knowing how to enter,

original: gnas dang gus par bar bya ba dang // bla ma nyid dang mnyes pa dang // de la mchod dang byad med dang // kun tu 'jug mkhyen gang yin dang // ma mthong ston par mdzad pa dang // 'jig rten stong nyid rnam pa dang //
analyzed: gnas dang gus par bar bya ba dang // bla ma nyid dang mnyes pa dang // de la mchod dang byad med dang // kun tu 'jug mkhyen gang yin dang // ma mthong ston par mdzad pa dang // 'jig rten stong nyid rnam pa dang //
translated: The teaching of the unseen, the emptiness of the world,🔽The manifestation of the knower of the expressed and the knower,

original: brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum dang // bsam pa'i khyad dang zhi nyid ston //
analyzed: brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum dang // bsam pa'i khyad dang zhi nyid ston //
translated: The teaching of the difference of thought and peace,

original: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa la //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa la //
translated: The cessation of the world’s perceptions,

original: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //
translated: The way of the knower of all aspects,

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Is explained as the characteristic of knowledge.

original: 'di ni rab 'byor ji ltar zhes bya ba nas le'u rdzogs pa'i bar gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni rab 'byor ji ltar zhes bya ba nas le'u rdzogs pa'i bar gyis gsungs te /
translated: This is stated by the passage beginning with “Subhūti, it is thus” up to the end of the chapter.

original: 'di yang shes pa la ltos pas bdun par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di yang shes pa la ltos pas bdun par sbyar ro //
translated: This is also connected with the seventh, since it depends on knowledge.

original: chos 'di la zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di la zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: “In this Dharma” is the teaching.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'o //
translated: “The perfection of wisdom” is the explanation.

original: chos gnas pa'i gzhi ni rdzas yin te /
analyzed: chos gnas pa'i gzhi ni rdzas yin te /
translated: The basis of the stability of the Dharma is a substance,

original: nam mkha' ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni ma yin no //
translated: not space.

original: de'i phyir chos kho na la brten cing gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kho na la brten cing gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is based on and abides in the Dharma alone.

original: 'di nyid ni chos la brten cing gnas pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni chos la brten cing gnas pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of abiding in the Dharma.

original: chos la bkur sti mdzad ces bya ba ni gus par byed pa'i shes pa'o //🔽bla mar mdzad ces bya ba ni bla mar mdzad pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos la bkur sti mdzad ces bya ba ni gus par byed pa'i shes pa'o // bla mar mdzad ces bya ba ni bla mar mdzad pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: “He honors the Dharma” is the knowledge of respect.🔽“He esteems it” is the knowledge of esteem.

original: ri mor mdzad ces bya ba ni mnyes par byed pa'i shes pa'o //🔽de la mchod dang byed med pa //
analyzed: ri mor mdzad ces bya ba ni mnyes par byed pa'i shes pa'o // de la mchod dang byed med pa //
translated: “He reveres it” is the knowledge of reverence.🔽“He does not worship it”

original: zhes bya ba ni de la mchod pa dang byed pa med pa nyid de //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de la mchod pa dang byed pa med pa nyid de //
translated: means that he does not worship it.

original: de la mchod pa shes pa ni mchod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /🔽byas ba tshor bar @135a * //
analyzed: de la mchod pa shes pa ni mchod do zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / byas ba tshor bar @135a * //
translated: The knowledge of worship is stated from “he worships” up to

original: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs te /
translated: “he knows that the deed has been done.”

original: ci ste 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'di la bkur sti mdzad pa'i rgyu ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'di la bkur sti mdzad pa'i rgyu ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “What is the cause for the Tathāgatas’ honoring of this?”

original: de'i phyir rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Therefore, Subhuti, it is called the perfection of wisdom, etc.🔽Why is that? If that is the reality of dharmas, then why is it always honored, etc.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te yang de nyid chos rnams kyi chos nyid yin pa de lta mod kyi rtag tu 'di la bkur sti mdzad ces bya ba nas /🔽gsol ba mdzad ces bya ba'i bar du bsams so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te yang de nyid chos rnams kyi chos nyid yin pa de lta mod kyi rtag tu 'di la bkur sti mdzad ces bya ba nas / gsol ba mdzad ces bya ba'i bar du bsams so //
translated: up to why is it worshipped?

original: rab 'byor zhes bya la sogs pa ni lan te /
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya la sogs pa ni lan te /
translated: The answer beginning with “Subhuti” is as follows.

original: rab tu 'byed pa ni yong su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'byed pa ni yong su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection is the completion.

original: gal te yang 'di las rab tu 'byed pa de lta mod kyi ci ste 'di la bkur sti mdzad ce na de'i phyir byas pa gzo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te yang 'di las rab tu 'byed pa de lta mod kyi ci ste 'di la bkur sti mdzad ce na de'i phyir byas pa gzo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If it is perfected here, then why is it honored? Therefore it is said, “because of gratitude, etc.”

original: rab 'byor gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de dag nyid byas pa gzo ba nyid kyis rab tu bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de dag nyid byas pa gzo ba nyid kyis rab tu bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The proof of those very things by gratitude, etc. is by “Subhuti, whoever, etc.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The specification “to the Tathagata” is for the purpose of avoiding the idea that this is said of the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: de'i byas pa gzo ba nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de'i byas pa gzo ba nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it that he is grateful?

original: de'i phyir rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te rtogs sla'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Subhūti, etc.” It is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni de la mchod pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de la mchod pa shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of worship.

original: byed med nyid ces bya ba ni rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byed med nyid ces bya ba ni rab 'byor gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As for “non-action,” it is said, “Subhūti, moreover, etc.”

original: chos rnams ma byas pa shes pa des na byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor ba zhes bya ba nges pa'i tshig gis na dgag pa phyi ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: chos rnams ma byas pa shes pa des na byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor ba zhes bya ba nges pa'i tshig gis na dgag pa phyi ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: By the knowledge of non-production of phenomena, he is grateful and appreciative. By the etymological explanation of “grateful” and “appreciative,” the latter negation is intended.

original: 'di ni byed pa med pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byed pa med pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of non-action.

original: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: As for “omnipresent,” it is said, “Subhūti, etc.”

original: 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni thams cad du 'gro ba shes ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni thams cad du 'gro ba shes ba bstan to //
translated: Up to “the teacher of the world” teaches the knowledge of omnipresence.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba nas nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la chos thams cad stong pa de'i phyir shes pa po dang / mthong ba bo med pa'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba nas nye bar gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa la chos thams cad stong pa de'i phyir shes pa po dang / mthong ba bo med pa'o //
translated: The Lord having said this, up to remained in the presence of the Lord. Since all dharmas are empty, there is no knower and no seer.

original: gang yang shes pa'i gnas yod pa yin na ni shes pa po dang / mthong ba por yang 'gyur na chos thams cad ni gnas med pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang shes pa'i gnas yod pa yin na ni shes pa po dang / mthong ba por yang 'gyur na chos thams cad ni gnas med pa ste /
translated: If there were a basis for knowledge, there would be a knower and a seer. But all dharmas are without a basis,

original: yod pa dang / med pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang / med pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not stand in existence or non-existence.

original: de'i phyir yang chos thams cad ni shes pa po med pa dang / mthong ba po med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang chos thams cad ni shes pa po med pa dang / mthong ba po med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, all dharmas are without a knower and without a seer.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni shes pa po med pa dang / mthong pa med pa de nyid de lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni shes pa po med pa dang / mthong pa med pa de nyid de lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: Thus means just that: without a knower and without a seer. The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di ni ma mthong ba ston pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma mthong ba ston pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the teaching of non-seeing.

original: chos ston par byed pas ye shes @135b gang gis 'dul bar bya ba'i 'jig rten kha cig la stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas ston par byed pa ni brjod pa ste /
analyzed: chos ston par byed pas ye shes @135b gang gis 'dul bar bya ba'i 'jig rten kha cig la stong pa nyid kyi rnam pas ston par byed pa ni brjod pa ste /
translated: He teaches through expression,

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa skye'o //
translated: and the wisdom that arises from hearing is generated.

original: kha cig la ni shes mdzad de bsams pa las byung ba skye'o //
analyzed: kha cig la ni shes mdzad de bsams pa las byung ba skye'o //
translated: He teaches through knowledge, and the wisdom that arises from contemplation is generated.

original: kha cig la ni mngon sum ste bsgoms pa las byung ba skye'o //
analyzed: kha cig la ni mngon sum ste bsgoms pa las byung ba skye'o //
translated: He teaches through direct perception, and the wisdom that arises from meditation is generated.

original: 'di'i shes pa ni bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'di'i shes pa ni bstan bcos las /
translated: His wisdom is taught in the treatise:🔽The emptiness of the world, its aspects,

original: 'jig rten stong nyid rnam pa dang // brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum dang / zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten stong nyid rnam pa dang // brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum dang / zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: its expression, knowledge, and direct perception.

original: de'i phyir rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
translated: Therefore, Subhuti asks,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dris pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dris pa'o //
translated: Bhagavan, and so on, which is the question.

original: 'dir 'jig rten stong pa'o zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de ltar 'jig rten smos so zhes bya ba dang / yang dag ston to zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten stong pa'o zhes bya ba dang / 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de ltar 'jig rten smos so zhes bya ba dang / yang dag ston to zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: Here, the emptiness of the world is the answer to The world is empty, and the teaching of the world is the answer to The world is taught. Thus the world is mentioned and it is taught correctly are also answers.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The world is the answer.

original: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The world is the characteristic of the five aggregates.

original: stong pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin du de ltar 'jig rten ston pa dang / de ltar 'jig rten smos pa dang / de ltar yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ltar 'jig rten ston pa dang / de ltar 'jig rten smos pa dang / de ltar yang dag par ston to //
translated: Thus, the world is shown, the world is mentioned, and the world is taught.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang brjod pa dang / shes par mdzad pa dang mngon sum du shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang brjod pa dang / shes par mdzad pa dang mngon sum du shes pa'o //
translated: This is the aspect, the expression, the knowledge, and the direct knowledge of the emptiness of the world.

original: de ltar 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab par mthong ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab par mthong ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the world is inconceivable is the knowledge of seeing the inconceivable.

original: de ltar 'jig rten zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni zhi bar mthong ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni zhi bar mthong ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the world is peaceful is the knowledge of seeing peace.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: In the treatise,

original: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa dang // zhes bya ba de ni de ltar 'jig rten dben pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa dang // zhes bya ba de ni de ltar 'jig rten dben pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the cessation of the world's perceptions is mentioned. Thus, the world is isolated, etc. is stated.

original: de ltar 'jig rten dben pa ni stong pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten dben pa ni stong pa'o //
translated: Thus, the world is empty, being void.

original: de ltar rigs pa 'dis 'jig rten smos pa dang / shes bar mdzad pa dang / yang dag par ston pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa 'dis 'jig rten smos pa dang / shes bar mdzad pa dang / yang dag par ston pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: By this reasoning, the world is mentioned, understood, and perfectly taught, as before.

original: rgyu gang gis na 'jig rten rnam par dag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na 'jig rten rnam par dag pa yin zhe na /
translated: By what cause is the world purified?

original: 'dir 'jig rten gyi sgras 'jig rten gyi ming du bstan pa'i phyir de'i rnam par dag pa ni 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten gyi sgras 'jig rten gyi ming du bstan pa'i phyir de'i rnam par dag pa ni 'gog pa ste /
translated: Here, the word “world” is taught as a name for the world, and its purification is cessation.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten ni stong pa yin pas 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten pha rol 'di'i bye brag gzung du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten ni stong pa yin pas 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten pha rol 'di'i bye brag gzung du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, since the world is empty, this world and the other world are not apprehended as different,

original: mnyam pa mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are seen as the same.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi 'du shes 'gog pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten gyi 'du shes 'gog pa shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the cessation of the perception of the world.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise states:

original: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //
translated: In the way of knowing all aspects,

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
translated: it is explained as the characteristic of knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa ste /
translated: This is the engagement.

original: rnam pa thams gcad mkhyen pa nyid @136a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams gcad mkhyen pa nyid @136a * //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects

original: kyi shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kyi shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “the characteristics of consciousness” is the twelve aspects.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'jig rten ston pa ni 'jig rten ston pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi 'jig rten ston pa ni 'jig rten ston pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the world by the Tathāgatas in the perfection of wisdom is the teaching of the world.

original: de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u la de skad ces brjod do //🔽'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
analyzed: de gsal bar byed pa'i le'u la de skad ces brjod do // 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa'i dka' 'grel /
translated: The chapter that elucidates that is called by that name.🔽Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines Commentary

original: slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas rnam par sbyar ba snying po mchog ces bya ba las le'u bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: The twelfth chapter, called “The Supreme Essence,” from the commentary on the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines called Extracting the Essence.

original: // / shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid bshad nas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid bshad nas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: Having explained the characteristics of the nature of consciousness, the characteristics of its distinctions will now be described.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcos las /
translated: Therefore the treatise states:

original: bsam mi khyab sogs khyad par gyis //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab sogs khyad par gyis //
translated: Distinctive characteristics such as inconceivability,

original: khyad zhugs bden pa'i spyod yul can //
analyzed: khyad zhugs bden pa'i spyod yul can //
translated: Distinctive, with the domain of the truths,

original: skad cig ma ni bcu drug gis //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni bcu drug gis //
translated: In sixteen moments,

original: khyad par mtshan nyid bshad pa yin //
analyzed: khyad par mtshan nyid bshad pa yin //
translated: The characteristics of distinctions are explained.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i khyad par gyis de lam gzhan dag las khyad par du gyur pa bden pa bzhi'i yul can skad cig ma bcu drug gi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa'i mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i khyad par gyis de lam gzhan dag las khyad par du gyur pa bden pa bzhi'i yul can skad cig ma bcu drug gi khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bshad pa'i mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief teaching of the path of insight, which is distinguished by the sixteen moments of the four truths, and which is superior to other paths by the previously mentioned distinctions of the inconceivable, etc.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa yang gang zhe na //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa yang gang zhe na //
translated: What are the inconceivable, etc.?

original: bsam mi khyab dang mi mnyam dang // gzhal dang bgrang las yang dag 'das //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab dang mi mnyam dang // gzhal dang bgrang las yang dag 'das //
translated: The inconceivable, the unequalled, the immeasurable, and the incalculable,

original: 'phags pa kun sdud mkhas pa yis //
analyzed: 'phags pa kun sdud mkhas pa yis //
translated: the noble ones, the collection, the skill,

original: rig bya thun mong min shes nyid //
analyzed: rig bya thun mong min shes nyid //
translated: the object to be known, the uncommon knowledge,🔽the swift knowledge, the absence of decrease, the accomplishment, the perfect accomplishment,🔽the object with its basis, the totality, the complete possession,

original: shes myur bri dang gang med dang // sgrub dang yang dag 'grub pa dang // dmigs pa rten dang bcas pa dang // mtha' dag pa dang yongs 'dzin dang // ro myang med dang khyad par ni //
